She sells clothing and owns a store located in the market. The current loan will be used to purchase products (trousers, shirts and flip-flops) in order to stock up on merchandise for selling.
Teresa intends to acquire a freezer so she can store soft drinks and other beverages for re-selling. That way she'll expand her business and she'll be able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase products (trousers, shirts and flip-flops) in order to stock up on merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste tem 39 anos de idade, é casada e tem 4 filhos com idade escolar. O seu esposo é reporter de um jornal nacional e o seu horario de trabalho é das 07:00h as 15:30h. Eles sustentam também uma sobrinha que perdeu os seus pais e vive com eles.
Celeste é negociante e vende no quintal da sua casa. O emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de um fardo de roupas, cerveja, carne, ovos, refrescos e arroz, para reforcar o seu negocio.
  Celeste tem como esperanca fazer crescer o seu negocio e dar acompanhamento nos estudos dos seus filhos ate ao ensino superior. O seu maior desafio e de construir uma mercearia maior no quintal da sua casa, e tambem concluir a sua casa uma vez que ainda esta em obras para melhor confortar a sua familia.
texts.en:
Celeste is 39 years old. She's married and has four school-aged children. Her husband is a reporter for a national newspaper and works from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. They also support a niece who has lost her parents and lives with them.
Celeste is a merchant and makes her sales on the yard of her house. The loan will be used to purchase a bundle of clothing, beer, meat, eggs, refreshments and rice in order to boost her business.
Celeste's hope is to make her business grow and to oversee her children's studies until they go to college. Her biggest challenge is building a larger grocery store on her yard, and also finishing her house which is still under construction so her family will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothing, beer, meat, eggs, refreshments and rice in order to boost her business.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 18 años de edad, esta soltero. Aprendió el oficio de agricultor desde que era un niño su papá fue quien le enseño, ya que él nunca fue a la escuela siempre se dedico a la agricultura, porque es su única fuente de ingresos para subsistir. Él siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en una de las laderas muy empinadas lo cual hace que sus labores en el cultivo sean mas difíciles, ya que es muy duro el trabajo que se realiza a diario para  mantener el cultivo en muy buenas condiciones y así tener una mayor cosecha, sus fertilizantes los llevan en el lomo hasta donde se encuentra su milpa, ya que en vehículo no se puede llegar.

Para comprar los insumos aborda un autobús en su comunidad, en el cual viaja durante 20 minutos hasta la ciudad mas cercana. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 8 sacos de abono  para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de maicillo de verano, entre otros insumos para su cultivo. A él se le dificulta mucho salir a la ciudad a comprar sus insumos por poquitos, por lo que si se le aprueba el crédito comprara todo de un solo viaje, lo que le ahorrara tiempo y dinero. Al  tener todos sus insumos en casa,  podrá dar un manejo a tiempo a su milpa, lo que vendrá a incrementar su producción y sus ingresos, para pagar su crédito y alimentar a su familia.


 Planea trabajar duro y ahorrar dinero para comprar un despacito de tierra y hacer una casa para vivir con su familia, ya que actualmente viven en una casa de bahareque.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 18, is single.  He learned to work in agriculture since he was a boy; his father taught him.  He never went to school and has always worked in agriculture because that’s his only source of income to subsist.  He plants 14,000 square meters of corn on very steep hillsides which makes his work very much more difficult because the work he does daily to care for his crops to keep them in good condition and yield higher harvests is very hard.  He carries his fertilizer on his back all the way to his corn fields because they are inaccessible by vehicle.  To buy supplies he takes a bus from his community to the nearest city, a 20 minute trip.

The loan he’s asking for is to buy 8 sacks of manure among other farm supplies to plant 14,000 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of summer sorghum.  It’s very difficult for him to go to the city to buy small amounts of supplies so if the loan is approved he will be able to buy everything in one trip which will save time and money.  By having all the supplies at home, he will be able to provide his corn field with care in a timely fashion which will lead to increased production and income to repay his loan and to feed his family.  He plans to work hard and to save money to buy a small lot to build a house to live in with his family since they currently live in a house made of mud and twigs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ordoñez Jf Group

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas esta unido de hecho, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 2 hijos y no estan estudiando, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, inició este trabajo con su padre ayudandolo a cultivar sus tierras y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para hecharle a sus cosechas y asi cultivar mejor, en el futuro desea tener más terreno para poder cultivar en cantidad y asi obtener mejores ganancias; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Nicolás is in a common law relationship and is 31-years-old.  He never went to school.  He has two children who are not attending school.  He works growing corn and beans having started this work helping his father to till his soil and to date has ten years’ experience; his wife helps him.

He decides to organize a group to request a loan he’ll use to buy fertilizer to spread among his crops so they’ll grow better.  In future he wants to have more land to grow large amounts and earn higher profits.  The other group members work the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sandra Emperatríz

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y a la sastrería actividades que ha desarrollado durante varios años; las que fueron aprendidas de sus  padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos para prepararse para irse a la parcela que alquila donde pasa parte de la mañana, luego sus hijos se dirigen a la escuela y ella se dedica a la sastrería durante el resto del día

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres novillas que le vende un vecino a un precio bastante accesible. Con la compra de las novillas podrá repastar los animales y obtener un buen ingreso para el sustento de su familia,  en un futuro desea darles una educación universitaria a sus hijos y que lleguen hacer profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra, 40, is the mother of three children.  She’s a person who has been working in agriculture and tailoring, activities she’s developed for several years and that she learned from her parents.  She rises at 5am together with her children to get ready to head for the farmland she leases and where she spends the morning.  Then her children head to school and she spends the rest of the day tailoring.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three heifers a neighbor is selling her at a very affordable price.  With the purchase of the heifers she will be able to put the animals to pasture and earn good income to support her family.  In future, she’d like to provide her children with university education so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy three heifers.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Ines, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable, es viuda y vive en compañía de sus dos hijos de 22 y 28 años de edad respectivamente en la casa de su hijo mayor. Ines se dedica a la venta de pescado, el cual su hijo pesca en los lagos de la localidad. Esta venta lo realiza de manera ambulatoria a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad , lleva en está actividad un promedio de 15 años. Comenta que  su negocio es rentable  porque le ha generado muchas satisfacciones tanto personales  como económicas ya que con los ingresos ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar, así como comprarse enseres del hogar entre otros gustos, además comenta que con las buenas ganancias que le deja sobre todo en tiempos de escasez, tiene planeado ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer para así tener más ingresos. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles planea comprar de materiales para pescar como redes y anzuelos.
texts.en:
Inés, 55, is a hardworking, dedicated woman in addition to being cheerful and sociable.  She’s a widow living with her two children who are 22 and 28 years of age respectively in her oldest son’s house.  

Inés works selling fish he son fishes in local lakes.  She sells from place to place to merchants in her local market.  She’s been in this occupation for about 15 years.  She comments that it’s profitable because it’s given her many personal and economic satisfactions because income has allowed her to cover household expenses as well as to buy home appliances among other things.  She also comments that the good profits she earns have made it possible for her to survive times of scarcity.  She plans to expand the business and make it grow to earn higher income.

This will be her third Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to advance in business.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 1,300 soles to buy fishing supplies like nets and hooks.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies like nets and hooks.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: MARIA HILDA ES ORIGINARIA DE SAN MARTIN JILOTEPEQUE TIENE 34 AÑOS Y DESDE HACE APENAS 3 AÑOS QUE DECIDIO INICIAR UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION Y ANALIZANDO QUE EN SU ALDEA NO HABIA UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO. DECIDIO ABRIR UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO Y A DIOS GRACIAS LE HA IDO MUY BIEN, ELLA JUNTO A SU ESPOSO HAN SALIDOS ADELANTE CON SU HIJOS LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO Y ELLA TIENE EL DESEO DE QUE SUS HIJOS SIGAN ESTUDIANDO Y POR ESO APOYA A SU ESPOSO EN EL NEGOCIO. DOÑA HILDA ESCUCHO DE FAPE Y KIVA POR MEDIO DE UN AMIGO QUE LE COMENTO, YA QUE ELLA ESTA BUSCANDO QUIEN LA PUEDE AYUDAR A SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO, DOÑA HILDA NO TIENE CREDITOS EN NINGUNA INSTITUCION Y ESO LA AYUDARA ASER RESPONSABLE, SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA AGUAS GASEOSAS, JUGOS, AZUCAR, CONCENTRADO Y ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECECIDAD.
texts.en:
María Hilda is from San Martin Jilotepeque.  She’s 34-years-old and just three years ago decided to start a home-based business having noted that her village had no grocery store.  She decided to open a grocery store and thanks to God has done very well.  She and her husband are getting ahead with their children who are attending school.  She hopes they will continue in school and this is why she helps her husband with the business.

Hilda heard of Fape and Kiva from a friend who commented to her since she’s looking for help to better stock her store.  Hilda has no loans with any other institution and that helps her to be responsible.  She requests the loan to buy soft-drinks, juices, sugar, concentrate and basic staple items.

loans.use: to buy food items for her store.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, de 22 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y empeñoso, está casado con Xiomi quien trabaja como cajera en una tienda, vive en compañía de su familia en la casa de su abuelita. Milton desea abrir su puesto de comidas en el frontis de la casa de su abuelita para eso cuenta con una mesa y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que viendo que  su zona es transitada considera que tiene demanda y notando la necesidad económica que tiene en su hogar ha decidido abrir este negocio, en el futuro espera tener un restaurante y contar con personas necesarias para este negocio. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles comprará tablas de madera para empezar a construir un espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Milton, 22, is a young, enterprising man.  He’s married to Xiomi who works as a cashier in a store.  He lives with his family in his grandmother’s house.  Milton wants to open a food stand in front of his grandmother’s house.  To do so he has a table and utensils needed to provide very good customer service.  Noticing that his zone has many passersby he believes demand will be there and noticing the economic need at home he decided to open this business.  In future, he hopes to have a restaurant and to hire the necessary people for this business.

This will be his second Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to move forward.  Also, he commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the requested 500 new soles to buy wood boards to start building his food stand.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Né vers 1966 à Koloni/Foulala- Kolondièba (Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali), LASSINA réside à Kolondièba ville avec ses 4 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Monsieur LASSINA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  produits divers (tapis, parfums, des chaises etc.) depuis plus de vingt ans.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
Lassina pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso  et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
LASSINA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 tapis, 5 cartons d’eau minérales, des cartons de différentes sortes de parfums et une dizaine de chaises. Il s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à Kolondièba ville. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit dans boutique à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
LASSINA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Koloni/Foulala-Kolondièba (town in the 3rd administrative region of Mali), LASSINA lives in the city of Kolondièba with his wife and four children in a traditional family. 

Monsieur LASSINA quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, and has been buying and selling various products (rugs, perfumes, chairs, etc.) for 20 years. He is well-liked and sought after in the market and especially on market day. 

In order to grow his business and satisfy his ever-growing clientele, LASSINA is working with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second loan after having reimbursed his previous loan.

LASSINA wants to use his loan to buy two rugs, five boxes of water bottles, boxes of various types of perfumes, and a dozen chairs. He buys his supplies from the wholesalers in the city of Kolondièba. He sells for cash, at retail, and occasionally on credit to a clientele of both men and women. 

LASSINA would like to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which he'll use to meet the needs of his family, reimburse his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various items.

loans.name: Cardona Group

texts.es:
El señor Isidro esta unido de hecho con su señora esposa, cuenta con 31 años de edad, curso 4 años de educación primaria, por el momento solo tiene 1 hijo, él se dedica a actividades agrícolas, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol, obtuvo la experiencia ayundando a su padre que desde siempre se ha dedicado a cuiltivar la tierra, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años trabajando independiente.

El decide formar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante e incecticidas para su cosecha de maíz y frijol, en el futuro tiene la esperanza de sembrar mas cuerdas de maíz y frijol y esto lo logrará si le conceden el préstamo; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a cultivar la tierra.
texts.en:
Isidro is in a common law relationship with his wife.  He’s 31-years-old and completed four years of primary education.  At the moment he only has one son.  He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He acquired the experience helping his father who has always worked the land.  To date, he has been working independently for ten years.

He decides to form a group to request a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his corn and bean crops.  In future, he hopes to plant more cord of corn and beans and he’ll do so if the loan is granted.  The other group members work the land too.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Sonia es una  señora que vive en la ciudad de Estelí desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al negocio de pulpería y la venta de cosméticos ella desde que recibió el primer crédito su vida mejoro en gran manera pudo invertir en la pulpería y la venta  de cosméticos este nuevo préstamo  lo está solicitando para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y cosméticos sus hijas que ya están grandes la apoyan en la distribución de sus productos tiene buenos clientes fieles. Ella dice que sus clientes no la cambian ya que da buenos precios vende lo mejor.
 Sus planes futuros son tener un negocio grande que impacte en su sector,  sus metas próximas son aumentar su inventario y tener los productos que sus clientes le están solicitando .
texts.en: Sonia’s a lady living in the city of Estelí for a long time; she works as a grocer and selling cosmetics.  Since she got her first loan her life improved quite a bit; she was able to invest in her grocery store and in selling cosmetics.  She’s asking for this new loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and cosmetics.  Now that her daughters are older they help her distribute her goods and she has good regular customers.  She says that her customers don’t change because her prices are good and she sells the best.  Her future plan is to have a bigger business that impacts her sector and her near-term goals are to increase inventory and to have the products her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cynthia Consuelo

texts.es:
Cynthia es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Cynthia no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Cynthia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, riego, cosecha y otros, Cynthia trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Cynthia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un carrito sanguchero, el cual utilizará para poder vender frituras como hamburguesas, salchipapas, pollo broaster y otros, de esta manera Cynthia podrá contar con un poco mas de ingresos, los cuales ahorrará para poder lograr su gran sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cynthia, 22, is single living in the city of Ica, Parcona District, with her parents and siblings.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person with a strong drive towards self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start work, Cynthia hasn’t been able to study Business Administration like she’d like to.  In her free time she enjoys relaxing listening to music and on occasion cooks a delicious pork stew with noodles to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Cynthia works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in her city; she does planting, irrigation, harvesting and other chores.  She works every day for about 10 hours and thinks she does well because of the good way she works and the kind way she treats others.

Cynthia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a fast-food cart that she’ll use to sell fast-food like hamburgers, ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes], Broaster-style chicken and others in order to have a bit more income to rely on that she’ll save up to reach her dream of owning a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy  food cart.

loans.name: El Milagro De Santa Ana Group

texts.en:
The women of this group call themselves "Milagro de Sta. Ana". Most of the women live in Santa Ana, a very small village on the outskirts of Antigua Guatemala. All of their businesses have been verified by business advisors, who believe that each woman stands to benefit from the support offered by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya.  In addition to a loan, Namaste provides coaching from business advisors who develop a detailed understanding of the borrowers business (see below an example of how much detail they have on their clients).  

Each of the women in this group are hard-working entrepreneurial ladies that dream of growing and bettering their businesses. Most of them are involved in the production and selling of food. For example, one of them promotes her business on Facebook and provides updates on the new products she will sell in the near future. There is also a woman who sells corn meal (the only one in the area) and another who sells products by catalog. 

Carmen Lucrecia (2nd from left to right) is a 48 year-old single mom who went to school through 9th grade. She has two daughters, one that is already married who contributes Q400 ($53)  per month to the household income and a younger daughter that still lives with her. Her younger daughter also has a daughter and Carmen Lucrecia pays for her school. Carmen Lucrecia has been selling food at the park of Santa Ana for the last 12 years and has become famous for her garlic bread, a product she introduced long ago to differentiate herself from the competition. She calls her big delicious bread “Neco” and this is the main attraction for her customers. She will share this business with her daughters so they have a place to work and support their families as well. 

Her dream is to learn how to manage her income, separate her profit from her personal expenses and be able to save enough money to open a new place to sell food in the village of Jocotenango. Currently she has a profit of Q986 (US$130) and works 240 hours (US$0.54/hour) per month. Her plan for the next 9 months is to increase her profit to Q1,665 (US$220). She knows that with the support of Namaste she will learn how to calculate and better manage her profit so she can open an additional location to sell her food.

loans.use: to save money to open a new location

loans.name: Mujeres Productivas Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Productivas group is located in Canton Siglo II of municipality Santa Cruz Mulua, in the department of Retalhuleu, Guatemala. 

The group is composed of six hard working women who have know each other for many years. They all are involved in the buying/selling or production/selling of food. In the early educational sessions provided by Fundacion Namaste Guatemaya prior to getting a loan, the group has demonstrated that they are motivated and very interested in learning how to keep control of their expenses and sales. The group also mentioned that previously nobody has taught them how to improve their business. Therefore they are eager to receive Namaste's Business Adviser monthly visit to quantify their business metrics and help improve their profits. 

Lilian is 40 years old, a widow and is raising two kids who are under 15 years-old and are going to school (in the picture, you can see her 4th from left). Lilian does not know how to read and write and is living far away from her family. While she was living with her husband and raising their family, he suddenly fell ill and ultimately passed from an unknown illness.  They exhausted their savings on medical bills and were forced to sell all of their appliances to pay doctors and hospital bills. Widowed and broke with two kids to raise, Lilian moved to a place where she pays no rent and gets electricity from the owner. She started selling tortillas [corn flatbread] door to door and now she has a place to make them and sell them too. Until now, she has been producing the tortillas for lunch and dinner. 

Her dream is to be able to have enough money to buy wood and corn in bulk because it is cheaper and now with the rainy season, dry wood is very difficult to find. With these supplies, she will be able to start producing tortillas for breakfast to meet her clients requests. She wants to learn how to manage her money and separate and save it in a way that she can start purchasing all of the appliances she was forced to sell when her husband got sick. 

Her actual monthly profit is Q1,740 (US$228) and she works 170 hours per month (US$1.35 profit per hour). Her business plan is to increase her profit by 40% by adding an additional selling time and by purchasing dry wood and corn in bulk.

loans.use: buy corn buy bulk and dry wood to improve her production/selling hours

location.town: Canton El Siglo II, Santa Cruz Mulua, Retalhuleu

loans.name: María Alba

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad, la menor  estudia en el colegio y el mayor esta por ingresar a la universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María además de ser una  gran madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo en especial la ropa de niños. Ella también le da parte del crédito a su marido para que este lo utilice en su negocio, él es comerciante de frutas y legumbres en Portoviejo, ciudad que recorre en un triciclo de cuatro a cinco días a la semana. Ella mientras tanto también recorre su localidad ofreciendo sus prendas.  Lleva más de 6 años dedicada a esta actividad mientras que su esposo desde muy joven.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, frutas y legumbres. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener buena salud y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (With Love and Faith Towards Development) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city noted for its cultural riches and its crafts like the straw hats that are known both inside and outside the country.

Maria, 49, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 17 and 14 years of age.  The younger attends high school and the older is about to start university.   Her husband is a merchant.

Aside from being a great mother and housewife, María is a merchant.  She sells all types of clothes, especially children’s clothes.  She also will give part of the loan to her husband so he can use in his business; he sells fruit and vegetables in Portoviejo, a city he travels around on a tricycle four to five days a week while she also goes around her location selling her clothes.  She’s been in this activity for more than six years while her husband has been in his since he was very young.

She will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, fruit and vegetables.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goals are to be in good health and that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Tungamiai Justine

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 31 year old Justine from Bulawayo.  He is married and has two children.  The eldest child is attending primary school. 

Tungamirai Justine runs a retail business selling electrical goods.  The business has been in operation for over 8 years.  He says the main challenges faced are high import duty costs and competition form larger retailers who offer credit facilities over longer repayment periods.  Justine has requested a loan of $500 to stock and fulfill his outstanding orders.  He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to supplement their household income, as well as other expenses and boost business capacity.  In the future Tungamirai Justine plans to have his own electrical gadgets shop selling a variety of goods within the CBD.  He also intends to diversify into the clothing business.

loans.use: to order stocks of radios, TVs, cable connectors, irons, satelite dish kits, speakers, invertors for resale. The goods are bought in neighbouring countries and are sold at a profit back home, prices range from $50 to $300, and profit margins are as much as up to 100%

loans.name: Marjorie Katherine

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 3 años y el menor de 8 meses de edad. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Marjorie es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días de la semana en las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que su mamá les cuida a sus hijos. Ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita, lleva dos años dedicada al comercio y le ha ido bien con sus ventas.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras prendas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque es muy fácil conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (With Love and Faith Towards Development) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city noted for its cultural riches and its crafts like the straw hats that are known both inside and outside the country.

Marjorie, 19, lives here.  She’s married and has two children; one is three-years-old and the younger one is 8-months-old.  Her husband’s a driver.

Marjorie is a very good wife who in order to help her husband cover household expenses works selling all types of clothes.  She sells door to door and also based on orders placed by her customers.  She works three days a week in the morning because her mother can care for her children at this time.  She sells on credit and collects every weekend.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to and has been in business two years; her sales have been very good.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses and t-shirts, among other articles of clothing.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and likes it because it’s easy to get loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Liliana Annabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Liliana, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 8 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Liliana es una muy buena madre y esposa que día a día lucha incansablemente para darles lo mejora a sus hijos, ella administrar el bar en una escuela y colegio de la localidad,  trabaja casi todo el día de lunes a viernes ya que ella en las tardes y noches prepara algunos alimentos para vender en el bar al día siguiente, prepara corviches, empanadas, hot dog, sanduches, además de jugos de fruta que son del agrado de sus clientes,  lleva más de 7 años dedicada a este negocio. Ella también en su casa vende filtros y lubricantes para carros, con lo cual se gana algo extra.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos, lubricantes y filtros de carros. Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (With Love and Faith Towards Development) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city noted for its cultural riches and its crafts like the straw hats that are known both inside and outside the country.

Liliana, 30, lives here.  She’s married and has three children aged 13, 8 and 6.  The oldest attends secondary school and the others attend primary school.  Her husband is a driver.

Liliana is a very good mother and wife who strives tirelessly to give the best to her children.  She runs a snack bar at a local school and high school.  She works almost all day from Monday through Friday because in the afternoon and evening she prepares the food to sell the next day.  She makes ‘corviches’ [bananas stuffed with fish and other ingredients], turnovers, hot-dogs, sandwiches and also sells fruit juices that delight her customers.  She’s been in this business for 7 years.  She also sells car filters and lubricants to earn a bit of extra income.

This loan is to buy the food ingredients needed to make her dishes and to buy car lubricants and filters.  She’s been in the communal bank almost since the beginning and she likes it because of the help they give with the loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy food items and lubricants and filters for cars.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 43 year old married woman who is running a business of milk sales with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Kousar's husband.  She has two cows and two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors.  She also makes butter and cheese with this milk to generate extra revenue.  She looks after the cows and buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. They feel pleasure while doing this business to secure their children’s future.  

She has four children; three of them are going to school.  She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education.  In order to make more profits, she requested a loan of RS 25,000/- to purchase another buffalo.  She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 43 year old married woman.  She is been doing stitching work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Shamim was not earning income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. 

Her husband’s income is too nominal to bear the daily expenses of the family members.  Over the time she has established a good clientele and has improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  Currently she applied for her fifth loan of RS. 40,000 to purchase spools of thread in various colors along with packs of elastic, buttons and needles.  Shamim wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread in various colors with the packs of elastic, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Tetee

texts.en:
Tetee is a 43 year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children between 25 and 18. Only one is currently attending school and lives at home.  Tetee was unable to attends school. She describes herself as hard working woman.

Tetee lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Tetee has a table business which sells fresh fish for the past seven years. She works from 7am to 6pm each day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. She started her business by selling for her mother. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Kullah

texts.en:
Kullah is a 26 year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has three children, between the ages of 1 and 10. Only two are currently attending school and they all live at home. Kullah completed grade 7 before starting her business. She describes herself as hard working woman.

Kullah lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Kullah has a table business where she has been selling fresh fish for the past three years.  She works from 8am to 4pm per day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more fresh fish. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house.
  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with two school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past years. She sells the fruits and vegetables from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial supports to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 43-year-old married woman.  She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching.  She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community.  She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of children. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  She has now requested a loan of RS. 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.  In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand more consistently.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Bashiran hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and high quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Farwa

texts.en:
Farwa is a 33 year old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past three years.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  

For this reason she requested a loan of RS 25,000 to Kashf Foundation.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate larger source of income.  She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Self Help Group

texts.en:
Radhakrushna Self Help Group is a women's self-help group with ten members. The members reside in the village of Jajpur in Odisha, India. The lady standing fifth from the left-hand side in the photograph is Pramila. Pramila is the president of the group. 

Pramila, 34, and her husband Kapila, 35, have two children who are currently in school. For the past ten years, this husband and wife have worked as a team selling fresh vegetables in the market. Pramila grew vegetables on her few acres of land, and her husband assists her in doing so. She cultivates brinjals (eggplant), gourds, lady fingers (okra), tomatoes, onions, etc. 

She hopes to get a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and a few tools for cultivation. With the ability to grow and sell more vegetables, she hopes to increase their profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and a few tools for cultivation.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 37 year-old married woman and a mother of five.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000/- in order to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons in order to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 72 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes, solo uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo ya casi no trabaja ya que está enfermo.

Doña Rosa  tiene una tienda en su casa  en la cual vende de todo un poco desde productos como arroz, azúcar, granos, detergentes, legumbres, carne, pescado, pollo entre otros productos de primera necesidad, además también hace poco empezó con la ventas de cilindros de gas y  le está yendo muy bien ya que no hay muchos lugares donde se puedan comprar este producto tan necesario en los hogares de los ecuatorianos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva más de 30 años con su negocio y le va muy bien, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan atender su negocio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en comprar víveres para abastecer su tienda y gas de uso domestico. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (Towards Development With Love and Faith) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and for its handicrafts such as the straw hats that are known inside and outside of the country.

Rosa lives here.  She is 72 years old, married and from that relationship she has six adult children who are independent; only one of them still lives with her.  Her husband hardly works due to illness.

Rosa has a store in her home in which she sells a little bit of everything such as products like rice, sugar, grains, detergents, vegetables, meat, fish and chicken among other products that are basic staples.  Besides that she also began selling cylinders of gas a little while ago and it is going very well for her since there aren’t many places where one can buy this product that is so necessary in the households of Ecuadorians.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm.  She has been in business more than 30 years and it is going very well for her.  Her son and her husband help her attend to the business. 

She is going to invest this new loan in the purchase of provisions to supply her store and gas for domestic use.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it for the help that the loans provide her.  

Her dream is to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and gas for domestic use.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 37-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store with her husband who assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market at wholesale rates. Over time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her five children. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 in order to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. Kosar expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Surya

texts.en: For about 12 years, Surya, age 35, has dealt in the business of milk sales.  She has two buffaloes who give milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She is happily doing it to support her family as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone.  She has four daughters and two sons, four of them are school going. In order to increase her sales, she needs to buy one more buffalo to carter to more customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 45000 from Kiva partner the Kashf foundation.  She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Kubra is a 41-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery work. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes enough to provide for her family. She has five children. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery she needs to buy frames, needles and threads in different colors, packs of sequins and glittering material. That is why she applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kiva partner the Kashf foundation.  It will help her to complete the orders of her customers without fail. She wishes to spend part of her profits on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy frames, needles and threads in different colors, packs of sequins and glittering material.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Mataji is a 55-year-old lady. She is staying in Odisha with her husband and her only child, who is is doing a job in a private company. Her husband is a farmer. 

For the past six years, she has been engaged in the activity of selling cow milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. Mataji is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Maa Mangala Self Help Group (SHG). There are ten members in the group, and all are women. 

The members of the group are involved in different kind of activities like agriculture, and some have grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 220,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. 

Mataji has a dream to provide a better living to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Laxmi Self Help Group consists of 11 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among them. 

One of them is Mamata, who was selected as the President of Maa Laxmi Self Help Group. The lady standing third from the right-hand side in the photo is Mamata. 

Mamata is 37 years old and is staying with her husband and her only child. Her child is in schooling. She hopes to see him as an officer in a company. She has a few acres of land in her village, and she is utilizing her land in sugarcane cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. 

She has requested a loan of 132,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angélica es una señora emprendedora con alto espíritu de superación, dedicada al negocio de tortillas desde hace cinco años, con el cual sostiene sus gastos y el de sus hijos, vive en la ciudad de Estelí  su perspectiva es seguir ampliando y mejorando las condiciones de su negocio ya que este es su única fuente de ingresos. Sus labores comienzan desde tempranas horas de la madrugada cuando sale al molino a moler el maíz y luego regresa a casa a encender su cocina de leña para comenzar a elaborar  las tortillas, esta actividad es diaria. Ella le vende a pulperías, comiderias y la misma población que la buscan para comprarle.
Ella está solicitando el crédito  para comprar leña y maíz que es la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar sus sabrosas tortillas.
texts.en:
Angélica is an enterprising woman with a great will to improve.  For five years she has had a tortilla business with which she pays for her expenses and those of her children.  She lives in the city of Estelí.  Her outlook is to continue expanding and improving the conditions of her business because it is her only source of income.

Her work begins at the very early hours of the morning when she goes to the mill to grind the corn.  She then returns home to start the wood stove in order to begin making the tortillas.  She does this business activity every day.  She sells to grocery stores, to eateries, and to people who seek her out to buy her tortillas.

She is requesting the loan to buy firewood and corn.  This is the raw material that she uses to make her delicious tortillas.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 51 years-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for the past four years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en:
Roqia had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to initiate her own business to support her husband financially in meeting their household expenses. Therefore, many years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time she has retained many customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

However, due to a lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kiva partner Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloth, threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers in order to create the means to increase revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene  41 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en el colegio. Ella vive en la casa de su mamá. 

Doña Carmen se dedica a muchas actividades ya que además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también es auxiliar de enfermería y realiza este trabajo en un centro médico de esta ciudad, ella también vende cosméticos y es Artesana, elabora sombreros de paja toquilla en sus ratos libres los mismos que una vez hechos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a otros lugares. Lleva más de 14 años realizando esta actividad que la lo aprendió de su mamá.

Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos y paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros. Lleva más de 8 años  en el Banco Comunal.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Con amor y fe hacia el desarrollo" (with love and faith towards development) meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its cultural richness and for its artisanal crafts, for example, straw hats that are well known within the country and abroad as well. 

It is here that Mrs. Carmen lives. She is 41 years old, a single mother of 2 children who are 16 and 14 and go to high school. She lives in her mother's house. 

Mrs. Carmen is involved in many different economic activities, as well as being head of household, and she is also a nurse's aid and she works in a medical center in the city. She also sells cosmetics and is an artisan, making straw hats in her free time and, once they are made, she sells them to vendors who come all the way to her house in order to re-sell them in different locations. She has been doing this for more than 14 years, it is a craft that she learned from her mother. 

This credit is to purchase cosmetics and straw in order to make hats. She has been a member of this communal bank for 8 years. 

Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics and straw to make hats.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha es una persona que quiere salir adelante e instruirse, es por eso que esta estudiando y luchando por ser una buena profesional. Este siguiendo la carrera de Informática, y cuenta que se dedica mucho a sus estudios para poder ser una buena profesional el día de mañana.
Su meta es poder ayudar a su familia y retribuirles todo lo que ellos dieron por ella. Quienes la inspiran son sus 2 hijos, ya que quiere sacarlos adelante. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar cuotas y clases de su universidad, este crédito le será de mucha ayuda y es una gran oportunidad.
texts.en: Mirtha is a person who wants to succeed and to get an education, and so, she is studying and fighting to be a good professional. She is studying a major in computer science and she tells us that she is very dedicated to her studies so she can be a professional one day. Her goal is to be able to help her family and give back all that they have done for her. She gets her inspiration from her 2 children, because she wants to give them a better life. She is asking for this credit to be able to invest it in paying her university inscription costs and tuition for classes at her university. The credit will help her a lot and this is a great opportunity for her.

loans.use: pay for her university inscription and tuition fees.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal es un joven con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, quiere ser un gran profesional es por eso que dedica mucho. El esta estudiando la carrera de Derecho, y cuenta que desea convertirse en un gran abogado que ayude a las personas de necesiten de el.
Cuenta que dentro de algunos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión, y afrontando grandes casos gracias a sus estudios. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y cuotas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Anibal is a youth who has a strong desire to make progress and get ahead.  He wants to be a great professional, and he is very devoted to this quest.  He is studying for a law degree, and he tells us that he wants to become a great lawyer who helps people in need.  He says that in a few years he will be practicing his profession and dealing with big cases, thanks to his education.  He is requesting this loan to invest in paying his tuition and fees.  This loan will be a great help to him, and he is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una joven muy emprendedora, que esta estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, se dedica mucho en sus estudios, y trata siempre de poder sobresalir en todo lo que hace. Ella desea que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ayudar a su familia por medio de su profesión.
Hoy esta solicitando este crédito para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que eso es muy costoso y este crédito le será de mucha ayuda. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad, ya que podrá cumplir así su sueño tan anhelado de ser una licenciada.
texts.en:
Lourdes is from the city of Pilar.  She is a very enterprising youth who is studying for a degree in business administration.  She is very devoted to her studies, and always tries to excel in everything she does.  In the near future, she wants to be able to help her family through her profession.

At this time, she is requesting a loan to pay for tuition and fees so that she can finish her degree requirements, because this is very costly.  This loan will be a great help to her.  She is very grateful for this opportunity, because she will be able to make her most cherished dream a reality: to become a college graduate.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees to complete her degree requirements

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una estudiante muy sacrificada, esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería en una buena universidad, esta luchando por ser una buena profesional que pueda asistir a las demás personas en su salud. Cuenta que desde siempre su sueño ha sido poder ayudar a las demás personas, es por eso que esta poniendo todo de si misma.
Esta solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de útiles para sus estudios  y también para poder pagar sus clases. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad de estudio que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a very self-sacrificing student who is studying for a degree in nursing from a good university.  She is striving to become a good professional who can help other people with their health.  She says that she has always dreamed of helping other people, and this is why she is putting everything she has into this endeavor.  

Marcelina is requesting a loan to invest in school supplies and also to pay for her classes.  She is very grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to further her education.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies and to pay for her classes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for his education

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en:
Ms. Azzaya is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in an apartment in the Dornogovi province of Mongolia. Her husband Amarsanaa is 31 years old and studies in South Korea for his Master's; her daughter Anudari is 7 years old and studies at a local primary school. 

Azzaya has been working at a beauty salon since 2010. She has built close relationships with her clients over the years and has started her own business of beauty service in a rental place in the local market.  She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase equipment and tools to provide full service to her clients. She is a hardworking, strong, and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to provide full service to her clients.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando esta cursando el primer año de la carrera de Lic. en Ciencias Sociales, le atrae esta carrera por que según el esta materia enfoca su estudio en el hombre y la cultura misma. Para el trabajar es la única fuente de obtener un ingreso y de esta manera cubrir sus gastos, siendo independiente de sus padres. Se esta esforzando por crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en los útiles de la universidad y también para poder pagar cuotas. Cuenta que con esta ayuda podrá aligerar su carga y seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que el esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Fernando is in his first year studying Social Sciences. This major attracts him because according to him the subject focuses his study on humans and culture. For him working is the only way to make an income and cover his expenses, independent from his parents. He is striving to grow and get ahead. 

He is asking for this loan to invest in college supplies and also to pay for tuition. He says that with this help he will be able to lighten his load and keep studying. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy supplies for college and to pay tuition.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and borders Tanzania to the south. Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food: wild mangrove forests and local passion fruit plantations. Beekeeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Beth is married and has three children. Both she and her husband farm, and they are currently growing mangoes and coconut on their land. She is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper for two main reasons: she wants a reliable source of honey for medicinal use, and she is also excited about the opportunity to learn about bees. 

This is Beth’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a tree nursery. In the future, Beth hopes to save up enough money to increase her apiary to house 20 beehives.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus lives outside of Masifini, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Nicodemus is married and has two children. Both he and his wife have been farming for nine years, and are currently tending to an orange orchard on their land. He is excited to start beekeeping with Honey Care because it is “an opportunity to start a honey enterprise.” 

This is Nicodemus’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to improve the security on his farm. In the future, Nicodemus hopes to save up enough money to establish a commercial-size apiary for honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel lives outside of Masifini, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Rachel is married and has two children. Unlike most of Honey Care's borrowers who were born in Kenya, Rachel is a Tanzanian citizen. Both her and her husband have been farming for nine years and are currently tending to an orange orchard on their land. Rachel is excited to start beekeeping because having another source of income will be helpful to take care of household expenses. 

This is Rachel’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to build a family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Anik has been involved in agriculture for 16 years. She raised her two sons alone and has worked really hard to sustain them. Her farm currently includes 40 chickens, and in the orchard she owns, different types of trees grow such as apricot, cherry, nut, and apple.  Anik sells the gathered harvest locally and earns income, which is very important for sustaining the family.

With the requested loan, Anik plans to purchase 6 oxen and more chickens. She wants to fatten the oxen, and then sell them for a better price. The loan is very important to Anik in order to expand the agricultural business and ensure better living conditions for herself and her sons.

loans.use: to pay for 6 oxen and more chickens.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 44 years of age. He is married and has three children ages two, six and nine years. Among the three children, two go to school. 

Nathan is involved in tea trading, which he solely depends on for his family's survival. Nathan started the tea business in 2006 so as to have a stable source of income. With the loan, 600,000 Ugandan shillings that was extended to him previously, progression can already be seen. With the loan he will buy organic fertilizers to spread in his tea plantation for improved yields. 

Nathan's clientele are mainly the local people in his village in the area of Kaasa, who say he has come a long way given the obstacles in the business which include competition. With his shrewdness and dedication, it is possible he will take care of his family and be able to send his children to good schools.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has three children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated that milking is most enjoyable about farming. His biggest challenge is not enough animal feed. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Serou."

Festus was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Favorable interest rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and he responded, "Has loans."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Festus replied "More income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Festus owns a cow but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives outside of Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Jacob is married and has three children. He and his wife have been farming for fifteen years, and are currently growing oranges and peppers on their land. Jacob is excited to become a beekeeper because his bees will pollinate his oranges and green peppers, leading to higher quality produce and higher yields come harvest time. 

This is Jacob’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to build a gate to his farm. In the future, he hopes to continue to expand security measures around his homestead “to have a protected farm.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 47 years old, and she lives alone in the small city of Ijevan. Alvard has her own business. For several years, Alvard lived in the Russian Federation, where she was engaged in retail trading. After earning enough money, she returned to her motherland and started her own business. At first it was a small food kiosk, and after the passing of time, she managed to buy a plot of land and to build her own shop. Her shop is very comfortable, clean, and not very expensive; it is much-visited daily.  In her shop, she sells candies, baked goods, dairy products, and some household products. 

Alvard has two grown-up children; both her daughter and son are married and live separately with their families. This is Alvard’s third loan from Kiva and she has already taken out five loans from Nor Horizon. Alvard hopes very much that she will be supported by Kiva lenders again, since she needs 1,500 US dollars to buy a lot of food and household products for her shop.

loans.use: to buy a lot of food and household products for her shop.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 53 years old, and she lives in Sevan. Hasmik is married, and has a daughter who is married and lives separately with her family. Hasmik’s husband has a truck used for paid shipping around their city. For many years, Hasmik has worked as a librarian in their city library, but their family needs have made her be involved in clothing retail and trading. 

Hasmik has rented a small stall not very far from the city center, and there she sells baby and teen clothes, towels, shoes, slippers, and trunks. Hasmik mainly brings all the products needed for her stall from Yerevan wholesale markets. Hasmik’s husband helps her very much since his truck is very convenient for bringing a lot products from Yerevan, and she doesn't need to pay for transportation. 

Hasmik wants to expand the product range in her stall, and she asks for a loan of 850,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of summer and winter season baby clothes, teen clothes, and warm winter boots. She hopes very much that support from Kiva lenders will bring a decent profit.

loans.use: to buy a lot of summer and winter season baby clothes, teen clothes, and warm winter boots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is an attractive young farmer. He learned how to farm when he was little boy, and now when the family's father works abroad and financially supports the family, Gagik is the head of the family. 

Gagik lives with his mother (in the photo) and 80-year-old grandmother (in the photo). 

Gagik breeds cattle. His livestock currently includes chickens, pigs, seven cows and 13 calves. Unfortunately, the income that Gagik's father sends from abroad is hardly enough for covering even the minimal costs of the family. So, in order to tackle the financial hardship, Gagik sells the gathered milk and meat produced and gets income.

Realizing that agriculture is very important for family, Gagik wants to expand his farm. By requesting this loan, Gagik wants to purchase six calves. This will enable him to fatten them and then sell with higher prices.

The loan is very important for Gagik to be able to increase agricultural income and provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for six calves.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a second time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance applying for 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She is a single mother who lives in the outskirts of the city with her three children. She has managed to look after them using the income she earns from her small business of selling foodstuffs and drinks that she operates in the neighborhood of her home. 

She supplements the income from the business with income from poultry that she does on a small scale. She is faced with a problem of limited capital that has always made her make fewer sales, thus leading to failure to meet some of her family's needs.

She applied for the loan to buy poultry feeds so that she can begin selling the chicken and therefore, receive income to support her family.

She has future hopes of educating her children through good schools and making sure they at least attain master's degrees.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Jahir

texts.en:
Jahir, 35, is married and the father of one daughter. His wife is currently a housewife and stay-at-home mother. Together they live in the southern part of Kosovo. 

For the last six years, Jahir has made a living by owning a café. Because Jahir is very responsible and hardworking, his business is popular in his area and is often full of customers since local unemployed people have free time to spend sitting at his café drinking coffee, tea and other beverages.

This is the first time that Jahir is asking for a loan. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy a new coffee machine for his business, which he hopes will improve his profit and generate more income. In the future, Jahir hopes to expand his business so that he can save money for his family’s future. He really appreciates the help from everyone and would like to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a coffee machine.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine, since she married has been engaged in farming and agriculture, and it is the main source of income for her family. She has a piece of land on which she cultivates potatoes and sells them to resellers. Her farm cattle is various but not many; four cows, two bulls, two heifers, three piglets, eight sheep, five lambs and 25 chickens. All the works connected with agriculture and taking care of farm animals, Armine does alone, since her two children are too small to help her, and her husband is in Russian Federation doing work abroad. 

Armine also has another work, but it is seasonal. She works as a cleaner at the rest house. She does her best to provide her children with good living conditions, and she also wants to enlarge her farm cattle. She asks a loan of 750.000 Armenian drams to buy a cow, two piglets and animal fodder for coming winter months.

loans.use: To buy a cow, two piglets and animal fodder for the coming winter months.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is married with 6 children aged 22, 20, 16, 10, 6 and 2. Five of his children attend school, and Sam also takes care of one other dependant at home. Sam is a farmer mainly growing and rearing animals. He operates a coffee seed bed where he gets some money by selling the coffee plants to other farmers.

Sam was given a loan of Ugx.1,000,000 to pay school fees for his daughter last term and this helped her to sit for the examinations of that term. Now Sam has applied for a loan of Ugx.1,300,000 to pay school fees for his daughter this term.

Sam's dream is to see his daughter complete the nursing course and maybe help him and the family in future after getting a job. However, this has always been a challenge for him because of the limited funds to pay fees. But he believes if Ugafode gives him a hand, he will be in a position to achieve his dream. In the photo is the client (right) and the Ugafode credit officer (left)

loans.use: To pay tuition for his daughter

loans.name: Hatigje

texts.en:
Hatigje is 30 years old, married and has two children. Her children are 8 and 11 years old. She is a housewife and a stay at home mother, caring for her children while her husband works transporting various goods for other people in the area. They live in a Roma community under very poor living conditions. 

As their house is very old, some basic things such as the bathroom are in desperate need of repair. Unfortunately they have not been able to manage to address this issue for the last few years. However, she is now asking for a loan to renovate their bathroom to help them to improve the living conditions of her family. Hatigje hopes in the future to be able to provide a better life for her children. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders and appreciates them all for their support!

loans.use: To renovate her bathroom

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
