El grupo llamado San José está en su ciclo número  2 del programa ellas son personas muy sacrificadas que están luchando por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Vilma es una de las integrantes, es ama de casa pero con su crédito quiere incursionar en la venta de comestibles. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo pueda abrirse camino y mejorar su vida.
Solicita su crédito para la compra de una freidora para pode agilizarle el trabajo en su nuevo emprendimiento. . Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The "San José" group is on its second loan cycle.  The members - all women - of this group are self-sacrificing and are fighting to get ahead and to help their families.

Vilma is one member of the group.  She is a housewife but, with this loan, she would like to start a business selling hot food.  Vilma hopes you will endorse her plan so that, with time, she can start on a new path and improve her life.

Vilma is applying for this loan in order to buy a fryer to be able to work more quickly with her new business.  With it, she will be able to continue to grow with her business and to give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy a fryer for a new business.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Чахонгир молодой человек в возрасте 28 лет. Он с женой и с ребенком проживает в городе Вахдат, в 20 км к юго-востоку от столицы. У него среднее образование. Чахонгир последние 5 лет зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь услугой такси. Он развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии своего города. Прибыль с деятельности является единственным источником их семейного дохода и он тратит его на ежедневные расходы семьи. Сейчас его машина нуждается в ремонте. Поэтому Чахонгир обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита он хочет закупить запасные части и отремонтировать свою машину, для того чтобы дальше продвигать свою деятельность.
texts.en: Jahongir is a young man age of 28. He lives with his wife and child in the town of Vahdad at the 20th kilometer to the southeast of the capital. He has secondary education. Jahongir has been making a living by driving taxi for the past five years. He transports passengers on the route line of his town. The income from this business is the only source of income for his family which he spends on the daily expenses. Right now his car needs a repair and this is why Jagonhir has come for a loan. He wants to use the loan to buy spare parts and repair the car so that he can move his business further.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and groceries with a goal to start a new business.

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
San Pedro es un grupo formado por amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas se unieron para luchar por sus familias y darles lo que necesitan. El grupo por su esfuerzo ya está en el ciclo del programa numero 10.
Una persona muy emprendedora es Emeteria, quien por medio de su esfuerzo está luchando por salir adelante, es una persona muy capaz que día a día tiene como meta ir superándose. Ella vende frutas y verduras, y comenta que gracias a su trabajo esta creciendo poco a poco y ayuda a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas. Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que reciben, que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pedro" is comprised of friends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo.  They joined together to work hard for their families and provide them with everything they need.  Through much effort, the group is in its tenth loan cycle.

One of the members, Emeteria, is an entrepreneur who works  hard to get ahead.  She is a very capable person who sets goals for herself every day to improve her situation.  By selling fruits and vegetables and working hard, she is growing little by little and helping her family.  

Emeteria is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables to continue with her sales.  All of the members of the group are grateful for this opportunity, which will be very helpful to them.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Igualdad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Igualdad está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una está muy emocionada por formar parte de este desafío y quieren capacitarse para mejorar sus vidas.
Nidia es una de las miembros, ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes, ya que por medio de este negocio está saliendo adelante, también cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela y que gracias a esto está ayudando a su familia.
Esta muy agradecida por esta ayuda que está recibiendo, que les será muy útil.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Igualdad" is in its first Women's Program loan cycle; and each member is excited to be involved in the challenge and wanting to learn how to improve her lifestyle.

One of the members, Nidia, is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, which is the business she is in to get ahead.  She says she has many customers and, thanks to this, she is helping her family.

She is very grateful for this support which will be very useful to her.

loans.use: To buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Yvoty está en su ciclo número 10 del programa de comité de mujeres,  las integrantes desde el primer ciclo pusieron todo de ellas ya que quieren crecer y salir adelante. La causa común de todas ellas es dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia, quien cuenta que tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Felicia se define a sí misma como una persona muy luchadora que con gran esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas, panificado y demás, ya que con ello podrá surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Yvoty" is in its tenth Women's Program loan cycle.  Since the first cycle the members have worked as hard as possible to grow and get ahead.  The common cause for all of them is to give their families what they were unable to have themselves.

One of the members is Felicia who runs a store where she works every day from the early morning hours.  She defines herself as a very determined person who has been able to grow and get ahead through much effort.

She is requesting a loan to buy goods such as beverages, vegetables, fruit, bread and other items to stock her business.  Her goal is to give her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: To buy beverages, vegetables, fruit, bread and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre mujeres activas, ya que eso es lo que son estas mujeres, muy activas, que se unieron con gran esperanza de crecer, trabajar y ayudar a los suyos. El grupo está en su ciclo 16 del programa de comité de mujeres, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una mujer que forma parte de este grupo es la Sra. Daniela, ella vio una gran oportunidad en su grupo, y es por eso que decidió unirse para poder trabajar y mejorar no solo su economía, sino su vida en general. Ella se dedica a la costura, que con gran empeño realiza, y cuenta que tiene buena clientela que siempre le lleva pedidos.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en telas, hilos, gomas y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio y podrá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women in English) as all of these women are very active and have come together in the hope of growing, of working and of helping their families.  This is their sixteenth loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme and the members are also undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to improve their living conditions.

One member of this group is Daniela.  She saw that this group would be a huge opportunity and so decided to join.  In becoming part of the group, Daniela hopes to work and improve not just her financial situation, but her life in general as well.  Daniela makes a living as a dressmaker, a job that she carries out with great determination.  She has good customers who always bring her orders.

Today Daniela is applying for a  loan to buy material, threads, glue and other supplies.  These items will help her in her business and Daniela will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, glue and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Triunfadoras está en su ciclo número 3, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, el cual mostró que 5 mujeres se encuentran con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Filina quien se dedica a la venta de bijouterie y, también se debe destacar el trabajo y esfuerzo que ella hace por mejorar su vida. Ella es muy luchadora y emprendedora y por medio de su arduo trabajo esta dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra lentejuelas, hilos, aguja, pinzas y demás, para poder seguir haciendo su bijouterie y  para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Triunfadoras" is in its third loan cycle and all the members have taken the poverty elimination survey to determine each one's situation.  The survey showed that five women have very low incomes.

One of the members is Filina who sells jewelry.  By working hard and putting in much effort she is able to improve her life.  She is a very determined entrepreneur who, through her hard work, is giving her family everything it needs.

Filina is requesting a loan to buy beads, thread, needles, clips and other items so she can continue making jewelry to sell.  This will help her fulfill her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy beads, thread, needles, clips, etc.

loans.name: Mamadou Adama

texts.fr:
Né en Janvier 1983 à Kolondièba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali), MAMADOU réside à Kolondièba ville avec ses 2 enfants et sa femme dans une famille nucléaire.
 Monsieur MAMADOU s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, etc.). 
Fort de ses 4 années d’expériences dans le domaine il est très apprécié et sollicité au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
MAMADOU collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
MAMADOU compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400 kilos de céréales. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants chez les producteurs. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit dans son magasin à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
MAMADOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in January 1983 in Kolondièba (a borough in the third largest administrative region of Mali), Mamadou lives in the town of Kolondièba with his two children and his wife, as a nuclear family. Mamadou became interested at an early age in income generating activities, in particular the buying and selling of cereal crops (maize, cornmeal, sorghum etc). 
With four year's experience in this field, he is much appreciated and sought after at the market, in particular on fête days. Mamadou is working with Soro Yiriwaso to grow his capital in order to service his ever growing customer base; he is on his second loan, having fully repaid the previous one. Mamadou intends to use his loan in order to purchase 400 kilos of cereals. He buys his supplies from producers in the surrounding villages. His sales take place in his shop for cash on a retail basis, and occasionally for credit, to both men and women customers.
Mamadou hopes to achieve an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the family's needs, to repay the loan, and to invest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
29 de Setiembre está en su ciclo número 14 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, con ingresos muy bajos, pero pese a ello se están esforzando por poder crecer.
Una persona digna de destacar es Marta, quien vende ropas y calzados en forma ambulante. Cuenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil emprender, pero que hoy gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido mejoro bastante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que día a día quiere ir mejorando para seguir ayudando a su familia con lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de calzados y prendas, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas, y generar los ingresos que su familia y su negocio necesita para seguir.
texts.en:
The communal bank "29 de Setiembre" is in its 14th Women's Program loan cycle.  They have taken the poverty elimination survey which determined that two members are below the poverty line, with very low incomes.  Nevertheless, they are working hard to grow.  

One of the members, Marta, sells clothing and shoes as a street vendor.  She says that at first it was difficult to get into business but thanks to the training she received, she has improved considerably.  She is a very hard worker who tries to improve every day to continue supporting her family and giving them what they need.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy clothing and shoes so she can continue with her sales activity and generate the income her family and business need in order to continue.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Constitué exclusivement de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe DANAYA vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Kolondièba (Préfecture  de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, chaussures, de savons, jus et des condiments. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame KADIA (2ème à gauche sur la photo) est la vendeuse de condiment du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 bidon de l’huile de palme, 5 kilos  de beurre de karité, 1 sac  de  sel, ½ carton  de concentrée de tomate.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes, dans les villages avoisinants  et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame KADIA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Made up of just four married women, the DANAYA group's members live in traditional families and have an average age of 36 and on average three children each. They all live in the city of Kolondièba (a borough in the third largest administrative region of Mali), and met through family links, the neighbourhood and marriage. The group members are local traders - selling shoes, soaps, juices and condiments. With the objective of increasing their capital, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on the second round of their mutual loan. 
Kadia (second on the left in the photo) is the group's condiment salesperson. She intends to use her loan to purchase one container of palm oil, five kilos of shea butter, one bag of salt and a half carton of tomato concentrate. She buys her supplies from wholesalers in the surrounding villages, and makes her sales in retail quantities - for both cash and credit - from her home and in the market, to a mixed clientèle. Kadia intends to generate an average monthly profit from this loan of 20,500 FCFA - which will be used to invest in the business, and to assist her husband with some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Benkelema 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKELEMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, un des villages de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec TENIMBA la seule assise sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 125.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the BENKELEMA 1 group are married women with an average age of 41, three children each on average, and all living in polygamous families in Kalakan, one of the villages in Kolondieba - the third largest administrative region in Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to accomplish their farming tasks during the winter season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and the previous ones have all been repaid.
The crop grown is the peanut, by Tenimba - the only woman sitting in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy soil inputs and seed, and to pay the costs of ploughing in order to plant two hectares. The produce is sold in the village following harvest, at the market, to both men and women customers.
She intends to generate a profit of 125,500 FCFA per harvest. This profit will allow her to repay her loan, and also to assist her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase inputs and seed, and to pay for ploughing to prepare a harvest.

loans.name: Askah

texts.en:
Ascar lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. She has three children and has been doing this work for three years.  Her primary income sources comes from sales of milk, eggs and crops.

Ascar says that what is most enjoyable about farming is "earning from agriculture." Her biggest challenge is "access to agricultural finance." One of the animals on the farm has been given the name Lemok.

When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, Ascar replied, "I chose Juhudi following the success of other group members."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied, "I learned how I could benefit by acquiring finances lent by micro-finance institutions."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Ascar replied, "It will enable me to start a horticulture project to boost my family's income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ascar owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards as a result of this loan. This borrower has in her household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power or running water nor does she have a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to start a horticulture project to boost her family's income.

loans.name: Tatjana

texts.en:
Tatjana is a 26-year-old married mother of one baby who is 3 months old. She, her husband and their baby live in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. Tatjana works in a kindergarten and her husband works in the municipality. They now have their own family and home and the house's exterior needs some refurbishing. 

The money they generate together is still not enough for them to perform the renovations needed for the house. This is the first time that Tatjana is requesting a loan and it is so that she may be able to refurbish her house. 

She and her husband feel it is very important to refurbish their house since the cost of electricity is very high and it will save costs on heating in the winter. 

Since this loan will help improve their living conditions and save them money on utility costs, this loan will provide her family with better living conditions and they will be able to save some money to ensure their financial security. She is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all of the lenders!

loans.use: To refurbish her house's exterior.

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Villa del sol está en su séptimo ciclo gracias a la labor que están haciendo. Todas son mujeres jefa de familia, que se unieron con la esperanza de ayudar a sus hijos y darles lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Mirtha vende comidas que ella misma hace desde muy tempranas horas del día, con esta habilidad que tiene para los comestibles está formando una buena clientela, que siempre compran de ella las cosas ricas que prepara. Ella es una persona que siempre ha trabajado y se ha esforzado, y gracias a ese esfuerzo llego donde hoy esta.
Pide este crédito para poder comprar carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos, huevos, y demás insumos que usa para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende. Las integrantes de este grupo están agradecidas por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Villa del sol” is in its seventh cycle thanks to its members’ work. All of them are head-of-family women that got together hoping to be able to help their children and give them what they could not have for themselves.

Mirtha sells food she makes, starting early in the morning. She is a talented cook, which has resulted in a good customer base. Her customers buy all the delicious things she cooks. She is a person that has always worked hard, and this is why she is where she is today.

Mirtha is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, spices, eggs and other supplies needed to prepare the food she sells. All the members of this group appreciate the opportunity they are given.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, spices, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
Jestina lives in Congo Town, one of the most popular business areas in Montserrado County. She is a widow and has four children born between 1994 and 2006. All of her children are presently in school and live at home.

Jestina has been operating a shop where she sells rice by the bag for the past eight years. She learned this way of selling from her mother since she is the one who established her business for her. Jestina spends 10 hours a day on her business since her shop is not far from her house. Mostly she uses buses to get her supplies to her shop.  

Being independent makes Jestina proud about her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support, which helped him purchase new tires and complete repairs on his vehicle. This loan has helped him continue and further develop his business.

Through the use of the loan, Nazmi was able to increase his income and thereby improve the living conditions of his family. He says that his business has grown and he now has even more customers. 

Nazmi is once again requesting a loan, this time so he can renovate his garage and fix his car. He will continue in the future to work as a taxi driver as he works toward his goal of improving the living conditions of his family even more. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support once again!

loans.use: to renovate his garage and fix his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and she stopped her education at the ninth grade. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past four years, Mary has been operating her own shop in the local market where she sells used clothes six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because she has more customers. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her shop.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio  está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepcion, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Luci es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona muy alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares sus productos. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para los comestibles que vende, como ser verduras, condimentos, carnes y demás. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
This group, called “San Antonio”, is in its fifth cycle of the Women Committee program. The group is from Concepción, a growing city located a bit away from the central region. It is a remote region, so all the members want to continue fighting to get ahead and help the region to grow little by little and to have a better environment.

Luci is one of the members. She lives far away from the city center, where her small food business is located. She also sells her products in other places. She hopes that with time, and with the help of the local people, the environment and safety conditions will improve so that they can offer their families a safer and better future.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her preparations, such as vegetables, spices and different types of meat. This way, she will continue to grow with her business and will give her family all they need to have a life that lacks for nothing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, meat and other supplies.

loans.name: Kamah

texts.en:
Kamah is 31 years old and lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is unmarried, and has four children between the ages 3 and 13.  Only three are presently in school and all three of them live at home.   She was unable to go to school and she describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past 8 years she has been selling oil, vita, rice, etc in the local market.  She sells from Monday to Saturday from 6AM to 5PM each day.  She likes her business because the various customers who buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by her mother.  She used shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, vita, rice, etc for her business.  She plans is to build a house for her children.   She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, vita, rice, etc for her business,

loans.name: Masieni

texts.en:
Masieni is 42 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is married and she was unable to go to school.   She has nine children between the ages of 3 to 30.   Only five are in school in school and live at home.   She describes herself as a hardworking woman.   

For the past four years she has been selling groundnut in the local market.  She sells every days from 7AM to 5PM.  She like her business because the various customers who buy from her.   She started this business with money given to her by her husband.   She uses a shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut for her business.   She plans to build a house for her children.   She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnut for her business,

loans.name: Buena Fe Group

texts.es:
Buena Fe está en su ciclo número 15° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas luchan y ponen todo de si para poder crecer en sus microemprendimientos. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Celsa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace se dedica a la venta de bingos, quinielas también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus cartones de bingo, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
'Buena Fe' are starting their 15th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program.  They are all working hard and putting everything they've got into growing their micro-businesses.  They took part in the 'Poverty Elimination' survey and found that three members are living below the poverty line, which is to say that they have very low incomes.

One of the members of this group is Celsa who, in the last survey she completed, was at level one on the poverty scale.  Through her continual hard work and effort, and by applying the actions of a successful woman, she is improving her situation.  Among other work, Celsa sells bingo cards and lottery tickets.  It is also necessary to highlight the work of the loan officers who follow up on training sessions and make any checks that are needed.  In addition, they encourage the women to work hard to break out of poverty.

Celsa is requesting this loan to buy her bingo cards.  This will help her to realize her business plan and, in turn, help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy bingo cards to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is living together with her fiancee who is a seller of clothes.   They both have three children between the ages of 9 and 17.  They are in school and live at home.  She describes herself as a hardworking person, who completed 10th grade.  

Due to some lack of home needs she decided to established a business to help support her home.  For the past 12 years she has been going out of town to buy cassava, potatoes, etc to resell in Monrovia.   She likes her business because of the variety of customers who buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by her friends.   She uses the bus to get her goods to her spot.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, potatoes, etc for her business.  She plans to buy a pieces of land and build a house.   She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, potatoes, etc for her business,

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 38 year old woman who lives in the West point, area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18.  Only three are in school and they all live at home.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past 9 years she has been running a market-table where she sells rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc in the local market.  She sells six days in a week from 7AM to 6PM.  She likes her business because of the various customers who buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by husband.  She uses a shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc for her business,

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 40 year old woman who lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is single, and has five children ages 20, 17, 14, 8 and 6; only four are in school and all five of her children live at home.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells rice and oil in the local market.  She sells six days in a week from 7AM to 6PM.  She likes her business because of the various customers who buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee.  She uses the shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her business location.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and rice for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.  She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice for her business,

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Hel is a 36 year old woman who lives in the West point, area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 1 and 17.  Only two are in school and live at home.  She describes herself as a hardworking woman.   

For the past six years she has been running a shop where she bakes and sells bread in the local market.  She sells six days in a week from 7AM to 4PM.  She likes the flow of her customers and she started this business with money given to her by her fiancee.  She uses the shard-taxi every time to get her goods to her shop.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, wood, etc for her business.  She plans to build a house for her children.   She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, wood, etc for her business,

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está casada con el Sr Bruno, con quien tiene un hijo aun pequeño, por quien ambos luchan  se esfuerza, para que de esa forma a su hijo no les falte nada.
Ella tiene una despensa y mercería en su casa, en la cual gracias al trabajo que está haciendo también le ayuda a su marido   Ella  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de un congelador  ya que no abastece con lo que tiene, y quiere seguir dando a su clientela un buen servicio. Cuenta que sueña con agrandar el negocio y dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Antonia is from San Lorenzo and is married to Bruno.  Together they have a son, for whom they both fight and put in the effort so that he does not need for anything.

Antonia has a general store and haberdashery in her home, where her has husband also helps.  Antonia has proven to be very responsible and honest in her dealings.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy a new freezer.  Her current freezer is not big enough and she wants to continue offering good service to her customers.  Antonia tells us that she dreams of expanding the business and of being a source of employment for other people.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing stock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es soltera ya que nunca se caso, pero tiene hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, estudiantes universitarios, los que pudo criar por medio de su esfuerzo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en el mercado de San Lorenzo con una antigüedad de 17 años, con clientes ya formados, solicito el crédito para la compra de una heladera ya que quiere surtir sus productos.Gracias al trabajo que está realizando también le ayuda a sus hijos a seguir estudiando, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. Comentan que gracias a su servicio brinda un buen  trato a sus clientes, sueña con agrandar el negocio y dar fuente de trabajo  a las personas.
texts.en:
Teresa is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She is single, as she never married, but does have children.  They are all now adults and studying at university.  She was able to raise the children with a lot of effort.

Teresa makes a living selling food at the San Lorenzo market.  She has been doing this for seventeen years and has regular customers.  She is applying for this loan in order to buy a fridge in which to store her products.  Thanks to her work, Teresa can help her children to continue studying.  She is responsible and honest with her commitments. Teresa tells us that she provides good service to her customers and that she dreams of expanding her business and providing employment to others.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for her food stall.

loans.name: Mafata

texts.en:
Mafata lives in the West Point area, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She is 35 years old and she is married with two children ages 9 and 6, who are in school and live at home.   

For nine years now she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells fashion clothes.  She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses, jeans, trousers, etc for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses, jeans, trousers, etc for her  business,

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 29 years old and lives in the town of West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County.  She lives with her fiancee and they both have a seven year old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For 10 years Theresa has been dressing hair in her community.  Sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy artificial hair since the price of artificial hair is not stable and is getting much more expensive every day.  She likes to talk with her customers and she learned the trade from her auntie a long time ago. 

Theresa has requested a loan to buy more artificial hair to increase her stock.  In the future, she would like to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy more artificial hair to increase her stock.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, ya que volvieron a juntarse las integrantes antiguas para seguir trabajando  con la fundación y están reiniciando de cero los ciclos. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Fatima, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cariadas clases de fragancias, tanto para hombre como para mujeres, cuenta además que se ha hecho de muy buena cantidad de clientes, ya que sus productos son buenos y a bajo precio. Gracias a este trabajo ella da su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes y fragancias, para poder seguir dando a sus clientes lo que piden.
texts.en:
Renacer are starting their first loan cycle within the Women's Committee program.  Some former members came together again as a group so that they could continue working with the foundation and they are re-starting their loan cycles from zero.  They are taking part in the 'Poverty Stoplight' survey and, through their continual hard work and effort, and by applying the right behavior, they are improving their situation.

One of the members of this group is Fatima, who sells perfume and different fragrances for both men and women.  She says that she has a good number of customers because she sells good products at low prices.  Thanks to this work, she is able to give her family everything they need.

Fatima is requesting this loan to invest in buying perfumes and fragrances so that she can continue giving her customers what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria, quien con su anterior credikiva compró ropa para damas y calzado, con los cuales aumentó sus inventarios y logró mayores utilidades para su negocio, lo que representó más ingresos para su hogar. Ella da las gracias a todos sus financiadores de Kiva por su apoyo al negocio, porque se ha fortalecido. Su meta es continuar en ascenso comercial y por eso está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con le cual comprará ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, todo ello sobre pedidos para hacer de su credikiva una magnifica inversión.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Maria. With the previous Kiva loan, she bought women's clothing and shoes, with which she increased her inventory and made more profit for her business, which meant more income for her home. She thanks all of the Kiva lenders for supporting her business, because it has grown stronger. Her goal is to continue growing commercially and that is why she is asking for a new loan. With it, she will buy clothing for women, men and children, everything to fill orders to make her Kiva loan a magnificent investment.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's  clothing.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Martha, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar una vitrina, productos de aseo, víveres como arroz, aceite, harinas, granos, espaguetis, carnes frías, pollo, salsas y refrescos en general para la tienda; mejorando su surtido para brindarle a los clientes una mejor atención. Esto le ha permitido aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades, trayendo bienestar a su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de víveres, productos de aseo, ranchos y dulcería al por mayor y al contado, con el fin de aumentar su capital de trabajo, volumen de ventas y utilidades. Martha dice a sus financiadores: “Muchas gracias por su apoyo financiero, espero seguir contando con ustedes para continuar progresando”.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Martha, who with her Kiva loan was able to buy a display case, cleaning products, grocery items such as rice, oil, flours, grains, pasta, cold cuts, chicken, sauces and general beverages for her store. This improved her stock to offer the customers better service. This has allowed her to increase her sales and her profit, bringing well being to her home. Right now, she is applying for a new loan to invest in buying grocery items, cleaning products, prepared meals and candy wholesale and paid for up front. This is to increase her working capital, sales volume and profits. Martha says to her lenders: “thank you very much for your financial support. I hope to keep counting on you to keep progressing."

loans.use: to buy grocery products, cleaning products, prepared food and candies wholesale and paid for upfront.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 52-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His main business is selling dry foods alongside selling milk and growing bananas. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning yet he is faced with the challenge of heavy rains that make transportation difficult. 

Joseph intends to use the loan to buy stock like maize flour, millet flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock like maize flour, millet flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Namaha Shibaya Self Help Group

texts.en:
The group Namaha Shibaya Self Help Group has 14 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. 

The lady standing in the front wearing a orange saree in the photo is Diptimayee, the leader of the group. Diptimayee is a 29-year-old married woman in Balipatna village of Odisha, India. The couple has one child who is at his schooling. Diptimayee lives with her son and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. 

For the past four years, she has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables. Her husband and her son help her in this activity. All other members of this group are engaged in various kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Diptimayee, together with her group, Namaha Shibaya Self Help Group, has requested a loan amount of 2,10,000 INR. She will use her portion for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Richeal

texts.en:
Richeal lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado county.She is 32 years old. She described herself as a hardworking person. She completed grade 2,  and she is unmarried.

For three years now she has been selling clothes in the local market. One of the problems she faces is small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food for her home. This makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. In the near future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been making crafts for 20 years and works ten hours a day. He also runs a transport business for additional income. A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university.

David intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодату 56 лет. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Детям 27, 25 и 15 лет. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги таксиста по городу. Саодат более 33 лет работает в поликлинике и одновременно преподаёт в Медицинском Университете. Она преподаёт в кафедре Семейной медицине студентам 5-6 курсов. Она является опытным специалистом и ответственным работником. Она имеет очень умных детей. Ее дочь Нозанин владеет 3 языками: английский, немецкий и французский. Ее старший сын окончил университет в Техасе. Саодат хочет отремонтировать свой дом и создать благоприятное условие для своих умных детей. Ее зарплата и доход мужа не хватает для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесину и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saodat is 56, married, and has three children who are 27, 25, and 15. Her husband runs a private taxi service in the city. Saodat has been working in a polyclinic and teaching at the Medical College for more than 33 years. She teaches fifth and sixth year students in the Family Medicine department. She is both an experienced specialist and a responsible employee.  Her children, too, are very bright. Her daughter Hozanin speaks three languages: English, German, and French. Her oldest son is a graduate of a university in Texas. Saodat wants to repair her house to provide her bright children with a nice place to live. Her salary and her husband's income are too little to buy building materials. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 US dollars to purchase building materials, such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood and etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira, a 24-year-old resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, supports her four children's needs from the megre PHP 3,000 she has been earning monthly from her gardening business for the last four years. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services and improve her ability to engage business, and has requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy fertilizer such as manure.

Elvira wants to cultivate her farm and create a new plot upon which to grow bananas to generate more income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen es una señora innovadora, ella tiene su tienda de ropa interior, por lo que desea adquirir mas mercadería y mayor variedad para su tienda. necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para tener una mayor variedad de ropa. con este proyecto pretende obtener mas ingresos y un mayor crecimiento de su negocio y así ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Carmen is an innovative woman who has a shop selling undergarments. She would like to acquire more merchandise, in a greater variety, for her shop. Thus she needs a loan of one million colones (1,000,000) in order to offer a greater variety of clothing. With this plan, she intends to obtain more income and better growth for her business, and thus help her family.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, a widow who works hard to support her family, has a fishing business in the Philippines. In operation for 25 years now, she has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials such as bamboo, wood, a fishing net, etc.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her enterprise to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like bamboo, wood, a  fishing net, etc. for her business

loans.name: Yamil Milton

texts.es:
YAMIL tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

YAMIL se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.
El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta fútbol y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Yamil is 33 years old, is in a common-law marriage, has four children, and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He belongs to the communal bank Genesis, which is located in the settlement of Atascoso, belonging to the town of Ventanas.  They make a living through agricultural work and livestock.

Yamil makes a living through agriculture by growing corn and rice.  He asks for the loan to buy urea, seeds, manure, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy the fertilizers and a pump to fumigate the fields. 

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda.  The challenges that he faces are the plagues and sicknesses of the crops.  His dream is to buy land to continue planting.  In his free time he likes to play football and spend time with his family.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Crescenciano

texts.en:
Crescenciano, a 42-year-old married man from Bien Unido, Bohol, has six children, the oldest 23 and the youngest 7 years of age. Crescenciano, who catches and sells fish for a living, has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing materials including a fishing net.

Crescenciano hopes to set aside some of his profits so he can continue to send his children to school and purchase a new pump boat in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials including a fishing net

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una joven emprendedora. ella tiene hace poco tiempo una librería, la cual ha iniciado con su esfuerzo y sus propios ingresos. sin embargo necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder comprar mas materiales y artículos y así ampliar su mercadería. con esto pretende crecer junto con su negocio ya que tiene muchas posibilidades al tener muchos centros educativos cerca que le permitirán mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a young entrepreneur. She recently set up a bookshop, which she began with effort and her own funds, however she needs a loan of one million colones (1,000,000) to buy more materials and items to expand her stock. Through this, she hopes to grow with her business, which she has a good chance of because there are lots of educational institutions nearby which will enable her to boost her profits.

loans.use: to buy materials for a bookshop and general store.

loans.name: Aharayna

texts.en:
Aharayna is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school, Aharayna works very hard to provide for her family.

Aharayna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Aharayna requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

In the future Aharayna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Editha is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Leona works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Leona is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nora Mercedes

texts.es: Gracis por apoyara Nora quien con su crédito porque pudo una nueva oferta de productos, debutar en los eventos que la contrataron y esto fue gracias a que su credikiva le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos y se las ingenió para que los invitados de primeras comuniones, fiestas de quince años, grados etc, degustaran las delicias con que los prepara sus productos. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada y aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos para hacer refrigerios, como harina, queso, lacteos,  pues tiene contratos con instituciones, como ella tambien se dedica a la distribución de productos de belleza, parte de su financiamiento tambien los usará para comprar cosméticos, perfumeria etc. Su mensaje a los financiadores es de muchos agradecimientos por los créditos recibidos.
texts.en: Thank yo for supporting Nora with the loan because she was able to offer new products and debut at some events she was hired for. This was thanks to her Kiva loan, which was used to buy materials and ingredients. She used them so that the guests at first communions, quinceaneras, graduations, etc. were able to enjoy the delicious products that she prepares. Right now, she is very enthusiastic and applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will use to buy products to make snacks such as flour, cheese, dairy products, etc. She has contracts with institutions. Since she also distributes beauty products, part of the loan will be used to buy cosmetics, perfume, etc. Her message to all of the lenders is: thank you very much for the loans she has received.

loans.use: to buy, with one part of it, ingredients to make snacks such as flour, cheese, and dairy products. The other part will be used to invest in cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором замужняя женщина и молодая мама. Ей 23 года и у нее один ребёнок. Её муж сейчас находится в России на заработках. Она вместе с сыном живет в районе Дж.Руми. У Дилором среднее образование. Она добрая и скромная женщина. Дилором хочет начать свой бизнес в сфере обслуживания. Она планирует заняться шитьем национальных платьев у себя на дому. Дилором умеет шить женские одежды, но у нее нет швейной машинки. С этой целью она обратилась в организацию. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения швейной машинки модели YAMATA и ткани. В дальнейшем за счет дохода Дилором намерена улучшить условия проживания и отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Dilorom is 23, married, and the young mother of one child. Her husband is working abroad in Russia. She lives with her son in J.Rumi. Dilorom has a high school diploma, and is a kind and modest woman. She wants to start her own business in the service sector: she plans on making traditional Tajik dresses at her home. She already knows how to make woman's clothing, but does not have a sewing machine. With this goal in mind, she has come to MLO Humo. She is requesting a loan to buy a YAMATA sewing machine and thread. With the money she earns with the loan, Dolorom intends to improve her living conditions and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and thread

loans.name: Emilio Celestino

texts.es:
Emilo vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad de clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros, también se desarrolla la pesca y también esta ciudad se caracteriza por su gastronomía variada, en la cual podemos degustar del riquísimo Chupe de Camarones. Emilio aprendió a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente desde muy joven es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Agronomía.

Día a día Emilio trabaja como agricultor, el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al dia ya que siempre esta muy pendiente del desarrollo del cultivo,  el cree que esta saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta lo que hace.

Emilio esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda ya que en los últimos meses ha habido vientos muy fuertes y han dañado el techo de su vivienda, así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Emilo lives in Camana, a warm, welcoming city with a strong agricultural sector, especially rice and beans, among other crops. There is also a fishing industry, and the city is known for its varied gastronomy, including delicious Chupe de Camarones, a rich shrimp soup. Emilio learned to work hard for his living from a very young age, which is he was only able to study up to the fifth grade of high school, but he would have liked to study Agriculture.

Every day, Emilio works as a farmer. He works for around 10 hours a day since he is always attentive to the growth of his crops. He thinks his work is going well because he is responsible, and above all because he enjoys his job.

Emilio is very grateful for Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support, he will be able to buy building materials to make improvements to his home, which are necessary because in recent months there have been strong winds which have damaged the roof of his house. In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life and keep working and fighting to make his dream reality: "To finish building his home".

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farm equipment rental business in the Philippines. Editha has been in this business for 42 years. Editha earns additional income from farming rice and fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Ekih

texts.en:
Ekih is 44 years old and married with four children.

Ekih works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. 

Ekih requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like toothpaste, rice, eggs, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Ekih has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ekih aspires to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional items like toothpaste, rice, eggs, shampoo, canned goods, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, a 53-year-old married mother of eight, has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for the last 10 years. She earns additional income by buying and selling fish.

Marieta is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Marry Ann, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 36 years, earns additional income from food vending and a motorcycle transport business. Having repaid her previous loan, Marry Ann is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

Marry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes, accessories, and cosmetic jewellery.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – из Виноградово. У него есть собственный микроавтобус Фольксваген. Сергей занимается маршрутными перевозками, а также работает по договору с одной консервной фирмой, предоставляя услуги перевозок людей на работу. Сергей очень любит свою работу, а еще любит отдыхать со своей женой на природе. 
Сергей хочет приобрести большой микроавтобус IVEKO на 24 места, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и обеспечивать перевозки для большего количества людей.
texts.en: Sergei is from Vinogradov. He has his own Volkswagon Van. He provides transportation along a set route, and also works by contract with a canning company, transporting its employees to work. He loves his work, but he loves to relax in the outdoors with his wife even more. Sergei wants to buy a 24-seat IVEKO van to expand his business and carry more passengers.

loans.use: to buy a bigger, newer van for his business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene un espíritu optimista y sobre todo humilde, es madre de 9 hijos, a quienes ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y se convirtió en padre y madre para ellos. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy caluroso, asimismo en el encontramos a las líneas de nazca, las cuales son geroglifos que se encuentra en medio de un extenso campo árido y que según algunos estudios se utilizaban como un calendario astronómico que era utilizado para saber cuando era la época de lluvia. Cuando Teofila tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial sus novelas y también le gusta preparar uno de sus  platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Frejoles con Carne”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo tuvo estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho terminar el colegio.

Con mucha dedicación Teofila trabaja en su negocio como agricultora, ella tiene una parcela de tuna, la cual es una fruta que crece en una especie de cactus y que es muy deliciosa, asimismo en estas planta se introduce la cochinilla que es un pequeño insecto llamado cochinilla, el cual es utilizado por diversas fabricas de tejido, entre otros para darle color a los insumos, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 7 horas diarias, ya que siempre tiene que revisar el cultivo; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicada.

Teofila está muy agradecida con los prestamistas  Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valioso apoyo y gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado y sobre todo la confianza, ella podrá dar mantenimiento a su cultivo lo cual comprende abono, fertilizantes, irrigación, cuidados, entre otros, así ella podrá tener una mejor cosecha y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos para seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran agricultora”.
texts.en:
Teofila is a very hard-working woman.  She has an optimistic spirit and above all is humble.  She is the mother of 9, who she has brought up alone since the father of her children abandoned her and she became father and mother to the kids.  Her home is located in the city of Nazca, which is known for having a very warm climate. In addition, the town of Nazca is known for its "Lines of Nazca" which are hieroglyphics that can be found in the middle of a large arid field and that, according to experts, were used as an astronomical calendar employed to determine when the rainy season would arrive.  When Teofila has free time she likes to watch television, especially Latin American soap operas (telenovelas).  She also likes to prepare one of her favorite dishes for her family, which is the delicious "Frijoles con Carne" or "Beef and Beans."  Due to the limited economic resources of her parents, she was only able to complete primary school, but she would very much have liked to finish high school.

With much dedication Teofila works in her business as a farmer. She has a parcel of "tuna," which is a fruit that grows on a species of cactus and is very delicious. Also on those same plants there is the "cochinilla" which is a small insect that is used for making diverse weaving fabrics, as well as to give color to foods.  She works around 7 hours daily, since she always has to check her crops. She believes that things are going well for her because she is very dedicated.

Teofila is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since this is the second time that they have offered their valuable help and thanks to the help given, and more than anything thanks to the trust shown, she will be able to care for her crop which includes providing fertilizers, irrigation, weeding, among other things. In this way she will be able to have a better harvest and above all increase her income in order to continue working day by day to make her great dream a reality: "To be a great farmer."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Norfrederie

texts.en:
Nurfrederie, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines for 20 years, earns additional income selling ready-to-wear clothing. Having repaid her previous loan, Nurfrederie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring shop such as clothes, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc.

Nurfrederie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring shop such as clothes, a sewing machine, needles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' (variety) store. She sells items like bread, noodles, biscuits, candies, seasonings and soap. She has been operating a retail store for almost 5 years now.

 Regina requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like beverages, soap, and soft drinks, so as to fill her store with stock to avoid shortages. In the future, Regina would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store business to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like beverages, soap, and soft drinks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with two children. She is 41 years old and lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. Fe owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She also has a new plot of papayas and other valuable plants. She has been in this business for  years.

Fe joined GDMPC last year and it helps her improve her business and gain financial access, too. She borrowed a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase manure as fertilizer. In the future, Fe's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase manure as fertilizer

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 51 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school, Ofelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a small business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional liters of gallon of gasoline to sell.

Ofelia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional liters of gallon of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave for her bamboo-weaving business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for many years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her bamboo-weaving business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma works hard to support her family. Selma is married and has a banana business in the Philippines.

Selma requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

Selma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Selma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Teresa has been in this business for 20 years. Teresa earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes fish to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 14 years now, and also earns additional income from direct-selling and pig-fattening businesses. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting new loan to build her fish-vending, direct-selling and pig-fattening businesses.

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 31 years old and married, with two children. She wants to start a small general store and sell rice, sugar, soft drinks, washing powder, soap, etc. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy rice, sacks of sugar, washing powder, soap, and soft drinks. In the future, Stella hopes to have a store all by herself. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, sacks of sugar, washing powder, soap and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 39 years old. She is  a mother of three and a food vendor at Alcala, Cagayan. She sells biscuits, soft drink, juice and bread to students. She had been in the food-selling business for over nine years and earns about 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) a day.  Her income is usually spent as the school allowance of her children. Her spouse is working as a driver and earns a daily income of 200 PHP. 

Marietta is borrowing a loan of 10,000 PHP to make her business flourish. If given the opportunity, she will make use of the loan in purchasing more merchandise such as meat, rice, soft drinks, biscuits and bread to sell in her food stall.

Marietta hopes to achieve a profitable business in order to attain a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, soft drinks, biscuits and bread to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dúo Flor Del Cafe Group

texts.es:
DUO FLOR DEL CAFE
Doña Simona es originaria del municipio de San José Poaquil,Chimaltenango, ella tiene 35 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad están sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de Poaquil. 
Desde hace algunos años ella empezó con un pequeño negocio y gracias a Dios poco a poco fue creciendo, todos los días desde temprano sale a vender ya que es conocida por sus clientelas.
El esposo de ella trabaja como jornalero y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue con su negocio ya que el apoya con las necesidades que tiene en su familia. 
El sueño de ella es ampliar y surtir mas su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a una mejor escuela. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
This group, "Duo Flor del Cafe" or "Coffee Flower Team" has as one of its members Simona. She is originally from the town of San José Poaquil, Chimaltenango.  She is 35 years old and she has two minor children in her care.  She works selling vegetables in the local market of Poaquil. 

A few years ago she began with a small business and thanks to God little by little it has been growing.  Every day early she leaves to sell since she is known by her customers.  

Her husband works as a day laborer and thanks to his support she continues with her business since he helps support the family needs. 

Her dream is to grow and to better supply her business in order to obtain better income and to send her children to a better school.  She is asking for credit to purchase vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marjolen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marjolen works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn.  Marjolen is borrowing 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional materials and pay for her laborer's salaries for her furniture shop business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her furniture shop and farming corn businesses.

Marjolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and pay for her laborer's salaries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Luvisminda

texts.en:
Luvisminda is 58 years old and married with six children, one of whom in school.
