She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Luvisminda is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to pay for her laborers' salaries and purchase fertilizers.

Luvisminda has been farming sugarcane for 35 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented shrimp.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her sugarcane farm and buy and sell fermented shrimp.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To pay her laborers' salaries and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Pua

texts.en:
Pua is 55 years old and married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as food and miscellaneous products. She has been doing this for two years. 

Pua needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, tinned food, snacks, washing powder and soap. She hopes to use her profits to provide for her kids' education. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, tinned food, snacks, washing powder and soap.

loans.name: Fuapepe

texts.en:
Fuapepe is 26 years old and married, with one child. She wants to start a small business, making and selling biscuits in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, an oven, yeast, sugar, milk, eggs, and butter. In the future, Fuapepe hopes to expand her business. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, an oven, yeast, sugar, milk, eggs, and butter.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 23 year old, married woman, with three children. To earn a living, she would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas, and yams. 

Faith has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, chemicals, a rake, shovels, and a mist blower. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for many years. Faith will spend her profits to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, chemicals, a rake, shovels, and a mist blower.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий уже брал один кредит на КИВЕ в прошлом. Он продолжает торговать в своем продуктовом магазине. У него также работает один сотрудник. Василий не женат, живет сейчас с мамой.
В этот раз Василию необходима сумма в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать внешний ремонт своего дома, а именно укрепить фундамент, подлив новый, а также поштукатурить фасадные стены здания.
texts.en:
Vasiliy has already taken out a Kiva loan in the past. He continues to work in his grocery store. He also has one employee. Vasiliy is single and now lives with his mother.

At present Vasiliy needs a sum of 20,00 UAH in order to carry out  exterior renovations on his home, specifically to strengthen the house foundation by adding more concrete and also to plaster the façade walls.

loans.use: to do remodelling of his private house

loans.name: Edarlina

texts.en:
Edarlina, 40 years old, is married with seven grown-up children. She lives in a village of San Pedro province of Isabela. Edarlina is engaged in selling different products in her community. 

Edarlina is asking for a loan amounting 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy canned goods, spices and commodities for her store. She hopes that her dream is granted for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices and commodities for her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old, married, and a mother to three school-age children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. She and her husband are very determined to uplift their living status and support the education of their children.  

Jocelyn operates a motorcycle transport business, while her husband cultivates their farm land. For the maintenance of her motorcycle, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy gasoline, wheels, accessories, and other spare parts. 

Jocelyn believes that, someday, she will improve the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, accessories, and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of  the motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 50, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 18 years and earns additional income from selling used clothing. 

Alicia has borrowed 26 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to sustain her businesses. She has paid back previous loans.

She is now requesting a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig to further build that business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, un des villages de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec DIATOU F 3ème de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter :3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de  KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 185.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the BENKELEMA 2 group are married woman, on average 26 years old with three children, who all live in polygamous families in Kalakan, a village in the Kolondieba region (3rd largest administrative region in Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete the planning of their farming activities during the winter season. They are asking for their seventh loan, the previous six having been successfully reimbursed. Diatou (seen 3rd from the left in the photo) cultivates rice. This loan will allow her to purchase rice seeds and other resources, and cover the labor costs of cultivating on 3 acres of land. She sells the product at the local village market in Kolondieba, to a client base composed of both men and women. She hopes to earn a profit of 185 000 FCFA (approximately 282 USD) per area of land. This will allow her to pay back her loan, in addition to helping her husband take care of daily family expenses.

loans.use: cover the cost of resources, seeds, and labour for an agricultural campaign

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont majoritairement  mariées dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Ouolofobougou dans la commune III du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali) et se sont connues à travers  leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Ouolofobougou. Les membres du groupe mènent  différentes activités génératrices de revenus, telles  la vente d’oignons, d’atieké, de poisson frais et du charbon de bois. Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir   leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur  premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (la 1ère  femme debout à l’extrême gauche) a une grande notoriété dans la vente des légumes dans le marché de Ouolofobougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant  au marché du quartier à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The four members of the Yiriwa group are for the most part married women who live in monogamous families. They average 32 years of age and two children each. They all live in Ouolofobougou, in commune III of the district of Bamako (capital of Mali) and they know one another through their income-generating activities, which they conduct at the market of Ouolofobougou. The group members practice different activities such as the sale of onions, atieké (a dish made from cassava), fresh fish and charcoal. In an effort to expand their activities, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This is their first group loan.

Mrs. Djènèba (1st from the left) has a great reputation as a seller of vegetables at the market of Ouolofobougou. She will use her loan to buy 10 bags of onions. She buys her stock at the market, and sells for cash at the neighborhood market to a clientele consisting mostly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover some of the household’s expenses and to reinvest in her activity. Her goal is to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to obtain numerous loans.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the farming business for more than 25 years now. This is the source of his income. 

Jacinto is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the reinvestment of the same venture and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay, 47, is married with seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending.  

Gay is borrowing 28,500 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She has successfully paid back her previous loan. The new loan is to further build her farming and food vending businesses.

Gay is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a vegetables-vending business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Petesa

texts.en:
Petesa  is a 43-year-old single woman with three children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Petesa  has requested a loan to buy more peanut seeds, a wheelbarrow, rakes, fertilizer and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD for many years. 

Petesa  will spend her profits to extend/improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more peanut seeds, a wheelbarrow, rakes, fertilizer and shovels.

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue is a 66-year-old, married woman, with eight children. To earn a living, she would like to start growing peanuts. 

Sue has requested a loan to buy sacks peanut seeds, a wheel barrow, fertilizer, and shovels. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) for many years. Sue will spend her profits to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks peanut seeds, a wheel barrow, fertilizer, and shovels.

loans.name: Djantoyerela  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA  1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, un des villages de KOLONDIEBA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec MARIAM  la seule assise sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter :3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de  KOLONDIEBA  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 185.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DJANTOYERELA  1 group are all married women, on average 36 years old and with three children, all living in polygamous families in Kalakan, a village in the Kolondieba region (3rd largest region in Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the success of their farming plans during the winter season. They are on their sixth loan, all previous loans have been successfully reimbursed. Mariam, seen sitting in the photo, grows peanuts. This loan will allow her to purchase grains and cover other resources and labor costs to harvest three acres of land. The output is sold at the village market in Kolondieba to a client base made up of both men and women. She hopes to make a profit of 185 500 FCFA (approximately 282 USD) per season. This profit will allow her to reimburse her loan, as well as help her husband to take care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: cover the costs of resources, grains and labor for a season of crops

loans.name: Santos Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Santos es una persona luchadora y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 1 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos desde hace 3 años.
Don Santos los vende en los distintos caseríos cercanos su comunidad. El necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos que necesita para seguir realizando su negocio. 
Don Santos espera que este préstamo le de muy buenos resultados al contar con el producto necesario que le ayude a cubrir la demanda que tiene su negocio y a su vez espera que sus ventas aumenten y de esta manera  poder mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el su familia.
Don Santos espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking and honest person who lives in a southern Honduras community, along with his wife and one of his children.  He has been in the business of buying and selling pigs for three years. 

Santos sells in the various settlements near his community and needs this loan to buy pigs that he needs to continue his business.

Santos expects that this loan will provide good results in getting the things he needs and will help him to cover his business’ demand.  He also expects that his sales will increase and in this way be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

Santos hopes to be able to continue supporting his children with their studies so that they will have better opportunities in life.
 
Choluteca, Honduras – May 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Annabe

texts.en:
Annabe, 26, is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three children, aged 4, 3 and 8 months.

Annabe has been in the hog-raising business for almost three years. Her husband works as a driver.

To meet the needs of her family, Annabe has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional pigs as well as feed for her pigs to grow healthy.
 
In the future, she would like to expand her hog-raising business and to build a sari-sari (variety store) to provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Rosemlin

texts.en:
Rosemlin is 36 years old and married, with three children.

Rosemlin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, soap, chips, eggs, and noodles.

Rosemlin has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store, sugarcane, and livestock businesses.

Rosemlin aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, soap, chips, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Juliet is borrowing PHP 29,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Juliet has been farming sugarcane for 17 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her sugarcane and pig-raising businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sufyan

texts.en:
Sufyan hopes to be a student at the Academy of Maritime Archipelago; he wants to work in a large port. Sufyan lives in a remote village, in a mountainous area, precisely in the area Majenang, Cilacap. Sufyan's father only works as a carpenter whose income is uncertain. His parents have only enough revenue to finance their day-to-day family life, 

Sufyan has four brothers who still have many needs. Sufyan wants to help his parents for the betterment of his family and the life of his four brothers. Then with the Student Loan program from Kiva, he wants to pursue his studies and complete quickly, in order to quickly get a job. He would very be grateful to all investors of Kiva who  help in his study, even though they do not know him personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Heri Ya Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kwabo est leader du groupe d’affaire Heri ya Mungu, entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un infirmier. La cliente est aussi infirmier et sociétaire d’une pharmacie. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari, il y a environ 4 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter un stock de médicaments. Les taxes et tracasseries policières, l’expiration des dates de certains produits sont des obstacles majeurs pour le développement de son activité. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Kwabo, is the leader of the business group "Heri ya Mungu". An energetic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 39 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, all students. Her husband is a nurse. This client is also a nurse and an associate of a pharmacy. She started this business with funds from her husband about four years ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase a stock of medicines. Some of the major obstacles in developing her business are taxes, police hassles, and expiration dates for certain products. She would thus like to increase her capital and provide education to her children. So, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ari

texts.en:
Ari hopes to be a student of engineering science in shipping at Nusantara Maritim Academy. Ari lives in a small village, to the west of the town of Cilacap,  Jeruklegi village. To reach the campus, he has to take a 1-hour trip by motorcycle. He hopes to complete the program of study, but he has concerns about the cost of these studies. 

Ari's parents work as farmers whose income is not fixed and can only meet the needs of day-to-day living, so the difficulty is to finance his studies. Ari wants work on a ship as a ship 'tekniksi' professional. He also did not want to bother his parents, because his parents have to pay for his sister's schooling. 

Ari wants to get a loan from Kiva to help pay for college expenses, so that he could complete his studies, get a job faster and his parents can be helped with their economic situation.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri wishes to be a student of the Academy of Maritime Archipelago. She will take the Nautical program in accordance with the education stream she took at high school. Her father works as a farmer making only coconut (brown) sugar, while  her mother sells vegetables around the village, helping her husband to provide for their day-to-day needs and sometimes what they earn is still not enough for that. 

Both  parents want Sri and all their children to get a good education, for the sake of their future. Sri is the second of three children and hopes to be the one who is expected to complete her studies. Due to family circumstances and the expectations of her parents, Sri is applying for a loan from Kiva, to help her pay for her studies. Sri is hoping to quickly finish her studies and quickly get the job she aspires to, as a captain of a ship.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus has had a dream of becoming a sailor since childhood. Agus lives in a rather remote area, far from the city. To go to school, he had a 5-km ride by public transport (bus). 

Agus has concerns that he cannot achieve his dreams. Due to economic factors hampering this family, his parents work outside the city and move from here to there, while he lives with his grandparents. His parents make every effort to help Agus achieve his desire and goal to be a trustworthy sailor. 

Through the Student Loan program from Kiva, Agus hopes to finish his education and get a job on a boat. He would be very grateful to the investors of Kiva, because thanks to their loans, he can cover the cost of college and not  waste this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Aufata

texts.en:
Aufata is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. She is growing a peanut plantation to earn a living. Aufata has requested a loan to buy sacks of peanut seeds, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, chemicals, gloves and a rake. 

She has been a member of SPBD for many years. Aufata will spend her profits to extend/improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of peanut seeds, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, chemicals, gloves and a rake.

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
Warna Sari Group resumes their borrowing from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK). To increase the price of piglets, they changed the method of maintenance. Some members still maintain a sow and the other members maintain super-quality pigs for fattening or local pigs for pork rolls. 

With this method, the sales of pigs will remain in this group only. The members who have sows, will sell their piglets to other members who raise pigs for fattening or pork rolls; the fattened pigs and pork rolls will be sold, in turn, to a big buyer.

Luh chose to maintain a sow and she will use her loan to purchase feed and to renovate the cages. She hopes this new method will work, so she and the Warna Sari group can get satisfactory results.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to renovate the pig cages.

loans.name: Massavo 5 Group

texts.fr: MASSAVO 5 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe du nom de Bernardine (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Bernardine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Bernardine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Luc. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé. Bernardine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de ménage. Pour ce faire Bernardine produit et vend du fromage (fabriqué avec du soja et du maïs) à son domicile depuis vingt cinq ans environ. Bernardine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Bernardine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO 5, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MASSAVO 5 consists of three members who form savings groups together. Their representative is Bernardine, age 46, whose hand is raised in the photo. Bernardine never went to school. She is married to a farmer named Luc and they have two children, one of whom attends school. Bernardine lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

To that end, Bernardine has been making cheese (from soy and maize) for sale from her home for some 25 years. She buys her supplies at a market in Benin. 

To better meet the needs of a growing customer base and to increase her profits, Bernardine is seeking a 4th loan from ALIDé together with the other members of MASSAVO 5. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy soy and maize to make cheese for sale.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia, 49, is married and the mother of four children. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. 

She and her husband have been farming for more than five years. This is the source of their income.

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her farm and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jesugo 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGO 5 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yèyinou 1(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 58 ans. Yèyinou 1 n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yèyinou 1 est mariée à certain Olivier. Yèyinou 1 vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour ce faire, Yèyinou 1 vend du maïs, du mil, des cossettes d'igname à son domicile depuis quarante ans. Yèyinou 1 s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Yèyinou 1 sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGO 5, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group called JESUGO 5 is made up of three women who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Yèyinou 1 (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 58 years old. 

Yèyinou 1 did not attend school. She is married to Oliver. She lives with her husband and her children. The couple share in supporting the family. In order to do that, she has been selling maize, millet, and cocoyam chips out of her house for 40 years. 

 Yèyinou 1 buys her supplies in a market in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her turnover and her income, she, together with the other members of her group,  JESUGO 5, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The prior loans were correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet and cocoyam chips

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en la zona del Paraíso. Comenzó con una papelería pequeña en la parte delantera de su casa, poco a poco fue mejorando lo que vendía y así comenzó a prosperar en su negocio. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo detergentes desde $ 1.25, papel higiénico desde $ 1.30, cuadernos, plumas. Una de sus dificultades es que es una persona con una discapacidad y esto hace que no trabaje al 100%. 

Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería, juguetes etc.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil.  She started with a small stationery store set up in the front of her house, and gradually improved what she sold, and in this way her business started to prosper.

Now she works from the early morning hours selling detergents from $1.25, toilet paper from $1.30, notebooks, and pens. One of the difficulties she faces is that she is a disabled person who is not able to work at 100%.

She has a lot of ambitions for her business, and so she wants a loan to buy notebooks, pens, stationery, toys, etc.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, stationery, and toys

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 32 years old and married. She has five children. She wants to start a small business in her community, making and selling German buns, twisties, soft drinks, and other items. To do this she needs a loan, which she will use to buy flour, soft drinks, twisties and sugar. In the future, Marina  hopes to extend and improve her business. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, soft drinks, twisties and sugar.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald, de 56 años de edad, está divorciada y vive en compañía de su hijo de 15 años en su casa propia. Ronald se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 04 años, para realizar su trabajo  se levanta muy de temprano ya que debe buscar pasajeros en las calles de su ciudad.
Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres y estar mas tiempo con su familia , además de obtener muy buenos ingresos. Ahora se siente tranquilo y cómodo ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para su vehículo tales como llantas , pernos , entre otros .
texts.en:
Ronald, 56, is divorced and lives with his 15 year-old son in his own house.  Ronald has a business providing passenger transportation services in his moto-taxi (light, 3-wheeled vehicle).  He's been doing this work for about 4 years.  To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Ronald enjoys his work, because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family.  In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings.  Now he feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income and has more free time.  This will be his 4th loan with Kiva, and he hopes that with your cooperation he will be able to carry out his plans.  He promises to make his payments on time.

With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles that he requests, he will buy spare parts for his vehicle, such as tires, bolts, etc.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle, such as tires, bolts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, butter, and sugar for her bakery

loans.name: Maribel Del Socorro

texts.es: Maribel del Socorro de 30 años de edad, acompañada y con 5 hijos todos en edad escolar, habitante de una comunidad llamada Chongo(llamada así por  un cerro de la zona). Maribel es una Joven emprendedora, logro terminar sus estudios primarios, empezó desde muy joven a matar cerdos de ahí nace los deseos crear su propio negocio, su acompañante de vida se dedica a la agricultura, uno de sus sueños es tener mas grande su negocio y que ofrezca mas variedad de productos  típicos, ya que su negocio consistes en matar los cerdos y vender la variedad, como es frito, la carne, hace nacatamales, todo el derivado del cerdo ella lo comercializa, gracias a esta iniciativa juvenil en chinandega es como Maribel tiene la posibilidad de cumplir sus metas y tener un medio de subsistencia para poder brindar alimentación y educación a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Maribel del Socorro is 30 years old, with a life partner and five school-age children. She lives in Chongo, which is named after a species of pig from this area. Maribel is a young entrepreneur who has finished primary school. Since she was young she has killed pigs. From this experience she has had a desire to start her own business. Her life partner is a farmer. One of their dreams is to have a larger business that offers a variety of local products. Currently their business involves killing pigs and selling pork products such as fried pork meat and pork nacatamales. All of the products that she sells come from the meat that she raises. Thanks to the young person’s initiative from Chinandega, Maribel has the opportunity to meet her goals and have a means to earn a living. In this way she can provide food and education for her young children.

loans.use: to start a business. She wants to buy pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Hyacinthe

texts.fr: Hyacinthe habitant au Sénégal marié père de 11 enfants dont les 3 sont à l'université , 2 sont dans des écoles professionnelles , 2 sont dans le service militaire , 3 filles sont mariées et 1 petit garçon de 1 an . Hyacinthe était un agent technique agricole , après la retraite , il a décidé de rentrer au village pour exploiter ses terres , il a fait une grande plantation de manguiers , des orangers et d’ana cardes . Il a bénéficié d'un premier crédit 150 000f soldé qui était destiner au défrichage de sa plantation . Il sollicite un nouveau crédit de 300 000f pour la culture des pastèques qui donne un bon rendement dans sa localité . Hyacinthe a comme ambition avoir un camion dans l'avenir pour le transport des fruits .
texts.en: Hyacinthe lives in Senegal. He is a married father of eleven children: three are at university, two are in professional schools, two are in the military, three daughters are married, and he has a 1-year-old son. Hyacinthe used to be an agricultural tech agent. After retiring, he decided to go back to the village to work his lands. He has a large plantation of mango, orange, and cashew trees. He has benefited from an initial loan of 150,000 francs, which was settled, for clearing his plantation. He is requesting a new loan of 300,000 francs to grow watermelons, which have good returns in his area. Hyacinthe's ambitions for the future include a truck to transport his fruits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure

loans.name: Rafael Enoc

texts.es:
El Señor Rafael es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos y leña desde hace 25 años.
Don Rafael  vende en su comunidad y demás caseríos cercanos.  El está pidiendo el préstamo para la compra de: cerdos que necesita  seguir realizando su negocio.
Don Rafael espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios para seguir desarrollando su negocio, además espera que sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto poder beneficiar el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Don Rafael espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus  hijos para que terminen los  estudios y así tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Rafael is a hardworking and honest. He lives in a community in southern Honduras along with his wife and six children. For the past twenty-five years he has been buying and selling pigs and firewood. Mr. Rafael sells to people in his community and in the neighboring areas. He is asking for this loan in order to buy the pigs that he needs to continue his business. Mr. Rafael hopes that this loan will give him the products he needs to increase his business. He hopes that his sales grow. In this way he can improve the quality of life for his family. Mr. Rafael hopes to increase his business and continue supporting his children so that they can finish their studies and have more opportunities in life. 
 
Choluteca, Honduras – May 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hard working mother and a very supportive wife who helps her husband to make a living. She is 55 years old and gifted with eight children.  The family live in a rural community and make their living through farming. So that they have an additional source of income, Magdalena is engaged in a hog-raising business. 

Her wish to make her business profitable led Magdalena to decide to take out a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She will use the loan to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Magdalena believes that her loan will enable her to make improvements in her business with the hope that someday she will make it a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years. She earns additional income by raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for the foods that she will prepare and sell. Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel is a hard-working entrepreneur who owns a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Marivel has been in this business for eight years. Marivel earns additional income from farming vegetables and running a general store.

Marivel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bienvenida is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Bienvenida has been raising pigs for eight years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pig

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fernanda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Fernanda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Fernanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Elsea

texts.en:
Elsea is 62 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elsea is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her pigpen and additional feed for her pigs.

Elsea has been in the pig fattening business for two years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pigpen and additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 48 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Honorata works very hard to provide for them.

Honorata runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, biscuits, laundry soap, eggs, candies, noodles and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Honorata has been in this business for six years. Honorata would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, eggs, laundry soap, candies and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Aracely, de 34  años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, está casada con miguel y tiene 4 hijos de 16, 10, 08 y 02  años de edad respectivamente en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Aracely es la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, etc. Para eso cuenta con una tienda instalada en su hogar, desde  donde atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial, lleva 5 años trabajando en está actividad. Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, por eso espera seguir trabajando con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, harina, etc. buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en: Aracely is hardworking and enterprising 34 year old woman who really wants to progress. She is married to Miguel and has four children ages 16, 10, 8 and 2, who live in her house. Arcely sells groceries such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. She has a store in her house, from where she sells her goods to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner. She has been doing this for the past five years. She likes to work as it allows her to be in the comfort of her home. Also the earnings help support the couple with their household expenses. She hopes to continue working and earning money. She plans to continue with her business and help it grow. This is her first loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial support. It helps her progress with her business. She is asking for a loan of 1500 new soles in order to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is looking to buy her products on a wholesale level.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is 43 years old and has a live-in partner. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income from her food vending business.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like canned goods, biscuits, and snack foods. Miguelita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her general store, like canned goods, biscuits, and snack foods

loans.name: Ulanie

texts.en:
Ulanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Ulanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough money to expand her business, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Francia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store and raising pigs.

Francia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to build her fishing, general store and pig raising businesses. Francia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by farming rice and corn in the Philippines. She has been farming rice and corn for five years, and she earns additional income by keeping a general store.

Editha is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years, and she earns additional income by selling fish and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams ofo saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, meats, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: DOÑA JUANA LLEVA YA MAS DE TRES AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN FAPE Y HA SIDO UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, DESDE HACE MAS DE DIEZ AÑOS HA MANTENIDO UN DEPOSITO DE GASEOSAS EN EL MERCADO Y TAMBIEN VENDE MEDICINA Y VITAMINAS VETERINARIAS, MUCHA GENTE DE LAS ALDEAS LLEGA A SU NEGOCIO A COMPRAR GASEOSAS POR BANDEJAS PARA VENDER EN SUS COMUNIDADES, ELLA JUNTO ASU ESPOSO LUCHAN A DIARIO PARA SALIR ADELANTE ELLOS Y ASI TAMBIEN PODER APOYAR A SUS HIJOS, DOÑA JUANA  SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE GASEOSAS POR BANDEJA, JUGOS Y PRODUCTOS VETERINARIOS.
texts.en: Juana has worked with Fape for over three years now, and has been responsible with her loan repayments. For over ten years, she has had a fizzy drinks store in the market and also sells veterinary vitamins and medicine. Many people from small villages nearby come to her business to buy crates of fizzy drinks to sell in their communities. Every day, her and her husband fight to succeed and also support their children. Juana is requesting the loan to buy crates of fizzy drinks, juices, and veterinary products.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Mao

texts.es:
Mao tiene 36 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 19 y 14 años a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades para un futuro mejor.

Día a día Mao trabaja en su pequeño negocio de afilado de discos de aserrar, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que está saliendo adelante con su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Mao está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ya que podrá comprar materiales de construcción como madera, clavos, calaminas, pintura, entre otros y así podrá mejorar su vivienda y la calidad de vida de su familia, así el seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller más grande y poder darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Mao is 36 years old and lives with his wife. Together they have two children ages 19 and 14 whom they love very much. They work very hard in order to bring a better quality of life for their children and give them more opportunities for a better future. 
Each day Mao works in his small business, sharpening round saw blades. He works about nine hours a day. He believes his business in improving because he is friendly to his customers and because he really wants to progress.
Mao is very appreciative of the loans from KIVA and he is thankful for the support that they provide as he is able to buy construction materials such as wood, nails, corrugated panels and paint among other items. In this way he can improve the quality of life for his family. He can then reach his greatest dream, “to have a larger workshop and give his son a profession”.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, corrugated panels and paint among other items.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Maritza es una persona honesta responsable y trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tamales desde hace 6 años.
Doña Martiza vende su producto a diario de manera ambulante en su comunidad. El préstamo lo necesita  para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, manteca, papas, repollo, carne, tomate, cebolla, chile, platos desechables, etc. que necesita para la elaboración de su producto. 
Doña Martiza espera  que el préstamo la beneficie mucho y así  poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien un poco en su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Martiza espera hacer crecer sus negocio y así poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mayores oportunidades en el futuro. 



Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Señora Maritza is an honest, responsible and hard-working person. She lives in a town in the south of Honduras with her husband and her two children. She has had a business making and selling tamales, a traditional corn dish filled with meat, for 6 years.
Martiza sells her food every day on the street in her town. She needs the loan to buy more food such as corn, butter, potatoes, cabbage, meat, tomatoes, onion, chili, disposable plates, etc. which she needs to make her products.
Martiza hopes that the loan will be of great use to her and that in this way she can get the ingredients she needs to keep making her products and earn more money to improve her and her family's lifestyle.
Martiza hopes to continue expanding her business and thereby continue to support her family, and that her children keep studying to become good people with better opportunities in the future. 

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, butter, potatoes, cabbage, meat, tomatoes, onion, chili, disposable plates, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Mahodo Group

texts.fr: MAHODO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Denise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Denise est âgée de 38 ans. Denise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Denise est mariée à un marchand du nom de Boniface. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Denise vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Denise et son mari assurent ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Denise vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons) et du sable lagunaire dans sa région depuis une vingtaine d’années. Denise s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Denise s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe MAHODO pour solliciter un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHODO is a group of three persons who are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Denise, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 38 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a merchant named Boniface. The couple have five children, not all in school, but all in their care. Denise lives with her husband and children. She and her husband jointly ensure that household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling food (polenta served with fish sauce) and lagoon sand in her region for about twenty years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customers demand, Denise joined with the other members of the group MAHODO to requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase corn, condiments, fish, and lagoon sand

loans.name: Juan Adrían

texts.es:
Juan tiene 25 años de edad, es padre de un hijo. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su  padre quien ya falleció. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su madre para prepararse e irse a la parcela que alquila donde pasa parte de la mañana, luego se dirige a trabajar en su vehiculo realizando viajes durante el resto del día, mientras su hijo es cuidado por un familiar  ya que el es padre soltero.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar vacas lecheras para producir leche. De esta manera, espera obtener un buen ingreso para el sustento de su madre y su hijo. Además, desea comprar un terreno para hacer su casa y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre e hijo.
texts.en:
Juan is 25 years old and the father of one son. He has worked in agriculture for several years, a trade that he learned from his father, who passed away. He gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his mother to get ready and go to the plot that he rents, where he spends part of the morning. Then he works in his vehicle making trips for the rest of the day while a relative takes care of his son, since he is a single father.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy dairy cows to produce milk. In this way, he hopes to make a good income to support his mother and his son. Additionally, he wants to buy some land to build a house and provide a better quality of life for his mother and son.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to produce milk.

loans.name: Jose Edulfo

texts.es: Jose, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Cristobal, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y hace 10 años ha cultivado dos manzanas de café. Siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes e insumos para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café, ya que es la única manera de poder sacar buenas cosechas. Su plan es mejorar los cultivos para poder arreglar su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Jose is 28 years old, married, with four children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of San Cristobal, Lempira. He has always worked as a farmer. For the past ten years he has been growing coffee. He does this in order to earn money. He sells his product in the local market. He is asking for this loan of 20,000 Lempiras in order to buy fertilizers and supplies to be used to maintain his coffee plantation. This is the only way he can have a good harvest. His plan is to improve his crops so that he can fix his home and provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies to be used for the maintenance of his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds, chemicals, a weed sprayer, fertilizer, a wheel barrow and rake.

loans.name: Manila

texts.en:
Manila is a 34-year-old, married woman, with six children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Manila has requested a loan to buy more vegetable seeds, chemicals, a weed sprayer, fertilizer, gloves, and a rake. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. 

Manila hopes to gain good profits from her garden to be able to support her family and children.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds, chemicals, a weed sprayer, fertilizer, gloves, and a rake.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan est constitué de quatre  femmes  toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Ouolofobougou en commune III du district de Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le marché de Ouolofobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments, fruits et légumes  (tomate, oignons, chou, gombo et autres). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de travailler avec  Soro Yiriwaso où ils sont à leur 1ier prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (Femme assise devant habillée en vert  avec un chou à la main) a une grande réputation dans la vente des fruits et légumes dans le marché de Ouolofobougou. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 2 sacs d’oignons, 1 panier de tomate et 1 panier de choux. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Kati  et au marché.  La revente s’effectue en détail au marché du quartier, au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata  compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et réinvestir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour atteinte ses objectifs d’augmentation du volume de son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkan Group is made up of four women all married and living in polygamous households. They have an average age of 35 years and and average of two children. They all live in the Ouolofobougou quarter in community III of the Bamako district (capital of Mali). They know one another through their trade businesses in the Ouolofobougou market. The members of the group have small businesses selling vegetable sauces, fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, onions, cabbage, okra and others). In order to increase their business capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso where they are on their first group loan.

Aminata (shown in the photo dressed in green, with a cabbage in hand) has a great reputation a a merchant of fruit and vegetables in the Ouolofobougou market. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of onions, one basket of tomatoes and one basket of cabbages. She purchases her merchandise in the town of Kati and at the market. She sells her goods at retail and for cash in the local market, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Aminata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 40,000 Francs CFA, part of which she will use to pay for the daily needs of her children, and the remainder of which she will use to reinvest in her business. Aminata relies very much on the partnership of Soro Yiriwaso to attain her objective of increasing the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and heads of cabbage.

loans.name: Aviwiwe Jesuton Group

texts.fr: AVIWIWE JESUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et ont un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe, nommée Gisèle (est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Gisèle est mariée à un certain Casimir. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Gisèle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Gisèle vend des bois de chauffage et divers articles à son domicile depuis dix ans. Gisèle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Gisèle s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe AVIWIWE JESUTON pour solliciter un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AVIWIWE JESUTON is a group of three persons whose members are friends or are related. The group's representative, Gisèle (the one in the photo with her hand raised) is 39 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a man named Casimir. The couple have four children, not all in school, and all are in their care. Gisèle lives with her husband and children. She and her husband jointly ensure that household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling firewood and various goods out of her home for ten years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demand, Gisèle joined with the other members of the group AVIWIWE JESUTON to request a sixth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: SISSIGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Emma (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Emma a très peu fréquenté l’école. Emma est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Emma vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Emma vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc et des emballages vides de façon ambulante depuis vingt-cinq ans. Emma s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Emma s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe SISSIGBE pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SISSIGBE is a group of four persons whose members are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Emma (the one in the photo with her hand raised) is 35 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a man named Pierre. The couple have six children, not all in school, and four are in their care. Emma lives with her husband and children. She and her husband jointly ensure that household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling corn, cassava flour, and packaging material by going door to door for 25 years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demand, Emma joined with the other members of the group SISSIGBE to request a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cassava flour, and packaging material

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama habite au Sénégal âgée de 56 ans mère de famille.Elle évolue dans la vente de friperie depuis 5 ans , elle démarre sa journée de 8h à 19h .Mariama avait bénéficié d'un 1er crédit de 150 000f qu'elle a soldé sans difficulté . Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de 150 000f pour acheter de la friperie qu'elle revende au marché de sa localité .A l'avenir,elle souhaite avec l'aide de l'imcec augmenter ses revenus pour pouvoir diversifier sa marchandise
texts.en: Mariama lives in Senegal.  She is a 56-year-old mother who has been selling used clothes for the past five years.  She works from 8AM until 7PM.  Mariama has already received a first loan of 150,000 francs which she has repaid without any difficulty.  She is requesting a new loan of 150,000 francs to buy used clothing that she will resell at the local market.  In the future, she would like to increase her income, with the help of the UIMCEC, in order to be able to diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Serapia

texts.en:
Serapia is a coconut wine vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three grown-up children. 

Serapia has been in the loan program for more than 11 years now. Serapia is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana is a 55-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a chef by profession. He provides cooking services for weddings and other family functions. He wants to purchase large food preparation bowls for his business. However, due to the lack of financing he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, as a member of this three-person borrowing group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use her share of the loan funds to obtain the bowls for her husband, and this will help him to continue his work. Rehana and her husband are thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase large food preparation bowls, for her husband's catering business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 23 years old and married. She has two children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns income by selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional items to sell, like soap, canned goods, milk, sugar, and spices. Salvacion has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money, for expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, can goods, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 47 years old, married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Celia has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Celia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Celia would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a 48-year-old married mother of three, has been engaged in pig fattening in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having borrowed and repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business, she has requested a new one for PHP 20000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Eva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Full Bank Group

texts.es: Edón, quien aparece hincado en medio de la foto con chaqueta clara, participa en el Banco Comunal Full Bank, que está ubicado en Villarrica Región de la Araucanía en Chile. En Full Bank hay negocios como los de artesanos, comerciantes personas que trabajan el campo, y hacen fletes. Y Edón es artesano en madera, lo es hace más o menos 30 años, ya que él es profesor, pero al jubilarse opto por seguir su amor que es la artesanía en madera, ya que es un trabajo tranquilo y puedo hacerlo y tallar en la comodidad de su hogar. Además con el dinero que ha ganado con su artesanía puede suplir algunas necesidades que no suple el dinero de su jubilación. Edón necesita el dinero para comprar madera insumos y algunas herramientas que necesita, y estima que no le irá mal ya que luego comienzan las vacaciones de invierno e irán muchos turistas a Villarrica. Comenta que lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar en Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder conocer distintas historias de vida y los amigos que ha podido encontrar en su grupo además de destacar la tremenda confianza que existe entre todos ellos.
texts.en: Edón, who you see kneeling in the middle of the photo with the light colored jacket, participates in the communal bank called Full Bank, which is located in the Villarica region of Araucanía in Chile. The members of Full Bank have businesses such as crafts, farming and freight transportation. Edón is a woodworker. He has been doing this work for about thirty years. He was a teacher. When he retired he decided to follow his love of woodworking, as it is a tranquil business that he can do from the comfort of his home. Also, from the money that he earns from his craft, he can provide for necessities that he can’t afford with his retirement income. Edón needs this loan in order to buy wood supplies and some tools that he needs for his job. It is also not so bad that the winter vacation is arriving and many tourists will come to Villarica. He has told us that he likes to work with the Hope Foundation as it gives him insights into the life histories of others. He has been impressed with the tremendous support exhibited by his many friends in the group

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 58 years old, married, and has eight children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as meat, food supplies, and a lot more. She has been doing this for six years.

Aiga needs a loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, salt, onions, snacks, and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids, and also to improve the quality of the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009, to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory, including sacks of rice, sugar, flour, salt, onions, snacks, and soft drinks

loans.name: Filomega

texts.en:
Filomega is 31 years old and married, with three children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as meats, tinned products, food supplies, and a lot more. She has been doing this for six years. 

Filomega needs a loan to buy tinned food, rice, sugar, salt, soy sauce, chicken legs, and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and children and also to create a better quality of her business. 

She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy tinned food, rice, sugar, salt, soy sauce, chicken legs, and snacks.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.ru: Чафару 49 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей и одна дочь. Чафар со своей семьей проживает в городе Дангара. Двое старших его сыновей находятся на заработках в России, третий сын помогает ему в деятельности, а дочь занимается хозяйственными делами по дому. Чафар имеет среднее техническое образование. Он по специальности водитель и проработал 8 лет в этой сфере. Последние 5 лет Чафар занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупно-рогатый скот у себя во дворе дома и после откорма продает на местном рынке. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа коров и телят, чтобы продолжить свою работу по купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Jafar is 49 years old.  He is married.  He has three sons and one daughter.  Jafar and his family live in the city of Dangara.  Two of his older sons are working in Russia, the third is helping him with the business, and the daughter is involved in household work at home.  Jafar has a secondary technical education.  He is a driver by trade and spent 8 years working in this field.  Jafar has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 5 years.  He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells it at a local market.  He is requesting this loan to buy cows and calves in order to continue his work in buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten up and resell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI    est constitué de 6  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de friperie, des habillements, etc. 
FATOUMATA, est la première femme arrêtée de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente d’habillements de friperie et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 colis de friperie avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group consists of six married women averaging 36 years of age and four children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the district of MASSABLACOURA, city of Bougouni. They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through their trade activities. They sell apparel, second-hand clothing, etc.

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to strengthen their working capital and better run their business activities. This is their first loan. 

FATOUMATA, standing first at the far right, buys and sells second-hand clothing. She will use her loan to buy three bales of second-hand clothing from Bamako wholesalers. She conducts her retail sales at the market and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA, which she will use to invest in her activity and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Germilita

texts.en:
Germilita works hard to support her family. She is married, and she engages in a business of buying and selling livestock, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Germilita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional livestock to resell. She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business. Germilita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to resell

loans.name: Alsana

texts.en:
Alsana is 44 years old and married with four children.

Alsana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles and spices etc.

Alsana has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from a welding shop.

Alsana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as soap, canned goods, milk, soap, noodles and spices etc.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. She has four children and has been doing this work for fifteen years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming as 'rearing poultry.'  Her biggest challenge is 'access to agricultural finance.'  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelgina.'

Dina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'I joined Juhudi following the success of other Juhudi members.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she said 'I learnt how I could boost my production and income from funding from Juhudi.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family?' Dina replied 'it will boost my poultry project by increasing production and income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dina owns the following: a cow and poultry but she does not own 'pigs, pumps, bicycles, motorcycles or automobiles'.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 45 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Librada has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. Librada has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

Librada has been in this business for four years. In the future, Librada would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 50 años de edad, es casada. Posee 10 años de experiencia en la venta de comida, la cual tiene de forma propia junto a su hija. Los insumos para elaborar los deliciosos alimentos,  los compra en el mercado municipal de la ciudad y en las comerciales, de la ganancia que deja la venta del día anterior la señora deja para invertir el siguiente día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una ramada frente a su casa para sacar la comida afuera; ya que por el motivo que el sol da de frente a su casa la señora solo hace comida para llevar y quiere tener también para comer ahí mismo, debido a que hay clientes que desean comer ahí pero no puede por lo inadecuado que tiene su espacio para la venta. Con la inversión, tendrá mejor su negocio para atender más clientes,  hacer crecer su negocio  y podrá tener mas gente trabajando con ella.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old and she is married. She has been selling food for 10 years with the help of her daughter. She buys the supplies to elaborate her delicious food at the municipal market of her town and from other stores. She uses the profit from the previous day to invest in the following day's supplies.
She is asking for a loan from the field partner, Fundacion Campo, in order to build a shelter outside her house so she can sell her food there. The sun shines directly on her house, so Ana can only sell food to take away. She wants to have a place where customers can eat their food, because some of them would like to eat there but they can't due to the inadequacy of Ana's selling space.
