With this investment, Ana will improve her business. She will be able to take care of more customers, grow her business and have more people working for her.

loans.use: to build a shelter outside her house to sell her food outdoors.

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан живет в районе Кубадиён. Ему 59 лет. Он женат и является отцом семерых сыновей. Хусан имеет высшее образование. Он работает учителем математики в сельской школе. Так как его заработная плата очень маленькая, а семеыне расходы велики, он решил заняться одновременно новым бизнесом. Ему интересна животноводческая деятельность. Он намерен заняться куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома и у него не будут дорожные расходы на эту деятельность. К тому же у него есть все необходимые условия для разведения скота. С намерением начать бизнес, Хусан запрашивает кредит для закупа 5 голов крупнорогатого скота и их корма.
texts.en: Husan lives in the Qubadiyon district.  He is 59 years old.  He is married and a father of seven sons.  Husan has a higher education.  He works as a mathematics teacher at a village school.  Because his salary is very low, and family expenses are high, he decided to simultaneously get involved in a new business.  He is interested in an animal husbandry business.  He intends to get involved in buying and selling cattle.  The livestock market is located near his house; thus, he will not have travel expenses in this business.  Additionally, he has all of the necessary conditions for breeding livestock.  Husan is requesting this loan to buy five heads of cattle and feed for them in order to start his business.

loans.use: to buy five heads of cattle and feed for them in order to start his business

loans.name: Alfina

texts.ru: Алфина является фермером и садоводом. Она уже повторно обращатеся за кредитом для своей деятельности. Первый свой кредит Алфина брала для закупа саженцев и минеральных удобрений. Она в своем саду посадила фруктовые деревья абрикоса и миндалья, которые в ближайщее будущее дадут свои плоды. Сейчас Алфина снова запрашивает кредит. В сезон посева она посеяла на большом земельном участке арбузы, помидоры и подсолнечник. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения. Благодаря кредиту ее урожай будет высшего качества и доходы ее семьи увеличатся.
texts.en: Alfina is a farmer and a gardener.  This is her repeat loan request for her business.  She took out her first loan to purchase seedlings and mineral fertilizers.  She planted apricot and almond fruit trees, the fruits of which will soon ripen, in her garden.  Now Alfina is requesting another loan.  She planted watermelons, tomatoes and sunflowers on a large land plot during the sowing season.  She wants to use this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.  Thanks to the loan, her harvest will be of high quality, and her family's income will increase.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for the watermelon and tomato harvests

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA  est constitué de 5  femmes  mariées et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiment à l’image de KEBE, qui  est la seule femme assise dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,1500Kg de grains de néré avec les grossistes de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group consists of five married women and one widow. On average, these women are 48 years old and have four children each.  They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, in the Massablacoura neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.  They know each other through neighborhood, friendship and business ties.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to strengthen their financial capacity and to better run their businesses.  This is their fourth loan with the institution.  Their three previous loans have been duly repaid.

These women, including Kebe (the featured borrower), sell condiments.  In the photo, Kebe is the only woman sitting.  She plans to use her loan to buy 1,500 kg of néré fruits from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She sells her merchandise at the market and from home, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women.

Kebe is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy néré fruits.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABALI  est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur sixième prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de  MARIAM, qui est la première femme arrêtée de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1800 Kilos de maïs avec les grossistes de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The SABALI group consists of five married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the district of MASSABLACOURA, city of Bougouni. They know one another as neighbors and friends, and through their trade activities. They sell cereals.

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to strengthen their working capital and better run their business activities. This is their 6th loan cycle, and all previous loans were correctly repaid. 

MARIAM, standing first from the right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 1800 kg of maize from Bougouni wholesalers. She conducts her retail sales at the market and from her home, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA, which she will use to invest in her activity and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Emilce Del Socorro

texts.es: Emilce de 56 años de edad, es madre de un hijo, debido sus grandes responsabilidades en el hogar, decidió montar un negocio en su casa con el fin de generar ingresos que le permitieran sostener su hogar y brindarle educación a su hijo. Desea posicionar su almacén en el sector con el fin incrementar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Emilce is a 56-year-old mother of one child. Due to her considerable home responsibilities, she decided to start a business from her house. This business will generate income, which will allow her to maintain her home and provide an education for her child. Positioning her small store in an area where she can increase her earnings will allow her to have a better quality of life. She is asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise, which will increase her earnings and also the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es: Don Marco, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de las Flores, Lempira. El tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, actualmente cuenta con cultivos de café en la propiedad de su casa. La producción la vende a intermediarios o a los beneficios de café. Ha mantenido bien sus cultivos mediante la inversión de prestamos, actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras, y los invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y limpieza. Su plan es seguir ampliando su cultivo para obtener mayor producción e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Marco, 59, is married and has two children.  He lives in a village in the Las Flores municipality, Lempira.  He’s been working in agriculture for more than 20 years.  He currently grows coffee on his home property.  He sells his harvest to middle-men or to coffee cooperatives.  He’s kept his crops well by means of loans and is currently asking for his third loan for 25,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fertilizer and manure and for the weeding.  His plan is to continue expanding his crop to obtain higher yields and income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to weed his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Upulasi

texts.en:
Upulasi is 49 years old and married, with three children. She runs a small business selling barbecued food in her community and she has been doing this for three years. 

Upulasi has requested a loan to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, a barbecue maker, a gas bottle, soy sauce, onions, ginger, and salt. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Upulasi plans to improve her food production business for her customers' satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy sausages, chicken, mutton flaps, a barbecue maker, a gas bottle, soy sauce, onions, ginger, and salt.

loans.name: Leyla Jaqueline

texts.es:
Leyla tiene 30 años, es madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales daría la vida con tal de verlos felices y que puedan cumplir sus sueños, Leyla es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades y por ello cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder ir a su centro de trabajo. Leyla trabaja en un fundo de su ciudad como obrera empacadora, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día; Leyla cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Leyla está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá iniciar su negocio de venta de salchipapas, ya que podra comprar un pequeño carrito sanguchero y insumos como platos descartables al por mayor, tenedores, salseros, entre otros, así ella podrá tener un ingreso extra para su hogar y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Leyla, 30, is the mother of two children who are 11 and 5 years of age who she loves  very much and for whom she’d give her life to see them happy and reaching their dreams.  Leyla’s a young woman who very much wants to get ahead despite adversities and to do so rises very early every day to head for work.  Leyla works as a packer in a local large agricultural estate.  She works about 9 hours a day and Leyla believes she’s getting ahead because she’s responsible and above all because she has a strong drive to get ahead.

Leyla’s very grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide because thanks to their great help she’ll be able to start a business selling ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with fried sausages] because she’ll be able to buy a small fast-food cart and supplies like disposable dishes, forks, sauce containers and others, at wholesale.  In this way she’ll have extra income for her home and she can continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic staple items.

loans.name: Ñanduti Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ñanduti está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres,  5 de ellas están por debajo de la pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, eso es posible saber gracias a la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que están haciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella mejorara su situación de pobreza, además de eso, con la venta de prendas que hace es que trata de mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prenda de vestir tales como remeras, shorts, pantalones, vestidos, camisillas. etc lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Ñanduti group is in its 3rd cycle of the women's committee programme. Five of them live below the poverty line, i.e. with very low incomes. It is possible to determine this from the poverty elimination survey which they are carrying out.

One of the members is Teresa, who was found to have a poverty level within level one in the latest survey, i.e. with very low income.  However, she knows that by effort and working continually and by showing the essential characteristics of a successful woman, she will improve her poverty situation. Moreover, by selling clothing she is trying to improve her own and her family's life. 

Teresa is asking for this loan to buy clothing such as knit tops, shorts, trousers, dresses and sleeveless tops etc. which will help her to set up her business plan. This will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy knit tops, shorts, trousers, dresses, sleeveless tops etc.

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu  is married and has 2 children. She went to school but only to primary school because her parents did not see the need of educating a girl child. Muniratu hawks and sells cosmetics at Santrokofi, Hohoe and its surrounding communities. She has being doing this now for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. Muniratu uses her income to help her husband to provide food for the home and to sew school uniforms for their children. Muniratu will use the loan to purchase different type of body creams, powders, silver plates and bowls. With the new profits from her expanded business, Muniratu plans to save to expand her business and also to acquire a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase different types of body creams, powders, silver plates and bowls.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes as a hairdresser in Esiam (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Efua is married and has 2 children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Efua wants to use her loan to purchase more hair products and hair accessories, hence allowing her to increase her client base. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase more hair products and hair accessories

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a mobile miller at Ve-Agbome, Hohoe. He has received education but only to junior high school. He is divorced with one child. He is responsible for all the financial needs of his family. 

James has been a miller for 5 years. He cracks the palm nuts to remove the shells for the preparation of palm kernel oil. (The traditional oil extraction method is to simply heat the dried nuts to release the palm kernel oil. The released oil is skimmed from the top of the nuts. This process is continued until all the oil is skimmed out of the palm kernel.) 

The shelling used to be performed manually using two stones to crack each nut to separate the kernel and shell.
 
His loan will be used to repair his mill and buy other accessories. He is also planning to buy unprocessed rice from the local farmers and sell it to the market women. He hopes to save the new profits from his expanded business to enable him get enough capital to acquire a new mill.

loans.use: to repair his mill and buy other accessories.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua is married and has three children. She has never received any formal schooling. 

Afua sells food ingredients at Ve-Wudome, Hohoe, and its surrounding communities, which she has done for 12 years now. Her husband is a farmer. Afua uses her income to support her husband with the basic needs of the home. 

Afua will use the loan to purchase different types of food ingredients for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afua plans to save to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase different types of food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Francisca Jeanette

texts.es: La Joven Francisca de 26 años de edad habitante de la comunidad el chonco (llamado así por un cerro de la zona), casada con dos hijos uno en edad escolar y el otro de dos años, su esposo perdió el empleo, por lo cual ella es el único sustento de su casa, Francisca es una joven emprendedora la cual apenas termino sus estudios primarios, adquirió conocimientos de su mamá y empezó vendiendo cajetas que ella preparaba, siempre con el objetivo de ayudar a su esposo, es una joven con muchos deseos de superación y con metas las cuales necesita lograr pero sin la oportunidad de un crédito es imposible lograrlo, gracias a las iniciativas juveniles en chinandega es como ella ahora tiene la oportunidad de optar a un financiamiento para inicio de su negocio que es abrir una pulpería la cual es un sueños.
texts.en:
Young Francisca, 26, lives in the community of El Chonco (so called because of a hill in the zone).  She’s married and has two children, one who is school age and another who is two-years-old. Her husband lost his job so she’s her home’s only source of support.

Francisca’s a young entrepreneur who barely completed elementary school.  She learned her skills from her mother and started selling sweets she prepared herself always aiming at helping her husband.  She’s a young woman with a strong wish for self-improvement and with goals she needs to reach but that are impossible to do so without access to credit.  Thanks to youth initiatives in Chinandega she can now access financing to start the business of her dreams: to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, que trabajó a los largo de su vida buscando progresar sin descanso. Esta casada con Roque y vive cómodamente en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Rosa se dedica a la agricultura por está razón siembra plátanos, yucas, cacao, entre otros. Se inicio hace más de 20 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de esposo pero a veces en tiempo de cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar. Actualmente su actividad le está dando muy buenos resultados y le deja muy buenas ganancias. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo económico que recibe para seguir adelante con su negocio , por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. 
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48, is a hardworking, dedicated woman who worked all through her life seeking to make progress tirelessly.  She’s married to Roque and lives comfortably in her own house with her husband and children who are all adults now.  

Rosa works in agriculture growing bananas, manioc, cocoa beans and others.  She started more than 20 years ago and to date continues doing so with her husband’s help.  Sometimes during harvest, though, she hires local laborers.

Her activity is having very good results at present and is producing good profits.  This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the economic support she gets to stay in business; because of this she promises to make her payments punctually.  She will use the 2,500 new soles to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Edgar Rolando

texts.es:
EDGAR tiene 21 años de edad es soltero  no tiene hijos, vive con los padres  en el Cantón Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

Edgar trabaja en una carpinterìa es ayudante. Solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina, un refrigerador. 

Con la ayuda del crèdito podrà comprar los electrodomèsticos que tanta falta le hace en la casa. 

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es  la competencia. en el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en: Edgar, 21, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Chimbo Canton, Bolívar Province.  Edgar works as an assistant in a carpentry shop.  He’s asking for the loan to buy a stove and a refrigerator.  With help from the loan he’ll be able to buy home appliances that are so needed at home.  His dream is to improve his standard of living.  The challenge he faces is competition and he enjoys playing volleyball in his free time.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Faccha Sisa

texts.es:
FACCHA tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo de 2 años, Vive con el hijo y con los padres, en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

FACCHA SISA sisa se dedica a la agricultura a siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de alimento como balanceado de engorde y crianza para los animales y abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito quiere tener sus propias cosas.

El sueño de ella es tener un poco mas de tierras para seguir sembrando.
En su tiempos libres le gusta salir con las amigas a caminar.
texts.en:
Faccha is 20 years old.  She is single and she has a two-year-old son.  She lives with her son and with her parents in the city of Guaranda in Bolívar Province. 

The “Tagma Rumiñahui” communal bank is made up of 14 members and is almost 25 minutes from the San Simón office.  The members work in agriculture and livestock.

Faccha Sisa works in agriculture, planting corn and breeding chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to purchase balanced feed for fattening and raising the animals as well as manure and fertilizers for the crops.  With the support of the loan she hopes to have her own things.

Her dream is to have a little more land to continue planting.

In her free time she likes to go out walking with friends.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for fattening and raising the animals, manure and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. She has four children and has been doing this work for two years. Her primary income sources are eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Keeping dairy cows." Her biggest challenge is access to finance. Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Everlyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, '"I chose Juhudi following the success of other Juhudi members."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and said, 'I learnt how a farmer could acquire assets through micro-finance institutions."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit her family, Everlyne replied, "I will purchase a dairy animal."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Everlyne owns poultry but does not own a cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net in the household but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad caracterizada por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de manzana, maíz, frejoles, entre otros. Maria es una joven con muchas aspiraciones, sobre todo porque es madre soltera y su pequeña hija tiene 4 años de edad, y es su mayor adoración y sobre todo lucha mucho cada día para poder brindarle una vida digna y sobre todo para que su pequeña sea una persona de bien.

Cada día Maria trabaja como empleada en una casa, ella realiza las labores de limpieza, asimismo en ocasiones trabajaba ofreciendo menús (comida) y con el fruto de su trabajo saca adelante a su hija a pesar de las adversidades y problemas que se presentan; Maria cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo honrada.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una  maquina de cocer con lo cual podrá mejorar su pequeño negocio de confección y reparación de prendas de vestir, de esta manera ella podrá tener un ingreso extra y con ello seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Darle una profesión a su hija y tener un gran negocio de confección de prendas”.
texts.en:
María, 35, lives in the city of Imperial, which has a warm and welcoming climate and where agriculture flourishes, especially apple, corn, bean, and other crops.  María's a young woman with a lot of goals because she's the single mother of a young daughter, 4, whom she adores.  She strives a lot every day to be able to give her daughter a decent life so she can be an honorable person.

María works every day as a domestic employee.  She cleans and sometimes cooks.  She gets her daughter ahead with the fruit of her labor despite the adversities and problems that come up.  María believes she's getting ahead because she's very responsible and above all because she's honest.

María's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a sewing machine to improve her small business making and mending clothing.  This way she'll have an extra income to continue striving to make her biggest dream a reality: "To give her daughter a profession and have a big tailoring business."

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Bakil

texts.en: Bakil is a 28-year-old man, living in a rented house in Sana`a, Yemen. He is employed, getting a low salary. He has a financial problem in that his salary isn`t enough to cover his family's expenses. He is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy furniture to use in his house. He is planning to open a retail store to make sure that his income is good enough to cover his expenses and own a house.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Lloysi

texts.es:
Lloysi tiene 60 años, vive con su esposo, su hijo y sus dos nietos en su casa propia. Lloysi se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en su hogar. También se dedica a la agricultura por esta razón siembra tomate, maíz, fríjol, etc., en un terreno que tiene a lado de su casa. Gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia pudo salir adelante y tener un negocio estable que le ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Lloysi espera seguir creciendo e ir mejorando para ampliar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. 
Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.
Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral. El monto de S/.2000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para aumentar sus sembríos de tomate y maíz y para comprar productos comestibles por su tienda.
texts.en:
Lloysi, 60, lives in her own home with her husband, her son, and 2 grandchildren.  She has a business selling food products from her house.  She also works in agriculture, cultivating tomatoes, corn, beans, etc., on some land at the side of her house.  Thanks to her efforts, and the support of her family, she has been able to make progress and have a stable business that helps her to improve her family's quality of life.  Lloysi hopes to continue to grow and expand her business and her sales.

This is Lloysi's first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for this opportunity to obtain a line of credit that will be very useful for her work.  She will invest the sum of 2,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of seeds to expand her plantings of tomatoes and corn, and to buy food products for her store.

loans.use: to buy tomato and corn seeds, and to buy food products for her store

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba prepares and sells ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste) in her village of Putubiw (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 5 children. Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Banku’ sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fruits in Ankaful  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for eight years. Esi is married and has two children. Her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fruit, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fruit

loans.name: Pepertual

texts.en:
Pepertual is a widow and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Pepertual is a successful businesswoman. She sells jewelry in Ankaful  (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Pepertual uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Pepertual will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of jewelry, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Pepertual plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of jewelry.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Even though Rose grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Rose is an entrepreneur. She sells a local drink in Ankaful (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began ten years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. 

Rose has identified that there are growing demands among customers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs, due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to make the drink. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make the drink.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cosmetics in Ankaful  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Araba is married but has no children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Araba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cosmetics. 

In the long term, Araba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cosmetics.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es: Natividad tiene 33 años, es casada y vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Natividad se dedica a la venta de comidas y refrescos. Toda su vida a tenido experiencia en este servicio, el cual le ayudo en ganar un kiosco en un concurso. Este negocio le ha ayudado a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Gracias al concurso logro una oportunidad para hacer esto. Espera seguir creciendo y mejorar su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio y así mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Para Natividad este es el primer crédito con Kiva por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido que le dará el capital para mejorar su negocio. El monto solicitado de S/.1500.00 lo invertirá en implementar su negocio en productos como arroz, carnes, verduras, entre otros.
texts.en:
Natividad, 33, is married living in her own house with her husband and two children.  Natividad works selling food and refreshments.  She’s had experience in this type of service her entire life and it helped her to win a kiosk in a contest.  This business has helped her increase her income and improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Thanks to the contest she attained an opportunity to do this.  She hopes to continue growing and improving her business in order to offer better service and improve sales and income.

This is Natividad’s first Kiva loan and she’s grateful for the economic support she’s getting that will provide the capital needed to improve her business.  The amount of 1,500 soles she’s asking for will be used to stock her business with products like rice, meats and vegetables, among others.

loans.use: to build a good infrastructure and to buy rice, meat and vegetables for her food stall.

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es: Sintia tiene 46 años, está casada, y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijas. Sintia se dedica a la venta de bebidas, una actividad que aprendió de su mama, apoyándola en la venta. Gracias a la experiencia que tenía y a su esposo logro abrir su propio bar. Sintia y su esposo emprendieron un nuevo proyecto dedicado a la compra y venta de cacao, como están en época de cosecha, es su esposo quien todas las mañana se dirige a sus terrenos a recolectar el fruto, y Sintia se dedique principalmente a atender el bar. Como una mujer emprendedora espera que su negocio siga creciendo y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio y un buen producto a sus clientes. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral. El monto de S/.1500 soles lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza, gaseosas, ron, etc. para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Sintia, 46, is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their daughters. She makes a living selling beverages. She learned about this business from her mother, whom she used to help make sales. Thanks to this experience and to her husband, she managed to open her own bar. 

Sintia and her husband started up a new project buying and selling cocoa. Since they are in the harvest season, her husband heads out to the fields every morning to collect the fruit, and Sintia is mainly responsible for attending to the bar. As an enterprising woman, she hopes that her business continues to grow and that she can continue to offer a good service and good products to her clients. 

This is her first loan with Kiva. She is very grateful for the opportunity to obtain a line of credit, which will be very useful for her work performance. She will invest this loan of 1500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of beer, soft drinks, rum, etc. to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks, and other beverages for her business.

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal  “Las Malvinas” está conformado por 10 socios responsables, que busca cada día mejorar. Este es el caso de Rebeca una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada con 03 hijos. Para salir adelante y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia Rebeca se ha dedicado a distintas actividades como al servicio de cocina y limpieza. Actualmente se viene desempeñando al  servicio de lavado de ropa, siendo sus mayores clientes vecinos de su zona. Rebeca se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó  el crédito pues  comprará una lavadora, y de esta manera facilitar su trabajo. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. El grupo “Las Malvinas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Rebeca es la segunda del lado derecho y viste casaca color ploma. Rosa no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Las Malvinas” communal bank has 10 responsible members who seek to improve more every day.  This is Rebeca’s case.  She’s 45-years-old, married and has three children.  In order to get ahead and provide better quality of life for her family, Rebeca has carried out a variety of activities like cooking and cleaning.  She currently is providing laundry services and her main customers are local neighbors in her zone.  Rebeca feels happy because thanks to her work she’s been able to help support her children’s schooling.

Aiming at continuing to improve she requested the loan because she’ll buy a washing machine that will make her work easier.  Her greatest wish is to see her children become fulfilled professionals.  The Las Malvinas group thanks Kiva lenders for the support provided.  Rebeca is second from the right wearing a gray jacket.  Rosa was unable to be present due to work.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy adhesive, foam, paint, and flower vases.

loans.name: Kenia Jisela

texts.es:
La Señora Kenia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y golosinas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Kenia vende sus productos desde su casa de habitación. El préstamo ocupa para la compra de más materia prima como ser: maíz, cal, leña, carne, papas, repollo, platos desechables, condimentos, refrescos, etc. que necesita para la elaboración de su producto y tener para la venta.
Doña Kenia espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto, además espera que esta inversión le genere un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar tener más ingresos que le ayuden a mejor un poco su estilo de vida y el su familia.
Doña Kenia espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo 2013
texts.en:
Kenia is a very hardworking, responsible person living in a community in southern Honduras with her two children.  Her business is making and selling tortillas and snacks; she’s been in business for five years.  Kenia sells her products from home.  She needs the loan to buy more raw materials like corn, lime powder, firewood, meat, potatoes, cabbage, disposable plates, condiments, soft-drinks, etc. needed to make her product and to have available for sale.

Kenia hopes that the loan will be of much help to her because she does not have the necessary ingredients to continue making her product on hand.   In addition, she hopes this investment will generate an increase in sales so that her income will increase too and her and her family’s standard of living will improve a bit as a result.  Kenya hopes to continue supporting her children’s schooling so that they will have better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy ingredients and soft-drinks for her business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling porridge in Effutuakwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. Abena is married and has 10 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Abena wants to use her loan to purchase ingredients to make porridge, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of porridge. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make porridge, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of porridge

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Even though Elizabeth grew up in poverty without an education, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She sells gari, porridge, and phone credit in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 1 year ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 3 children. Elizabeth has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more gari, porridge, and phone credit to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more gari, porridge, and phone credit to sell

loans.name: Elia Rosa

texts.es: Elia de 62 años es una gran confeccionista que habita al suroccidente de la ciudad. Ella con 40 años de experiencia en la costura de ropa, aprendió de su madre el oficio, en el que ella manifestaba su mayor inclinación. Por eso en el año 1972 emprendió su propia aventura de negocios  de manera empírica tanto en el conocimiento técnico como en el empresarial. En su taller Elia realiza todas las operaciones de la confección en su taller desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche,  las líneas de ropa para damas como blusas, vestidos y camisas y pantalones para caballeros. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado y su principal mercado está ubicado en el barrio donde habita y en sus aledaños. Elia tiene una meta y es la de tener una buena infraestructura técnica y aumentar la producción. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una máquina plana industrial y tela botones, hilos e insumos para producir camisas pantalones y vestidos para damas y con ello lograr su meta principal y continuar teniendo muchos mas sueños de prosperidad y progreso para ella y su familia y justamente es este justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
62-year-old Elia is a great clothing manufacturer who lives in the southwest of the city.  She has 40 years of experience in sewing clothing, a job that she learned from her mother and for which she expressed great inclination.  Because of this, in the year 1972 she began her own business adventure in an empirical manner, both in business and technical knowledge.  

Elia carries out all the operations of dressmaking in her workshop from 7:00 in the morning to 7:00 at night.  The clothing styles for women include blouses, dresses, and shirts; and pants for men.  She makes her sales by credit and cash only, and her main market is located in the neighborhood where she lives and in its vicinity.  

She has a goal, and that is to have good technical infrastructure and to increase production.  This is the reason for which she turned to a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Through this she will buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, buttons, thread, and supplies for making shirts, pants, and dresses for women; and achieve her main goal and continue having many more dreams of prosperity and progress for herself and her family from the success of Kiva credit.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, buttons, thread, and supplies for producing shirts, pants, and dresses for women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies in order to improve his housing.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Evelyn from Mutare, the capital of Minicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is a single parent with four children and one is attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Evelyn runs a retail business which sells clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that of late payments from clients who buy on credit. Evelyn has requested a loan of $600 in order to buy blankets, tracksuits, bags and boots to resell this winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Evelyn plans to own some business properties.

loans.use: to buy winter wear to resell in urban and peri-urban areas around Mutare.

loans.name: Divine Favour Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! 

This is 49 year-old Patricia from Mutare. Patricia is a member of the Divine Favour Group. She is widowed with six children and two are attending school. Patricia runs a retail business selling televisions, radios and refrigerators. The business has been in operation for 12 years. She says the main challenge she is facing is that of high import duties on electrical goods. Patricia has requested a loan of $800 in order to buy electrical gadgets to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to school and to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Patricia plans to operate her shops in several towns in Zimbabwe.

loans.use: To buy electrical gadgets to sell in Mutare.

loans.name: Luz Mabiliana

texts.es:
Luz es ama de casa, y madre de cinco hijos. Con su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar y garantizarles a sus hijos una buena educación. Luz se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, con el fin de generar los ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos.
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito con el fin de iniciar con su proyecto de negocio; cría y engorde de pollos, actividad que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
Luz desea tener una producción permanente y para ello espera comprar los pollos de diferentes edades y asegurarse de una producción secuencial. 
Con el crédito espera además, adecuar los galpones y compra de concentrado.
Sueña con poder constituir su negocio y lograr que sea perdurable en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Luz is a housewife and the mother of five children. With effort and sacrifice she has been able to improve her family’s condition and give her children a good education. Luz sells products from catalogues. Her goal is to generate income in order to help her husband with household expenses. 
Today she is looking for a loan in order to start a new business, raising and fattening chickens. This will allow her family to have a better quality of life. Luz would like to have a permanent place for her business. She hopes to buy chickens of various ages in order to have a continuous production of chickens. With this loan she would like to buy chicken coops and food. She dreams of growing her business.  She hopes that it will last through time.

loans.use: to buy chickens, build chicken coops and buy chicken food.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel, de 67 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación artesanal y comercialización de detergentes en su localidad, desde hace más de 15 años. Labor que inició debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su grupo familiar. 
En la actualidad viene presentando problemas de liquidez, debido a que algunos de sus clientes no han podido cancelarle. Motivo que lo ha conducido a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos, con el fin de continuar con el desarrollo de su actividad comercial.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es adquirir una vivienda y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Ezequiel, 67, works making and selling artisanal detergents in his community; he’s done so for more than 15 years.  He started this work because he needed to generate income to support his family group.

He’s currently having cash-flow problems because some of his customers haven’t been able to pay him which is why he’s asking for a loan to buy raw materials and ingredients to continue with his commercial activity.  One of his greatest dreams is to acquire a house and to guarantee better life opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients to make detergent.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria de 62 años de edad. Comenzó vendiendo productos por catálogo y en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios. Hoy se siente afortunada por las bendiciones que Dios le ha regalado y  agradece a la vida por tantas alegrías. Gracias a su trabajo su hijo ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar.
Con el fin de continuar con su negocio y diversificar sus productos, Gloria se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de calzado y jeans, lo que permitirá llevar a cabo su deseo.
texts.en:
Gloria, 62, started selling products via catalog and today sells clothes and accessories.  She feels fortunate for all the blessings God has given her and is grateful to life for all the joy.  Thanks to her work her son has been able to attend school.

Aiming at continuing with her business and diversifying her products, Gloria is asking for a loan to buy jeans and shoes which will allow her fulfill her wish.

loans.use: to buy jeans and shoes.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABOUGNOUMA   est constitué de 8  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales à l’image de MARIAM qui est la première femme arrêtée de droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 800 Kg de maïs avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is composed of eight married women averaging 32 years of age with four children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, siblings and children in the Massablacoura district of the town of Bougouni.
They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. In order to bolster their financial capacity in order to improve their business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan. Their prior loan has been properly repaid. The group members sell cereals, which is the case of Mariam, for example, the first one on the right in the photo. 
She plans to use her loan to buy 800 kg [about 1800 lbs] of corn from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market and out of her home, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to invest in her business and  repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr: Femme d’un plombier, et mère de 02 enfants qui ne sont plus sur les bancs de l’école, Madame Kokoé âgée de 57ans est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile végétale…) et des condiments (tomates, piments, oignons épices…) dans une boutique. Elle sollicite un quatrième prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut avec les profits, réinvestir une partie dans l’activité et l’autre partie à l’épargne. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait devenir grossiste dans la vente des céréales et assurer le bien –être de la famille.
texts.en: The wife of a plumber and a mother of two children, who are no longer in school, Ms. Kokoé is 57 years old and sells grocery items (rice, oil, vegetables…) and condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, spices, …) in a store. She is requesting a fourth loan to stock up on merchandise. She wants to reinvest part of her profit in her business, and the other part will go into savings. For the coming years, she would like to become a wholesaler of grains and to ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy condiments  and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Amadou Sidy

texts.fr: Amadou Sidy habite au Sud marié et père de famille ,depuis 20 ans il est dans le transport . Il avait bénéficié de deux crédits respectivement de 150 000f qui ont été soldés sans problème .Il démarre sa journée de 7h 30mn à 21h de tous les jours sauf le vendredi qui est un jour de repos pour lui.Avec son transport il prend en charge les fais de nourritures de sa famille . Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000f pour l'entretien de son véhicule et assurer les charge de la famille.Amadou sidy a comme ambition être un grand transporteur dans son secteur .
texts.en: Amadou Sidy lives in the South. He is a married father. For twenty years, he has been in the transport sector. He had benefited from two loan of 150,000 francs, respectively, that were settled without a problem. His day goes from 7:30 AM to 9 PM every day, except Fridays, which is his day of rest. With this transport, he covers the cost of food for his family. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to maintain his vehicle and to ensure family expenses are covered. Amadou Sidy's ambition is to be a major transporter in his sector.

loans.use: to maintain vehicles

loans.name: Anoumou

texts.fr: Anoumou âgé de 48ans est marié et père de famille. Il est éleveur de profession et a démarré cette activité en 2003. Afin d’acheter des poussins et des aliments, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour répondre à ses besoins. Comme perspectives d'avenir, Anoumou espère agrandir la taille de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Anoumou, aged 48, is a married father. He is a livestock farmer by trade and started this business in 2003. To purchase chicks and some feed, he is requesting an initial WAGES loan to meet his needs. For the future, a hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed and chicks

loans.name: Lupe Morayma

texts.es:
LUPE tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene una hija de  doce años de edad, vive con el esposo y con la hija en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

Lupe se dedica a la confección de colaciones, caramelos, habas fritas, canguil de dulce, bolas de panela y de maní.

Solicita el crédito para comprar canguil, un quintal de azúcar, papel, maní. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los materiales que le hacen falta para realizar los dulces artesanos.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima. El sueño es que la hija termine los estudios.
En el tiempo libre le gusta leer mucho.
texts.en: Lupe, 32, is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar. Lupe works making cookies, candy, fried broad beans, sweet popcorn and peanuts. She is asking for a loan to buy popcorn, a quintal of sugar, paper and peanuts. The money will help her to buy the materials she needs to make these traditional confectioneries. The challenge she faces is competition and the bad climate. Her dream is that her daughter is able to finish her studies. In her free time, Lupe enjoys reading.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, a quintal of sugar, paper and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas cutting torch, two drills, and materials.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Convertirse en microempresario es el gran reto de Jorge, un hombre quien ha trabajado incansablemente por obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración de joyas, arte que aprendió gracias a un primo y que hoy es su fuente de sostenimiento.
Desde hace cuatro años viene trabajando como independiente, por lo cual es bastante reconocido en su localidad. 
Sueña con mostrar al mundo su talento y tener una gran empresa en donde pueda brindarle a otras personas la oportunidad de tener un trabajo digno.
Con el propósito de seguir construyendo su sueño, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pedrería y accesorios.
texts.en: Jorge’s great challenge is to become a micro businessman.  He’s worked tirelessly to attain better quality of life.  He currently works making jewelry, an art he learned from his cousin and that has become his source of support.  He’s been working independently for four years and is quite well-known in his community as a result.  He dreams with showing his talent to the world and have a great firm where he can offer others a source of work with dignity.  With the aim of continuing building his dream, he’s asking for a loan to buy stones and accessories.

loans.use: to buy stones and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies in order to make housing improvements.

loans.name: Zinetou

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des tissus pour confectionner les voiles, madame Zinetou sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’en approvisionner. Âgée de 39ans, elle est mariée à un agent de sécurité et maman de 04 enfants dont 02 à l’école. L’ainé est âgé de 20ans et le dernier 03ans. Démarré en 1991, elle revend au marché. Madame Zinetou espère avoir une boutique au grand marché et contribuer au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: To purchase cloth to make scarves, Ms. Zinetou is requesting an initial WAGES loan for supplies. She is 39 years old, married to a security guard, and a mom of four children, of whom two are in school. The oldest is 20, and the youngest is 3. She began selling at the market in 1991. Ms. Zinetou hopes to have a store at the big market and help meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make scarves

loans.name: Sanaha

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales au marché, Sanaha est une jeune femme de 28ans qui a un enfant de 02ans en charge. Son conjoint est aussi dans le domaine du commerce. Elle a démarré en 2000 et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Madame sanaha espère ouvrir une boutique et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: A grains retailer at the market, Sanaha is a young woman, 28 years old, who has a 2-year-old child to support. Her husband is also in the commerce sector. She started off in 2000 and is requesting her first loan to purchase some merchandise. Ms. Sanaha hopes to open a store and ensure her family's self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Acts Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe!

This is 37 year-old Sharon from Mutare. She is married with three children and all are attending school. She also cares for two other dependents. Sharon runs a retail business selling blankets, winter clothing and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of import restrictions at border posts. Sharon has requested a loan of 1250 in order to buy more stock such as blankets and winter clothing to sell during this winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Sharon plans to operate her own boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as blankets and winter clothing to sell during this winter season.

loans.name: Mupopo Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Rebecca from Mutare. She is married with two children and both are attending school.  Rebecca runs a retail business selling blankets, winter clothing and ladies suits. The business has been in operation for 15 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of high import restrictions at border posts. Rebecca has requested a loan of $320 to buy ladies suits, blankets and winter wear to sell during this winter season. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Rebecca plans to operate her own boutique shop in town.

loans.use: to buy ladies suits, blankets and winter wear to sell

loans.name: Takaropafadzwa Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Lusia from Mutare. She is married with four children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for four other dependents. Lusia runs a poultry business, which produces chickens. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are the increased mortality rate, especially in winter, as well as late payments from customers. Lusia has requested a loan of $1200 to buy more chicks and feed for the poultry business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the general family welfare. In the future, Lusia plans to have many batches and be in a position to supply big supermarkets with chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for the poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, t-shirts, and dresses) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Anthony from Liberia.  He resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Anthony is married with a child, aged six. His child is currently attending school and is living with him in his home. His wife works as a fashion clothes seller.  

Anthony runs a shop selling goods such as artificial hair.  He describes himself as a business-minded man. He started his business six years ago, using 20,000 LRD which he borrowed from one of his friends.  Typically, he works 10 hours per day at his business and transports his goods to his business by bus.  He cites his greatest challenge as too little income.  He is proud of his business because he supports his family from his business.

Using the proceeds of this loan, he intends to purchase more artificial hair.  In the future, he plans to open another shop.  He sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
This is Florence from Liberia, she is 34-years-old. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rent and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Florence is single, with two children, aged one and 14-years-old. One of her children is currently attending school and they all live with her in her home.   
Florence runs a shop selling goods such as rice, milk, flour, etc. 

She describes herself as business minded woman. Florence started her business two years ago, using 10,000 Liberian Dollars (LRD) which she borrowed from one of her friends. Typically, she works 12 hours per day at her business and transports goods to her business by bus.  

Florence cites her greatest challenge as less income. She is proud of her business because she can support her family and has money for all expenses.

Using the proceeds of this loan, Florence intends to purchase more rice, flour, sugar, milk etc. for her business.  In the future, Florence plans to open another shop and build a house. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, sugar, and milk etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca from Liberia, she is 41-years-old. Rebecca resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rent and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Rebecca is single with two children, aged 16 and 21. Only one of her children is currently attending school and they all live with her in her home.   

Rebecca runs a shop selling goods such as fashionable local jewellery. She describes herself as business minded woman. She started her business five years ago, using money from her mother. 

Typically, Rebecca works nine hours per day at her business and transports goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as less income. Rebecca is proud of her business because it enables her to support her family.

Using the proceeds of this loan, Rebecca intends to purchase more jewellery for her business. In the future, she plans to open another shop and build a house. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fashion local jewellery for her business.

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.ru: Даврончон добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он мастер на все руки. Из-за обстоятельств в семье и трудных времён он не смог получить высшее образование. После школы пошёл работать и помогал родителем, так как он был старшим сыном в семье. У него любящая жена трое детей.  Жена не работает, воспитывает детей.  Даврончон как ответственный семьянин, заботливый папа и добрый муж старается, чтобы его семья не нуждались и дети выросли грамотными. Несколько лет назад он открыл свой бизнес. Его бизнес связан с изготовлением газовых оборудований. Он хорошо разбирается в своем деле и его труд очень востребован на сегодня. Также он умело ремонтирует и чинит автомашины. За день он обслуживает множество клиентов. Считает, что правильный и бескорыстный труд приносит счастье в его семью, ведь Даврончон именно деньгами заработанные трудовым потом обеспечивает своих самых близких людей. У него хорошо налажен бизнес, но на данный момент для купли сырья и запчастей ему необходимы дополнительные деньги. С этими намерениями Даврончон обратился за кредитом В МДО "Арванд". Очень надеется на поддержку со стороны "Арванд" в дальнейшем продвижении его бизнеса. Заранее благодарит за помощь и содействие.
texts.en: Davronjon is a good, hardworking person.  He is a master of all trades.  Due to family circumstances and hard times, he was unable to get a degree.  After high school, he worked and helped his parents since he is the oldest son in the family.  He now has a loving wife and three children.  His wife doesn't work outside of the home, but raises the children.  Davronjon is a responsible member of his family, a caring father and kind husband.  He works so his family doesn't want for anything and so that his children grow up literate.  Several years ago, Davronjon opened his own business connected with manufactured gas equipment.  He knows and runs the business well and his work is very much in demand.  He also skillful repairs vehicles.  He serves many clients each day.  He believes that good hard work brings his family happiness because the money earned provides for people closest to him.  His business is well established, but at the moment, he needs funds to buy raw materials and spare parts.  With this intention, Davronjon turned to Arvand for a loan.  He relies on Arvand's support to move his business forward.  He is grateful in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell spice pack business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Emma is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spices for re-sale. Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spices for re-sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has no children and has been doing farming work for 13 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Rearing dairy cows." Her biggest challenge is: "How to boost production due to low milk-producing animals." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Lelmok."

Hellen was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Joined Juhudi after being convinced by a neighbor."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "How microfinance institutions work to boost farmers' income."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit her family?," Hellen replied, "Will purchase a high-yielding dairy cow."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hellen owns the following: 'cow, poultry,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards, based on this loan. This borrower does not have in the household: 'mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.'

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años de edad, tiene una pequeña panadería ubicada al lado de su residencia, la cual trabaja en conjunto con su esposa. Diariamente inician su faena  a las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm. Inició su negocio gracias al apoyo de su familia y a un curso de panificación que realizó hace algunos años.
Con el fin de aumentar su producción, gracias a la buena acogida que han tenido sus productos en el sector, Juan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la ampliación de la planta de alimentos, el techo y la compra de una vitrina enfriadora.
Su mayor sueño es poder posicionar su negocio en el mercado local y convertirse en la número uno. Espera brindarle  a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, has a small bakery located at home where he works alongside his wife.  They start their work day every day at 5am and continue until 6pm.  He started the business thanks to family support and a baking course he took some years ago.  

Aiming at increasing production thanks to the good reception his products have had in the sector Juan is asking for a loan to expand the food plant, to repair the roof and to buy a refrigerated display case.  His greatest dream is to position the business in the local market and become number one.  He hopes to provide his family with proper quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case, expand the plant and repair the roof.

loans.name: Las Hortensias Group

texts.es: Roxana, esta al fondo en la derecha de lentes rojos, pañuelo blanco al cuello  y pelo oscuro, es participe del Banco Comunal Las Hortensias, que está en Villarrica, Región de la Araucanía de Chile. En este Banco los rubros son, confección de ropa, trabajo en sector agrícola, agrario y forestal, artesanía en cuero, artesanía en lana, artesanía a crochet. Y el negocio que Roxana tiene es de confección y venta de ropa institucional y comenzó hace un año de manera formal, pero toda su vida ha trabajado en la confección de ropa, ya que su madre le enseño porque ella es modista. El problema que más le ha aquejado es el hecho de no tener capital para comenzar con su negocio, y el tener que conseguirlo. El dinero que recibirá lo ocuparía para comprar insumos y algunas maquinarias pequeñas que necesita. Espera que le vaya muy bien, y comenta que lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que encontró mucho apoyo de su grupo el cual está empecinado en conseguir todos los objetivos que se han propuesto.
texts.en:
Roxana’s in the right rear wearing red eyeglasses, a white scarf around her neck and has dark hair.  She’s a member of the “Las Hortensias” communal bank located in Villarrica, Araucanía Region, Chile.  The various businesses in this communal bank are: clothes making, agricultural work, animal husbandry, forestry, leather crafts, wool crafts and crochet crafts.

Roxana’s business is making and selling institutional clothing.  She started a year ago formally but she’s worked her entire life making clothes since her mother who is a dressmaker taught her.  Her main problem has been the lack of capital to start her business and having to get it.  The money she’ll get will be used to buy supplies and small machines she needs.  She hopes that she’ll do very well and comments that what she’s liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza has been finding the group support she’s had and to start achieving all the group objectives they’ve set.

loans.use: to buy supplies and small machinery.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi vit avec sa femme comptable et leur enfant à Lomé. Pour jouer son rôle de père de famille, il revend des friperies au marché. Il espère renforcer son activité et ouvrir une boutique. Il est âgé de 37ans et a démarré en 2000. Une personne l'aide dans l'exécution de son activité.
texts.en: Koffi lives with his accountant wife and their child in Lomé. To fulfill his role as the father of the family, he sells used clothing at the market. He hopes to expand his business and open a shop. He is 37 years old and started his business in 2000. Koffi has one employee who helps him run his business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy stock such as milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, chips, bread, etc., to sell in her general store.

Theresa has been in this business for five years. Theresa earns more income from farming vegetables and from selling prepaid mobile load.

Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock such as milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, chips, bread, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Digna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and more snack foods to sell.

Digna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marissa has been farming vegetables for eight years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and has six children. Alma is married and has three children who are in school.

Alma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Alma has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food, beers and soda to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic staple items and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work equipment and furniture

loans.name: Nhor's Group
