loans.use: to buy flatbreads wholesale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, esta divorciada y tiene un hijo de 20 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Edith se dedica a la agricultura ya que cuenta con un terreno  ubicado en las afueras de su ciudad, donde siembra cacao, plátano y otros productos, los cuales vende periódicamente en otra ciudad , de estas ventas logra conseguir buenos ingresos, lleva 10 años dedicándose a está actividad y hasta ahora lo hace muy bien. Paralelo a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de artículos. En el futuro desea seguir ampliando sus ventas ya que así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su apoyo financiero para seguir adelante y cumplir todas sus metas. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para sus sembríos de cacao y plátano.
texts.en:
Edith, 57, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s divorced and has a 20-year-old son she lives with in her own house.  Edith works in agriculture since she has a parcel of land located in the outskirts of her city where she grows cocoa beans, bananas and other products that she sells periodically in another city.  She earns good profits from these sales and has been in this business for 10 years and to date does it very well.  As a parallel activity, she also sells items.  In future, she’d like to expand her sales so that her quality of life will be better.

This will be her first Kiva loan so she’s hoping for your financial support so she can continue forward and meet all her goals.  She will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure for her cocoa bean and banana crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Doña Ana de 57 años de edad vive con su familia en casa propia, doña Ana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de choco bananos, gelatinas, charamuscas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos años de realizar esa actividad tiene  mucha clientela pues sus productos son buenos, doña Ana esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para seguir elaborando los alimentos como: guineos, chocolate, frutas, gelatinas de sabores, etc. para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 57, lives with her family in her own house.  Ana works making and selling chocolate covered bananas, gelatin and ‘charamuscas’ [frozen treats].  Her business is located at home and she’s been doing this activity for many years.  She has a large clientele because her products are good.

Ana’s asking for a loan to be able to buy all the necessary ingredients like bananas, chocolate, fruit, flavored gelatin, etc. to continue making her food so that she can stay in business since this is her only source of work and to be able to give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, chocolate, fruit, flavored gelatin, etc.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su compañero de vida tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de  este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia. El busca mejorar su calidad  de  vida,  por lo que solicita un crédito para incrementar la variedad de sus  artículos en su tienda, como: granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de  su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Juan, 34, lives in his own house with his lie companion.  He has a small grocery store where he sells perishables like soft-drinks, snacks, candy and other food and non-food items.  He’s supported his family by means of this business.  Seeking to improve his quality of life he’s asking for a loan to increase the variety of merchandise like basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, etc. stocked in his store so business profits will increase and his family’s living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña rosa de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella tienen un negocio de venta cosméticos desde hace varios años esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña rosa esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos por mayor y asi seguir con su negocio para poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rosa, 62, lives with her family in her own house.  She has had a business selling cosmetics for several years located at home.  She has a large clientele because her products are very good quality at affordable prices.  She’s able to cover some of her household expenses with profits earned.  She’s asking for a loan to be able to buy cosmetics at wholesale to continue in business and giving her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional livestock and feed for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and feed for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina de 42 años de edad, ella vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos,  posee una venta de ropa tiene de diferentes estilos y  para todas las personas damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, la ropa que comercia es de muy buena calidad y la vende a precios accesibles es por eso que se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente; carolina es muy activa siempre se encuentra trabajando luchando por salir adelante. Para carolina el propósito y coraje que le pone a su labor tiene una dirección ver crecer el negocio para lograr un mejor futuro, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa en variedad como faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, trajes etc. Así siempre podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Carolina tiene la esperanza que de esta forma lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en:
Carolina, 42, lives in her own house with her two children. She sells clothes in various styles for women, men, boys and girls.  The clothes she sells are very good quality and she sells them at affordable prices which has led to much clientele lately.

Carolina is very active and is always working and striving to get ahead.  For Carolina, the purpose and drive she puts into her work is aimed at making the business grow in order to attain a better future.  

This is why she decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy assorted clothes like skirts, pants, blouses, t-shirts, suits, etc. to be able to always meet customer needs.  Carolina hopes in this way to give her family economic security and a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: G.s San Juan#1 Group

texts.es:
La Señora María  es una persona  muy  trabajadora vive con   sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de  refrescos  desde hace más de 12  años. 
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de refrescos de todos los sabores con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y mas producto que ofrecer a sus clientes que la visitan a diario.
Doña María al igual que sus compañeros de grupo espera  que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. 
Doña María en unos años espera con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.
Doña Simona su negocio es la venta de golosinas  desde hace 16 años 
Don José su negocio es la  venta de granos desde hace 6 años.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Mayo  del 2013
texts.en:
María’s a very hardworking person living with her children in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business for the last 12 years has been selling soft-drinks.

María needs the loan to buy soft-drinks in assorted flavors.  She hopes with the loan to increase sales because she’ll have fresh capital and more products to offer her customers that visit her daily.

María like her fellow group members hopes her economic situation will improve and be reflected in this new investment.  In a few years, María expects her business to be established as the biggest and best known in the zone so she can continue supporting her family so they can become upstanding citizens with better opportunities and contributing to society.

Simona has sold snacks in her business for 16 years and José has sold grains in his business for 6 years.

Choluteca, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks for her store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 40 years old and has five children. Vivian is married and has two children who are in school.

Vivian is in the agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vivian has been in hog raising business for 10 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Vivian would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Francisco Angel

texts.es: Francisco de 31 años de edad se dedica a la venta de joyas (enchapes de oro y plata) desde hace 10 años  tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de buena calidad y a precios accesibles, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias donde reside, con las ganancias que obtienen logra salir a delante con su familia, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, francisco esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas joyas por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que esa es única fuente de trabajo y asi pueda darle a sus dos hijos lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco, 31 years old, has been selling jewelry (gold- and silver-plated) for 10 years. He has a large clientele, since his products are of good quality and accessibly priced. He sells on the street in the different neighborhoods where he lives. With his earnings he is able to get by with his family. He lives in his own house with his two children.

Francisco is requesting a loan so that he can buy more jewelry at wholesale and continue his business, since he is the only source of income; this way he can give his two children what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy wholesale jewelry.

loans.name: El Posito Group

texts.es: Angelina tiene 51 años es una señora amable y muy trabajadora, ella vive en la localidad de Dongu, y pertenece a un grupo llamado El Posito dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque cerca de su casa hay un pozo de agua que abastece la comunidad. Ella se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, chiles manzanos, duraznos, zarzamoras ya que tiene dos terrenos enormes sembrados de arboles de las frutas antes mencionadas, también dice que en temporada de noviembre y diciembre vende flores de noche buena ya que una de sus hijas es quien las cultiva y doña Angelina se las compra para sacar a venderlas al estado de México en diferentes tianguis, su esposo es apicultor y en los terrenos donde tiene sus árboles tienen sus bastidores donde las abejas hacen sus colmenares y ahí dejan la miel. Ella le ayuda a su esposo a vender la miel, dice que la mejor miel es la morena ya que las abejas la sacan de las flores de los arboles de aguacate y también vende el propoleo, jalea real y cera, dice que le gusta mucho ayudarle a su esposo a cuidar de las abejas. Ahorita angelina está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, calidra para mejorar sus árboles ya que tienen que estar en buenas condiciones para que también sus abejitas, como dice ella, estén en buenas condiciones. El fruto que saca de los arboles va a la central de abastos de la población de Zitacuaro a venderlos por cubetas porque asi le gana un poco mas. El sueño de doña Angelina es poner un puesto estable en la central de abastos para vender a diario frutas y legumbres de temporada y dice que agradece a VisionFund por darle la oportunidad de darle un crédito para mejorar sus huertos. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman María del Carmen, Miriam, Diana y Jorge ellos invertirán en insumos para sus huertos de aguacate y durazno, zarzamora y para una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Angelina is 51 years old and a very kind and hardworking woman. She lives sin the town of Dongu, and belongs to a group called El Posito. She says that they called it that because close to her house there is a water well (pozo) that supplies the whole community. She grows avocados, manzano chiles, peaches, and blackberries. She has two enormous plots of land with the fruit trees. She also says that in November and December she sells poinsettias, since one of her daughters grows them. Angelina buys them from her to sell in the state of a México in different  street markets. Her husband is a beekeeper and on the land where she has her trees he has his apiaries where the bees make their hives and leave their honey. She helps her husband sell the honey. She says the best honey is dark, since the bees get it from the avocado trees. She also sells propolis, royal jelly and wax. She says that she really likes to help her husband care for the bees. Right now Angelina is asking for a loan to buy chemical fertilizer and manure and lime to improve her trees. They have to be in good condition so that her bees, as she says, can also be in good condition. The fruit she gets from the trees goes to the wholesale center in the town of Zitacuaro to sell by the bushel so she makes a little more. Angelina's dream is to have a stable spot in the wholesale center to sell her fruits and vegetables every day in season. She says she is grateful to VisionFund for giving her the chance to improve her orchards. The other members of the group are named María del Carmen, Miriam, Diana and Jorge. They will invest in materials for their avocado, peach and blackberry orchards and in a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy manure and chemical fertilizer and insecticide to grow avocados and peaches.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 27 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Joy has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jewelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jewelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Jewelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell in her general store, like soap, canned goods, chips, sugar, and milk.

Jewelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like soap, canned goods, chips, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna, a married mother of three children who lives in the Doun Keo District of Takeo Province, is 42 years old. She is a rice farmer and her husband is a paid construction worker in the local area. Having been in this business for 22 years, she is able to earn about US $20 a day, and she manages to save about US $7 each day after daily expenses. 

Vanna joined VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, this cycle as a first-time borrower. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition. She hopes this loan will enable her to continue her daughter’s education until graduation, as well as relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s university tuition

location.town: Ta Keo Province, Doun Keo District

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Previously Rina ran a small businesses in a small stall. Rina lives in Bogor, a peri-urban area about one hour from Jakarta.  Rina is single and living with six persons in the family home. 

Besides increasing the family income, 12 months ago Rina joined Ruma because she wanted to start expanding into other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credit. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $25- $30 /day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as additional working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia de 19 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, con grandes deseos de progresar y ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Desde hace 6 meses se encuentra buscando empleo, pero debido a su inexperiencia en el mundo laboral, las puertas no se han abierto. Razón que la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio,  consistente en la venta de productos por catalogo y artículos de papelería. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, ropa y vitrinas con  el propósito de adecuar en la sala de su casa un almacén y formalizar su actividad comercial.
Sueña en convertirse en una gran microempresaria y tener la oportunidad de acceder a al universidad para formarse como una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Natalia, who is 19 years old, is an enterprising young woman who is very eager to move forward and help her parents with their household expenses. She has been looking for employment for six months, but due to her lack of job experience, no doors have opened for her. That is what motivated her to start her own business selling products by catalog and office supplies. 

She is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of beauty supplies, clothing, and showcases in order to convert her living room into a store and formalize her business. Her dream is to become a great microentrepreneur and to have the opportunity to access college to get an education and become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies, clothing, and showcases.

loans.name: Cesar Obdulio

texts.es: Don cesar de 36 años de edad se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 3 años elabora juegos de comedor y de sala tiene mucha clientela pues su mercadería es de buena calidad y a precios accesibles con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, don cesar esta solicitando un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para seguir elaborando dichos productos como: madera, clavos, pegamento, barniz, tela, etc. y asi obtener mejores ganancias para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 36, has worked in carpentry for three years.  He manufactures dining room and living room sets and has a large clientele because his merchandise is good quality and prices are affordable.  He uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two children.

Cesar is asking for a loan to buy the materials like wood, nails, glue, varnish, fabric, etc. to be able to continue making said products to earn higher profits and be able to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Ana María Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una  señora  soltera  de 28 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo ellos viven en el Caserío el Panca, municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá.
Ella  es una  señora  trabajadora,  actualmente se dedica  a la compraventa de  abarrotes en el mercado de Sololá. Esta actividad la eligió porque le genera ingresos y ganancias buenas,  en la cual puede contribuir al sustento familiar. Ahora  cuenta con 3 años de experiencia  y eso la llevo hacer  independiente teniendo  su propio negocio de abarrotes.
Ella  ha visto que la demanda  de sus clientes es buena así como sus ganancias es por ello que  necesita tener más variedad de productos  para brindarles  un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para ampliar su tienda comprando más productos para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias y así  seguir creciendo y apoyando la economía de su familia ya que una de sus metas  que quiere cumplir.
Sueña  con ampliar su negocio y con  las  ganancias mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a single 28-year-old woman.  She has one son and they live in the hamlet of Panca in zone 1 of Sololá, Guatemala.  She is a hard-working woman who right now makes a living buying and selling groceries in the market in Sololá.  She chose this work because it generates good income and profit, with which she can contribute to the family's means of living.  Now she has three years of experience, which she has taken to become independent with her own grocery business.  

She has seen that her customers' demand is good, as are her earnings.  This is why she needs to have a larger variety of products in order to offer better service to her customers.  She is asking for a loan of 3,500 GTQ to expand her store by purchasing more products in order to get better earnings and thus continue growing and supporting the finances of her family, which is one of the goals that she wants to accomplish.  She dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living conditions with the earnings.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: United Traders 1 Group

texts.en:
Mariama is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mariama was born in Daru town, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and dried fish. She has been doing this business for four years now.

With the help of this loan, Mariama and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mariama will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm oil and dried fish in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and dried fish in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Mañana Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” conformado por 05 socios trabajadores y responsables,  la cual pasa a su 6to ciclo. Esther es comerciante, pues hace más de 6 años  que se dedica a la venta de  pollos, ofreciéndolos en un mercado de su localidad. Este negocio surgió con la idea de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder aportar en su hogar. Gracias a su esfuerzo Esther ha  logrado cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y comprar su propio puesto donde actualmente ofrece sus pollos. Su último crédito los destinará para la compra de pollos. Su siguiente meta es de  terminar de construir su vivienda. Esther  tiene 47 años, separada con 03 hijos independientes. El grupo “El Futuro Del Mañana” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Esther es la primera del lado derecho viste blusa color rosado con blanco y pantalón turquesa. Rosario está ubicada en la parte superior al lado izquierdo, la cual no puedo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is “El Futuro Del Mañana” (Tomorrow’s Future) and it has five hardworking, responsible members.  It’s starting its sixth cycle.  Esther’s a merchant for she’s been selling chickens for more than six years in her local market.  The business arose with the idea of improving income to contribute to her home.  Thanks to her effort Esther has been able to reach some of her dreams like improving her house and buying her own stand where she currently sells the chickens.

She will use her latest loan to buy chickens.  Her next goal is to finish building her house.  Esther is 47-years-old, separated and has three independent children.  Esther is first on the right wearing a pink and white blouse and turquoise pants.  Rosario appears in the upper part on the left side; she was unable to arrive on time due to work.

The El Futuro Del Mañana group thank the people who make this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is a 65-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Lucita is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to expand her inventory and attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Hortensia, tiene 28 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortilla desde hace 6 años, tiene 4 años de ser cliente de la institución siendo puntual en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz por quintal, leñas, cal, bolsas plásticas etc. Silvana tiene 44 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de nacatamales y María tiene 44 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y bisutería
texts.en:
This group consists of three members.  One of them is Hortensia, 28.  She has a spouse and two children.  Her business for the last six years has been making and selling tortillas.  She’s been a client of the institution for four years and is punctual with her payments.  She will use the loan to buy raw materials like corn by the quintal, firewood, lime powder, plastic bags, etc.

Silvana, 44, sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan style tamales] and María, 44, sells new clothes and costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like rice, lime water, firewood, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 33 years old and married with four children. She has an agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings.

Mary Joy has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a variety of seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his maize garden.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz works hard to support her family. Beatriz is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Beatriz requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ready-to-wear items to sell.

Beatriz has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear items to sell

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan, a mother of six children, is 58 years old and a resident of the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal Province. To make a living, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland, and she also buys rice for resale. She has been involved with her current business for two years. Counting this loan, she is a five-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she can continue to make progress with her livelihood, and that this is because of the positive impact of her past loan. Now, one of her sons want to pursue his bachelor’s degree at a local university, majoring in engineering. For this reason, she is applying for a new loan to help her son realize his dream of achieving academic progress. Her entire portion of this loan will be used to cover her son’s tuition fee. She hopes that her son can concentrate on his studies, so he will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee in engineering school.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 41-year-old hard-working man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is transport, alongside farming in order to boost his income. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning and to provide his family with a good home. Patrick intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for his house and pay workers who are constructing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and pay workers who are constructing his house.

loans.name: One Family 1 Group

texts.en:
Hassanatu is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hassanatu was born in Koidu city 33 years ago. She is married to an electrician and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. Hassanatu sells market food like rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been doing this business for two years now.

With the help of this loan, Hassanatu and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Hassantu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa is a merchant and runs a sari-sari (variety) store in her place selling various goods and items to the people who live there. 
Jelisa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 59 years old and lives in Tugas,Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Shee is married with four sons and daughters. 

Pablita has a shop that sells grocery goods. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan amount of 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more grocery items for the groceries store.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Pablita hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods and items for the grocery store business.

loans.name: Amigos Group

texts.es: Silvia tiene 59 años de edad, ella tiene un negocio de venta de productos naturistas por catalogo, dice que tiene un club nutricional en su casa y que le va muy bien, ella pertenece al grupo Amigos dice que  le pusieron ese nombre porque todos los que están en el grupo se llevan muy bien y hay confianza, dice que desde hace 5 años tiene su negocio que una amiga fue la que le invito a trabajar y hacer su club para que la gente coma sanamente y se mantenga en forma y que también abrió ese tipo de negocio porque no conseguía un trabajo estable ya que a la gente después de los 35 años no les quieren dar trabajo “es muy difícil encontrar un buen trabajo donde ganes bien y te den prestaciones" dice ella "tal vez no tengo seguro social pero tengo buenas ganancias” dice que a muy temprana hora abre su negocio hace diferentes y nutritivos almuerzos como tés, malteadas, ensaladas las cuales ayudan a la gente ha estar en buenas condiciones o también le compran los productos sus clientes y se los hacen en sus casa. Silvia esta pidiendo un crédito para surtir pedidos que tiene pendientes y para la compra de frutas y legumbres para hacer sus nutritivos desayunos. Dice que agradece a VisionFund por el crédito que le esta haciendo porque asi crecerá su negocio. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman María Eugenia, Clara, Nancy Verónica, Yessica, Elizabeth, Lorena, Graciela, J. Cruz y Maricarmen ellos invertirán en sus negocios para la compra de material para hacer ropa y venderla, para la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos y venderlos, para la compra de artículos y surtir tienda de abarrotes, para la compra de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños para su venta, para la compra de pollo para vender por kilos, para la invertir en frutas y legumbres de temporada, para la venta de cobertores y blancos por catalogo para su venta y para la compra de zapatos por catalogo para su venta.
texts.en:
Silvia, 59, has a business selling natural products by catalog.  She says that she has a nutrition club at home and does very well.  She belongs to the “Amigos” group and says they named it thus because everyone in the group gets along very well and they trust each other.  She says that she’s had her business for five years and a girlfriend invited her to work and to create her club so that people will eat healthy and stay in shape.  She also opened this type of business because she’d been unable to get stable employment because after the age of 35 no one wants to hire them.  “It’s very difficult to find a good job with benefits,” she says; “I may not have social security but I do earn good profits.”  She says that she opens for business very early and makes various nutritional breakfasts like tea, malts and salads that help people stay in good shape.  Her customers also buy products from her and to make them at home.  Silvia is asking for a loan to fill pending orders and to buy fruit and vegetables to make her nutritious breakfasts.

The other group members are María Eugenia, Clara, Nancy Verónica, Yessica, Elizabeth, Lorena, Graciela, J. Cruz and Maricarmen.  They will invest in their businesses buying fabric to make clothes to sell, to buy ingredients to make Mexican fast-food snacks to sell, to buy items to stock a grocery store, to buy women’s, men’s and children’s clothes to sell, to buy chicken to sell by the kilo, to invest in seasonal fruit and vegetables, to sell bedspreads and linens by catalog and to buy shoes by catalog to sell.

loans.use: to stock up on natural products, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Candido

texts.es: Candido tiene la edad de 80 años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de chile que quieren iniciar. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Candido is 80 years old and married. He lives with his wife. He wants the loan in order to put it towards a chilli pepper plantation he wants to start and buy compost. He wants to maintain his crops well so that he has better output and greater earnings. He hopes to give his family a better quality of life and better economic stability in the future, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has extended the loan to him on more agreeable terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing chilli peppers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land to venture into farming..

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Pursat Province, Pum is 56 years old and a widow. To deal with the daily cost of living, she sells corn and small freshwater clams. This is the business that she has had for 10 years and it earns her about 9,000 KHR per day. 

Pum has been a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for six loan cycles.  She has formed a group of four to apply for a new loan. The past loans, which she has fully repaid, have helped her to support her business. As the group leader, Pum will spend her portion of this new loan to buy wooden boards to renovate her house. She hopes to own a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards to renovate her house

loans.name: Tiessiri Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela un des villages de la commune de massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  FATOUMATA SOUMAILA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.5 Ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI  IV" are married women averaging 41 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kenikela, a village in Commune de Massigui, in Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and some millet. The women are in their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, FATOUMATA SOUMAILA, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Massigui City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Flor Del Cafe Group

texts.es:
El señor Jose Maria esta unido de hecho con su esposa, tiene 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, inició este negocio sembrando unas plantitas de milpa y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante para su cultivo de maíz, en el futuro desea tener más terreno para poder sembrar no solo maíz sino también café, ya que es una cosecha que deja buenas ganancias; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la siembra de maíz y café.
texts.en:
Jose Maria is 54 years old and is married. He did not have the opportunity to study as his parents were of scare economic resources. He has 4 children and 2 of them are studying. He cultivates corn for a living. He began his this business planting some seedling cornfields and to date has 10 years of experience, with the support of his wife.

He decided to organize a group in order to request a loan that will allow him to purchase fertilizer to cultivate corn. In the future he wants to have more land to be able to plant not only corn but also coffee, as it is a crop that brings good earnings. The rest of the members of the group grow corn and coffee for a living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Orlando aims to upgrade his livelihood to support his family. He is 42 years old and has three school-aged children. He raises hogs to generate additional income. He would like to improve the business and increase his income in order to satisfy their necessities and continue to send his children to school. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy piglets, feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his hogs. He hopes that this financial assistance will help him improve the business and that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets, hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed for his hogs.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 27 years old and raising her child alone at Linao East, Tuguegarao City.  To make a living, she manages a retail store where she sells grocery items in their village.  She earns about PHP 300 a day and uses it for daily meals and as rolling capital in the business. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy different grocery items such as noodles, biscuits, eggs, breads, sugar and coffee to sell in her store. This will help her acquire more sales and income as well. 

Karen hopes to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy different grocery items to sell

loans.name: El Trébol Group

texts.es:
Gabriela tiene 42 años ella pertenece a un grupo llamado El Trébol el cual lo conforman doce personas las cuales piden créditos a VisionFund para mejorar sus negocios. Ella es origina de una población llamada Ocampo donde muy cerca de ahí se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, el cual es un atractivo turístico y que año con año los turistas llegan a admirar a las mariposas que viajan desde Canadá. 

Gaby como de cariño le dicen tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, dice que  puso su negocio porque cerca de ahí no hay una tienda de abarrotes y para obtener sus propias ganancias y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene con su negocio desde hace 13 años y dice que le va bien en sus ventas ella dice “desde que entre a VisionFund mi negocio ha mejorado mucho ya que al principio nada mas vendía dulces y refrescos y después fui surtiendo un poco de todo ahora tengo mejores ganancias”, dice que a la mayoría de sus clientes les vende en pagos, cuando ve que la gente no le puede comprar al contado ella así les ayuda. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de jabón, refrescos, pan, leche, huevo, azúcar, café, sal, frijoles, arroz, aceite comestible, focos, papel higiénico, pañales desechables, leche en polvo para bebes, y muchos productos mas, ella va a la ciudad de Zitacuaro a comprar en tiendas donde le dan mas barato los productos para asi ella no venderlos tan caros, dice que también puso la tienda para que la gente de su comunidad no gaste en pasajes para comprar lo básico de la comida, dice que su sueño es invertirle en frutas y legumbres y un poco de carnes frías pero que necesita un refrigerador mas grande para que no se le echen a perder las cosas, agradece a las instituciones que harán posible su crédito. Antonio, Edith Verónica, Esperanza, María de Jesús, Ma. Consuelo, María Eugenia, María Guadalupe, María Claudia, Natividad, Margarita Belinda Sara y Juliette ellos invertirán en la compra de material para estudio fotográfico, para la compra de insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para la compra de pollos y venderlos por kilos, en la compra de insumos para hacer paletas de hielo y helados para su venta, para surtir en cosméticos y venderlos por catalogo y para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada para vender en puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 42 years old and belongs to a group called ‘El Trébol’ which has 12 members who request loans from VisionFund to improve their businesses.  Gabriela is from a town called Ocampo which is located very close to a monarch butterfly sanctuary which is a tourist attraction.  Every year tourists come to admire the butterflies that travel from Canada.

Gaby, as she is affectionately known, has a convenience store in her home.  She says that she started her business because there was no convenience store near her.  She wanted to make her own money so that she could help her husband with their household expenses.  Gabriela has been running her business for 13 years and says that she enjoys good sales.  She says “since I joined VisionFund, my business has improved a lot because at first I only sold sweet treats and soft drinks, then I started stocking a little of everything.  Now I make better profits”.  Gabriela says that she sells to most of her customers on account.  When she sees that people can’t pay cash she helps them in this way.  She says that she is requesting this loan to buy soap, soft drinks, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, coffee, salt, beans, rice, cooking oil, light bulbs, toilet paper, disposable diapers, baby formula and many other products.  She goes to the city of Zitacuaro to buy her products from shops where she can get them much cheaper.  This means that she can sell them more cheaply herself.  She says that one of the reasons she set up her store was so that people from her community didn’t have to spend money on transportation in order to buy the basics they needed to make their meals.  She says that her dream is to invest in fruit and vegetables and some cold cuts but that she needs a larger refrigerator for this so that the produce doesn’t go off.  Gabriela is grateful to the institutions who will make her loan possible.

Antonio, Edith Verónica, Esperanza, María de Jesús, Ma. Consuelo, María Eugenia, María Guadalupe, María Claudia, Natividad, Margarita Belinda Sara and Juliette will invest in buying material for a photography studio, buying supplies for making Mexican snacks, buying supplies for baking bread, buying chickens to sell by the kilo, buying supplies for making popsicles and ice creams to sell, stocking up with cosmetics to sell through catalogs and buying seasonal fruit and vegetables to sell from a stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy goods for her convenience store such as soap, soft drinks, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, coffee, salt, beans, rice, cooking oil, light bulbs, toilet paper, disposable diapers, baby formula and many other products

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es: Olivia tiene 39 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos dos de ellos ya no dependen de ella, la mayor se caso y tiene una niña y el que sigue trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y la menor estudia la primaria, ella es originaria de la comunidad de Crescencio Morales un lugar rico en naturaleza y con unos paisajes hermosos, ahí es una zona  indígena Mazahua, la mayoría de las personas visten y hablan el dialecto mazahua. Ella pertenece a un grupo llamado El Calvario. Olivia tiene un negocio de cría y venta de borregos y también tiene una huerta de aguacates los cuales cuando es temporada sale a venderlos a la población de Zitacuaro por cubetas. Ella está casada con Santos quien vive en Estados Unidos y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella puso su negocio por que antes sus 3 hijos iban a la escuela y no le alcanzaba lo que su esposo le mandaba de remesas, y poco a poco fue ahorrando para comprar borregos criarlos y venderlos en su pueblo, dice que en los meses cuando vende mas es en mayo ya que son las clausuras de las escuelas y ocupan los borregos para las fiestas que les hacen a los graduados y también en el mes de diciembre por las fiestas de navidad, ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de alimento, vacunas, desparasitantes y para comprar abono orgánico e insecticidas para que estén en mejores condiciones sus árboles y así poder sacar fruto de buena calidad. Los otros 3 integrantes del grupo se llaman Ruperta, Gustavo y Miguel ellos invertirán sus créditos para la compra de borregos y alimentos para estos.
texts.en:
Olivia, 39, is the mother of three children two of which are no longer dependent on her.  The eldest got married and has a little girl and the next one works and helps her with household expenses and the youngest attends primary school.  She’s from the community of Crescencio Morales, a place rich in nature with beautiful scenery.  It’s a Mazahua indigenous zone and most of the people dress and speak the Mazahua dialect.  She belongs to a group called “El Calvario” (Calvary).

Olivia’s business is raising sheep to sell and she also grows avocados.  When they are in season she goes out to sell them by the bucketful in Zitácuaro.  She’s married to Santos who lives in the United States and helps her with household expenses.  She opened her business because her three children used to attend school and her husband's stipend that he would send her wasn’t enough.  She gradually saved up to buy sheep to raise and then sell in her town.  She says that the months she sells the most are May  which is when school lets out and the sheep are needed for parties given for the graduates and also in December for the Christmas feasts.  

Now, she’s asking for a loan to buy feed, vaccines and anti-parasitic agents and to buy organic manure and insecticide so that her trees will be in better condition and produce better quality fruit.

The other three group members are Ruperta, Gustavo and Miguel and they will invest their loans in the purchase of sheep and feed for them.

loans.use: to buy sheep, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Ma. Monina

texts.en:
Ma. Monina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

Ma. Monina requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall.

She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Ma. Monina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Flavour Group

texts.en:
Mamie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mamie was born in Kailahun town 30 years ago. She is single with one child who is attending primary school. 

Mamie has been a businesswoman for two years now. She sells market food like rice, palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. This is the first loan that Mamie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. Mamie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela un des villages de la commune de Massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAKORO la première personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI  III" are married women averaging 37 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kenikela, a village in Commune de Massigui, in Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and some millet. The women are in their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, MAKORO, who is first person standing in her row in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Massigui City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Maisoon

texts.en:
Maisoon is 40-years-old and from Ramallah.  She is married and has four children.

Since 2011, she has owned a grocery store and she has two part time employees.

She has asked Kiva partner Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator, and do some needed displays for her grocery store.

She hopes that this loan will help increase her sales and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, and do some needed displays for her grocery store.

loans.name: Houmiétou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante, Houmietou sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le bénéfice tiré de la vente l’aidera à renforcer son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Âgée de 37ans, elle a une ancienneté de 13ans dans l’activité.
texts.en: A hawker of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), Houmietou is requesting her first WAGES loan to purchase some merchandise. The profit earned from the sales will help her to bolster her business and ensure her family's well-being. She is married to a chauffeur and has two children, including one in school. She is 37 years old and has 13 years of seniority in this work.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Tiessiri Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baba un des villages de la commune de Massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  MARIAM  la première  personne à gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 05 ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI  II" are married women averaging 43 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Baba, a village in Commune de Massigui, in Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and some millet. The women are in their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, MARIAM, who is first person standing from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Massigui City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 25,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Benidicta

texts.en:
Benidicta is 58 years old and married with six children. Benidicta works very hard to provide for them.

Benidicta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like bread, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries in her general store.

Benidicta has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Benidicta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like bread, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 66 years old and married with six children. Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es: Salvador de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal es el maíz y el frijol con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, salvador está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara ecológica ya que con las ganancias que obtiene no puede realizarlo ya que no cuenta con energía eléctrica estable y la lámpara será de mucha ayuda en su hogar.
texts.en:
Salvador, 30, lives in his own house with his wife and his two children.  He has made a living in agriculture for several years, mainly corn and beans.  With his profits he's able to cover some of the household expenses.

Salvador's requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp because he can't buy it with his earnings.  He doesn't have stable electricity and the lamp will be a big help in his home.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Tiessiri Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe TIESSIRI VI sont constitués par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela un des villages de la commune de massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,    METIE  la personne au milieu  dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1Ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group "TIESSIRI  VI" are married women averaging 36 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kenikela, a village in Commune de Massigui, in Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and some millet. The women are in their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, METIE, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Massigui City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 75,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

With this loan, Fatoumata Moussa, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of rice and peanuts.
