loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 42 years old and married with six children. She lives in Ozamis City. For the past 10 years, Jocelyn has owned and operated a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell. In 2007, she joined GDMPC and gained access to microfinance services. Recently, Jocelyn requested a 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to finance the costs of farm preparation and purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance the costs of farm preparation and purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 58 years old and widowed with eight children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Emelia has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from raising ducks and pigs.

Emelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her business.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is 47 years old. She lives in Bolnisi district with her husband and 14 year old son. 

Several times, Nargiz requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Her family owns a small plot of agricultural land where maize and haricot are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets. Their additional income is from small, monthly salaries. Nargiz is working as a cleaner and her husband as a security guard. 

Nargiz requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nargiz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With her credit, Nargiz will purchase a car. Her husband will drive it as a taxi to transport local people and the family will increase their monthly income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Tiessiri V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kenikela un des villages de la commune de massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,   KADIATOU SOKOURALA la première personne à gauche dans le rang des débous, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 75 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Tiessiri V Group are married women who average 37 years of age and have an average of three children each. For the most part, they live in polygamous families in Kenikela, a village in Massigui Commune, Dioila prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).

The women in this group are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being able to better organize their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops being grown are, among others, ground nuts, rice, and a small amount of millet. The group is on its seventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this loan, Kadiatou Sokourala (the first person on the left in the row that is standing in the photo) plans to purchase farm inputs and minor equipment, as well as to pay the labor costs to maintain roughly two hectares of rice and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base of men and women. Kadiatou Sokourala makes a profit of approximately 75,000 CFA francs per loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and minor equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding.

loans.name: Tiessiri Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIESSIRI III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baba un des villages de la commune de massigui,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres (Culture de l’arachide, du riz et  un peu de mil). Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, Yayi  la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de riz et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI  III" are married women averaging 40 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Baba, a village in Commune de Massigui, in Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and some millet. The women are in their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, Yayi, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 1 hectare of rice and peanuts.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Massigui City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 45,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Inoussa

texts.fr: Inoussa âgé de 37 ans, est marié à une marchande du nom de Odette. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Inoussa vit ensemble avec sa femme et son enfant. Inoussa et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Inoussa n’a fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture. Inoussa exerce cette activité depuis plus de dix ans. En vue de renforcer ses équipements pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Inoussa  désire acquérir une nouvelle machine à broder. Pour ce faire, Inoussa sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Inoussa, aged 37, is married to a merchant named Odette. The couple have one child, in school and in their care. Inoussa lives together with his wife and child. They jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. Inoussa did not attend school but learned how to sew. He has been in this business for over ten years.  With the aim of bolstering his equipment to satisfy his customers further, Inoussa would like to acquire a new embroidering machine. To do so, he is requesting for a third time financial support from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidering machine

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Glenn is a married man and a father of six children. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Glenn is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With this, he will be able to improve his fishing business as well as his income. In the future, Glenn hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Mundo De Fe Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Patricia tiene 28 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de comida y refrescos naturales. Tiene un año de experiencia en el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la  compra de materia prima como arroz, azúcar, carne de res, carne de pollo, frijoles crudos, frutas como papaya, naranja dulce, melón, granadilla etc. Marbeli tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería, Flor tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida y Elena tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida y ropa nueva
texts.en:
The group is comprised of four enterprising members.  Patricia, age 28, is one of them.  She is single, and her business is selling food and natural soft drinks.  She has one year of experience in the business.  She will use the loan to buy raw material like rice, sugar, beef, chicken, uncooked beans, and fruit like papaya, oranges, melon, and passion fruit, etc.

Marbeli, age 25, has a grocery store business.  Flor, age 25, sells food.  Elena, age 31, has a business selling food and new clothes.

loans.use: to buy raw material like rice, sugar, beef, chicken, uncooked beans, and fruit like papaya, oranges, melon, and passion fruit, etc.

loans.name: Banex

texts.en:
Banex, a married young man of 25 years, with one child, is from a humble background. He did not go far with school because his parents could not afford to pay his high school tuition. However, he got lucky because he recently found a contract job as a casual laborer with the construction firm working on the road leading to his town. He thinks that he will be able to save some of his wages to pay the monthly installments of the loan that he is using to pay for a piece of land.

He hopes to start making bricks after buying the plot of land, so that he can put up a shelter for his young family very soon. Banex is a hard-working, young man who wants to work hard, so that he can provide the best for his child, especially in terms of education. 

Banex is standing in the center, between his parents on the left and his wife and credit officer on the right. They all consented to the photo and signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To pay for a plot of land.

loans.name: Gbo-Tima Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the Gbo-Tima Group. They are small-scale businesswomen, based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT)/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standards of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. Fatmata is age 30. She was born in Moyamba. However, she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a military officer and four of her children are attending either primary or secondary schools. 

For five years now, Fatmata has been selling market-food – palm-oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With this loan, she is going to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, and pepper, etc., in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Siem

texts.en:
Siem, 44 years old, is a resident living with her spouse and three children in her own home in Kompong Cham province. She works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of rice, cassava and sugar cane trees on around two hectares of farmland. 

She has been operating in this field for many years and has gained a lot of valuable experience, which allows her to obtain better yields. She usually sells her products in all the surrounding areas and markets of the regions, together with her husband generating approximately a net income of USD 8.00 per day.

Siem needs to invest in the purchase of farm supplies, such as sugar cane trees and cassava for seeding. Due to insufficient capital for the investment, she is asking for a Kiva loan amounting to USD 1,400. She has confidence to pay off her loan on time, and at the same time she can supply her family with the basic living necessities.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Elineo

texts.en: Elineo is a thirty four year old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is running a cosmetics shop alongside a barber shop to boost his income. Having a bigger, well-stocked shop and the ability to provide fully for his family is his greatest dream. Elineo is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Blessing Iv Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Blessing IV” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Femusu is the featured leader of this group. Femusu is a 39-year-old, and she is married with three children, one in primary school, one in secondary school and one not of school-going age. Femusu sells market food – palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. 

With the help of this loan, Femusu will invest in her business by buying palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling spare parts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more spare parts to sell to her customers.

Cheryl successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Cheryl's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Salvacion successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Salvacion's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred used the previous loan to buy cocoa to sell. He is a forty-two year old hardworking farmer living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He grows cocoa and also buys cocoa from other farmers to sell. He has operated his business for over five years. Like most farmers, he faces the challenge of inadequate capital to buy necessary farm inputs, coupled with price fluctuation. Nevertheless, his dream is to become the leading cocoa supplier in the district. Wilfred intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell and rehabilitate his farm by buying fertilizers to apply.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell and fertilizers to apply.

loans.name: Tatay-Yirra Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Makeni city, 30 years ago. She is married to a house builder and the couple has five children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. 

For 13 years now, Fatmata has been selling napkins, pants, towels, wrappers, baby clothes, etc. This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy napkins, pants, towels, wrappers, baby clothes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: With Out Money Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Without Money” group. They are small scale business people based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profits and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Hawa. Hawa is aged 49-years-old and she was born in Magburaka town but is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a fisherman and  her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For eight years now, Hawa has been selling fish. With this current loan, Hawa will buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 35 years old, is from Gaza. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend primary school.

She has owned a place for sewing and selling embroidery since 2005 and she has one employee.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy sewing machines for her embroidery workshop .She hopes that this loan will increase the productivity of the project,, thus improving her family's financial situation so she can approach her dreaming of having a big workshop,

loans.use: to buy sewing machines for her embroidery workshop

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, es empleado trabaja de analista en una empresa que está cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene varios años de trabajar en esa actividad con el pago que recibe logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una turbo cocina ecológica y asi poder ahorrarse algunos gastos en su hogar con la inversión de la compra de la cocina.
texts.en: Juan, age 34, lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He is employed and works as an analyst for a company located near to his home. He has worked there for several years, and is able to cover some household costs with his income. Juan is requesting a loan for the purchase of a turbo cooker so that he can save on some household costs with this investment.

loans.use: to buy a turbo cooker.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 32 years old and single.

Cecile is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecile has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Cecile would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en: Hamid is a 29-year-old married man who lives with his child in Sana`a, Yemen. He has owned a butcher shop for five years. He started off by working in a restaurant and eventually accumulated money and opened his own butcher shop. He is a hardworking man who treats his customers politely.  Because he wants money to purchase products for his store, he has asked for a loan of 150,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy meat for resale to his clients. He hopes to improve his family's living conditions and become a merchant.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale to his clients.

loans.name: Butukuru Bakyara Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Peluce is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She practices agriculture and with the profits from her business she has been able to buy fertilizers and more land for farming. She has a vision of expanding and diversifying her business to include dairy farming, although she is faced with the hardships of unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations. Peluce will use the loan to buy maize seedlings for planting. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a forty-eight year old married man with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. He runs a retail business and with the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children. He hopes to educate his children to a university level and trade in wholesale. Charles is requesting a loan to buy soda, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is thirty-four years old, and a married woman of three children that live with her in a small home in Kompong Cham province. Oun is a farmer, which is why she owns a few pieces of land where she and her husband help each other by sowing rice for nourishing the family and for sale. She focuses more on his crops, because it is the sole source of her family income. Her business location is very well-suited to rice, cassava, other seasonal crops, and that’s why she always tries to keep her land fertile and her crops in good condition. 

Oun has been working in this occupation for almost 20 years. This is her third HKL loan and first Kiva loan, which she will use to buy extra farmland to increase her annual rice production. She is very delighted and grateful for the financial support she receives to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy extra farmland.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 39 years old, married and has two children. She is working hard to provide the educational needs of her children.  At the moment, she is engaged in the food vending business where she sells halo-halo (is a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and evaporated milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits and served in a tall glass or bowl) and other beverages for refreshment in their village.

She wants to buy more ingredients and improve her income, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy milk and different ingredients such as bananas, sweet potatoes and beans for her halo-halo business.  She hopes that her business will become successful.

loans.use: to buy milk, bananas and potatoes to cook and sell

loans.name: Flaviano

texts.en: Flaviano is a 55 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 4 grown children. Growing seaweed is the family's source of income. He has been farming seaweed for more than 10 years now. Flaviano has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more seaweed seedlings and materials like straw, tissue and bamboo sticks to increase the harvest. In the future, Flaviano  hopes that he can expand his seaweed farming business to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings and materials like straw, tissue and bamboo sticks

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a 50 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 5 children.The oldest child is 30 while the youngest is 20. Rosalia has been raising pigs for almost 2 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and feed, in order to produce healthy pigs that can be sold on time. In the future, Rosalia would like to expand her hog raising business to improve her standard of living and to provide her family with good food.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Dawood

texts.en: Dawood is 24 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been operating a business selling batteries and oils for six months. He is able to attract many clients. He acquired his experience when he worked in other batteries and oils businesses. He accumulated some money to start up this business. He is a hardworking man who tries to offer a good life for his family. He would like to expand his business, so he has applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more batteries and oils for his business. He hopes to open an extra store in the same field.

loans.use: to buy batteries and oils for his business.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 35-year-old man in the motorcycle transport business. He is married with four children. His motorcycle business is based in Nairobi, Kenya, and he has run it for the past five years. According to him, the business has been profitable. 

This will be Bonface's fourth loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the funds to buy an extra motorcycle. With that, Bonface will be able to make more income, with which he will buy a plot and build a house for his family.

In the future, Bonface hopes to buy more motorcycles and be successful in the transport business, and thus be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 54-year-old mechanic who sells spare motorcycle and bicycle parts, as well as seat belts for passenger service vehicles. He is a married man with four children and has been in this business for the last ten years doing well. 

This marks his second loan from KADET LTD, Kiva's partner, to finance his business. Charles will use the loan to purchase more spare motorcycle and bicycle spare parts for his shop, and the anticipated profit from the loan will help him expand his business. He hopes to have a stable and profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle and bicycle parts for his shop.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 58-year-old married man with ten children and four dependents who are grandsons from his late son. He was previously a civil servant, but with time and as the children started going to higher institutions of learning, the small salary was inadequate to cater to their financial needs. So, he decided to retire to practice commercial farming of coffee, since he had an averagely big piece of land. 

Income from the coffee sales has helped him a lot in educating his children. Amos attributes this to hard work and determination. Having bore many children, he had to struggle a lot to see them get a good education. 

Amos narrates that his coffee plantation has been a savior in his financial needs. He has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to complete tuition for his two sons at university, since this is their final year. If his plan is fulfilled, Amos projects a harvest of 15 coffee bags next season, which will enable him to pay up the loan, finish his house that is under construction and pay tuition for his other children.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his two sons who are at university.

loans.name: Amor Al Trabajo Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatros socios emprendedores una de ella  es Karla tiene  32 años de edad, con un hijo, casada, su negocio es de una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio, tiene un año de tener su negocio, este crédito  lo  invertirá en la compra de inventario como granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sal, pan, pan dulce, carne de res, carne de pollo, productos lácteos, medicamentos populares, maizenas, caramelos, gaseosas, jugo en latas, jugo en cajas, jabon de baño, jabon de lavar, ace, cloro,  Arlinn tiene 24 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de productos básicos, Rosa es otra socia  tiene 44 años y su  negocio es  la venta de nacatamales y Jose tiene 47 años y su negocio es la compra de cosechas de tamarindo.Agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado atraves del credito, lo que a logrado es que maneja una variedad de productos en inventarios.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four enterprising members. One of them is Karla. She is 32 and married with one child. Her business is a grocery store located in her home, which she has had for a year. She will use this loan to invest in buying inventory, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, bread, sweet bread, chicken, dairy products, popular medicines, corn flour, candies, sodas,  canned juices, juice cartons, washing soap, detergent, bleach, etc. 

Arlin is 24 and her business is selling basic products. Another member, Rosa, is 44 and her business is selling nacatamales. Jose is 47 and his business is buying tamarind crops.

Thanks to Kiva investors for the support they have given through their loans, the group has achieved an ability to include a variety of products in their inventories.

loans.use: to invest in buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, bread, sweet bread, chicken, dairy products, popular medicines, corn flour, caramels, sodas,  canned juices, boxed juices, washing soap, detergent, bleach, etc.

loans.name: Essivi

texts.fr: Essivi a pour conjoint un éleveur. Elle a 02 enfants âgés de 23 et 02ans. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des poissons fumés de façon ambulante depuis 2003. Le prêt sollicité de WAGES l’aidera à acheter plus de marchandises. A l’avenir, elle espère développer son activité et assurer l’éducation de la famille. Elle est âgée de 43ans.
texts.en: Essivi is married to a farmer. She has two children, who are 23 and 2 years of age. To help provide for her family, she has worked reselling smoked fish on the street since 2003. She has requested a loan from WAGES to help her buy more merchandise. In the future, Essivi hopes to develop her business and provide for her children's education. She is 43 years old.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Isolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Isolina del Carmen una Joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, soltera y sin hijos, viven en una comarca de Chinandega, vive en casa de sus padres, estudiante universitaria de contabilidad casi al finalizar sus estudios, desea tener su ´propio negocio como es un tienda surtida, con la iniciativa juvenil para jóvenes emprendedoras es la oportunidad para poder realizar sus sueños como es tener su tienda, ella inicio a vender de forma ambulante con su mamá desde los 15 años, adquirió experiencia por lo cual se independizo a los 17 años de edad y hoy en día tiene muchos clientes para satisfacer la demanda necesita un financiamiento que le ayude a tener su propio negocio y no andar ofreciendo ambulante, ya que de esto ella mantiene sus estudios. 

es una joven con una visión amplia, segura de lo que quiere con muchos deseos de crecer, responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, necesita un crédito para invertir y surtir su negocio y obtener sus propias ganancias.
texts.en:
Isolina del Carmen, 21, is an enterprising young woman.  She's single and has no children.  She lives in her parents's house in a region of Chinandega.  She studies accounting in the university and is about to finish her program.

She wants to have her own business, a stocked store.  With youthful initiative for young entrepreneurs, it's her opportunity to be able to achieve her dreams, such as having a store.

She started selling on foot with her mother when she was 15.  She acquired experience and went out on her own when she was 17.  Today she has a lot of customers.  To satisfy the demand she needs a loan, which will help her have her own business and not sell on foot, because this is how she supports her studies.

She's a young woman with a broad vision, sure of what she wants and with a great desire to grow.  She's responsible, honest, and very hardworking.  She needs a loan to invest and stock her business to earn her own income.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, jewelry, and appliances

loans.name: Las Lomas De San Juan Group

texts.es: Elva de 41 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos aún dependientes, ella es integrante del grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan” conformada por 10 socios empeñosos que han demostrado ser responsables. Elva es la que preside al grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas, la cual lo realiza a repartos. Con el crédito anterior pudo implementar su negocio. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros productos. El deseo de Elva es de poner su restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Las Lomas De San Juan” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Elva se encuentra en la parte posterior es la tercera del lado izquierdo y chompa a rayas.
texts.en: Elva, 41, is married and has 2 children who are still dependents.  She is a member of the communal bank "Las Lomas De San Juan."  This group has 10 hardworking members who have shown themselves to be responsible.  Elva is the leader of the group, a role that she carries out with responsibility.  She now has a business selling food which she delivers to her customers.  With the last loan, she was able to set up her business.  This loan will be used to buy supplies, such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other products.  Elva wants to start up a restaurant, because this way she is sure that she would have greater earnings.    The communal bank "Las Lomas De San Juan" is grateful for the loan that is being provided to them, and they promise to continue to work hard.  In the picture, Elva is the third from the left in the back, wearing the striped sweater.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and milk

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, to apply for a loan of SLL 10,500,000.00 for the entire team in order to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for taking the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Abu Bakarr is the name of the featured leader of this team. A native of Freetown, the 45-year-old is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 school aged kids. Abu Bakarr has been a school teacher for many years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron corrugated sheets for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron and corrugated sheets for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Kisanga K Group

texts.en:
SALMA who is in her mid 30s is a divorcee with three children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for one and a half years now.  She works from 6.00 pm to 10.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be SALMA's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the capital so she could restock the missing items in her food store. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to cover household expenses and pay school fees. She will use this loan to buy more food to sell to more customers. She dreams of owning a Hotel.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group "KISANGA K" which has twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to more customers.
